ownerResponse/text:
If there were any short comings at the Chalet may we apologize for the inconvenience you seem to have undergone at the chalet.

We own few properties. All have highly trained domestic  and  maintenance  staff  who  maintain it throughout the year. 

This is the first time we had guests who did not wish any staff at the Chalet  during their stay.  I admit the staff have not followed instructions but entered the property to clean the chalet, pool and garden which annoyed our guests. Thereafter staff was given strict instructions not to enter the property.  The Chalet has a staff entrance at the back of the property but the manager uses the main entrance to meet the clients.

In the tropics close to the beach homes have to be cleaned and maintained on a daily basic due to humidity, dust and the  salt in the sea breeze.

Pool is cleaned between 5.30 am - 7 am and treated in the nights to prevent water changing colour and moss building in the cemented pool.Since staff were instructed not to enter the property the pool maintain was was neglected. When pool is not treated on a daily basis it complicates the maintenance.

Since the clients wanted a refund.  We were prepared to give it to them, but clients did not want to leave the chalet.  

On hearing of their complaint I  met clients the following day. ( owner lives in Colombo)

All bedroom windows have glass as the bedrooms are air conditioned. the staff would not dare to put newspapers on the windows. All windows have wooden panels, if clients wanted blinds on the top glass our seamstress available 24 hours would have stitched the blinds within 2 hours.

We have a standby electrician in the village who attends to short comings within the day.  When there is NO sunlight the solar power works on electricity..

The Chalet has  4G dialog connection. Sometimes signals could be low due to bad weather.

I admit our staff at the Chalet has a limited knowledge of English. The houseboy is in his 20's, we give young staff opportunities at our properties.

The manager is quite fluent in English, he is on call from 7 am to 8.30 pm and meets guests on a daily basis to check regarding their meal request, tours and to attend to any short comings.

We do not provide  mobile phones. But on clients insistence,  the manager  provided a mobile phone with Rs. 1000/- reload. for their use.

We went the extra mile to make the stay of our clients memorable and sorry that the clients did not appreciate the complimentaries which was offered, which we do to all our guests.
We once again apologize for any short comings faced by our guests.
placeInfo/address: Matara Road Kathaluwa, Ahangama 80650 Sri Lanka
text:
The Chalet. A truly awful experience. 

We had booked one week here after an idyllic week at another villa nearer Galle which cost $250 per day. The Chalet was $400 per day (Peak Christmas period) so we expected something pretty good. Arrived to find the Chalet, filthy, broken and totally unprepared for guests.

We spent the WHOLE of the first day and much of the second day getting more and more frustrated and angry as our holiday was being used up getting the villa we were paying $400 a night for to be cleaned and fixed by slow, rude and unhelpful staff. 
On day 5 of 7 we asked the owner Sonali Gunaratne for a refund for  the lost days but she suggested we just "check out and find somewhere else". So Sonali, we said to you we would do this and just so no-one else has to go through what we went through, here we go....

KITCHEN. Absolutely disgusting. Sorry no pictures of this, was too shocked. Dirty one and half year old newspapers covering grimy glasses and dirty toaster. Fridge full of ants, so couldn't use it. Rubbish and bottles from previous people still piled up by dirty old bin. More grimy cutlery, crockery and utensils stored in a dirty store room full of old boxes and general rubbish.

BATHROOM. Hot water system is a combination of solar and electric. Electric system didn't work so during 4 days of rain had to wash and shower in cold water despite constant pleas to have it fixed, and being told it will be. It took 5 days to be repaired. FIVE DAYS!! No glass in upper windows so mosquitos fly straight in.

BEDROOM. Ceiling fan was stuck on super fast turbo. Impossible to sleep with noise. Took days to have fixed. Bed sheets were old and torn. No mattress cover so very unhygienic. No curtains, just shutters covering lower window so the morning sun blasts straight in. Had to ask for a covering...so they sellotaped newspapers over the windows. 
There are no wardrobes or drawers for clothes, just a couple of tables and a hanging rack.
Had to ask for clothes hangers.
Half the light bulbs in the bedroom and villa were broken and had to be replaced.
We asked for a mosquito net as soon as we arrived. Mosquitos are rampant. This was met with complete bewilderment. Why would anyone want a mosquito net?  2 days later it grudgingly arrived.

POOL. Dirty. Unswimmable. Green mould and algae on bottom of pool. Pool pump to circulate the water didn't work. Despite constant pleas to fix it and being told every day that it would be, we left a week later and it still was broken. Spent hours with manager pointing at the filth while he said it "would be fixed"
So we didn't swim.

WiFi: Waited 2 days for it to be "mended".

STAFF: Pretty much non-English speaking staff. I have to remind you that this is a $400 a night villa.
The villa manager Gamine had quite an attitude about him and is inefficient and slow, seemingly bewildered with the concept of fixing things. He suggested we ring him on our own phones with international calling costs if we needed to call him. He eventually lent us a mobile phone with a few rupees on it. Good for 2 calls. Took a day for him to put more credit on it.
Upal, who seems to spend most of his time at South Point Villa across the road, was unhelpful to the point of rudeness. 
The pair of them could not comprehend that they should have sorted ALL of this before we arrived. They're totally untrained to provide the service that is expected for the price they're charging and totally unsuited to the hospitality business. The houseboy Shanti was charming and but only did what the others told him. 
All 3 of them would wander into the villa area at any time of day unannounced from any of the 3 gates.
The gardener would wake us up sweeping at 7.00am. Had to ask him  to stop.

THE OWNER. Sonali Gunaratne. Based in Colombo 2.5 hours away. We rang her and emailed her about the problems. She didn't really want to know. She eventually visited and saw for herself, saying it wasn't obviously good enough. But then she disappeared back to the city and as our problems continued she ignored our calls and emails. She has taken the money and run.
Take my advice and don't touch this place with a barge pole.
title: The Chalet. Just don't.

ownerResponse/text: We are taken aback about the comments made by this client. The feedback from the actual client who booked the property was positive and no complaint was made about the billing at anytime. The bills were checked and signed daily by the clients. The transport price was agreed  and accepted by the complainant before it was arranged. Before responding to this complaint, we rechecked with the party who booked the property and she was unaware of any problem regarding  billing. The villa is not runned on the basis of extracting money from any guests. All prices are clearly indicated. We ensure there are No  unpleasant surprises and would go an extra mile to make the stay memorable for our guests. Although the villa is recommended only for 6 + 2 children there were more and we are unaware how the bill was split. Whiles admitting there is a deck. No railings have been built because it obstructs the view. Parents with young children may asked the staff to supervise  or we can provide a full time child minder. All websites have clear pictures of the deck and veranda.  A part of the feed backl from our guest who confirmed this booking states  “We will certainly recommend the villa - we had a lovely time and look forward to coming back.” .
placeInfo/address: Matara Road Kathaluwa, Ahangama 80650 Sri Lanka
text: The overwhelming impression I got  was that management was keen to extract as much money from us as possible.  On top of the nightly rent, which worked out to $200 a night per couple for 3 rooms, we were then hit with high charges for food(which was excellently prepared, by the way). For a three night stay, including transport back to Colombo, my husband and I spent $1,000 and there wasn't even a wardrobe in our room.  A warning for those with young children. there are  hazards in the form of sharp drops as there are no railings on the high deck.
title: Very overpriced. For $600 a night I expect hanging space for my clothes."

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback. We appreciate all comments, as they help us strive for excellence in guest satisfaction.

While we deeply regret any inconveniences you encountered during your recent visit, we would like to provide clarification regarding the usage of facilities. Jetwing Kandy Gallery, being a boutique luxury property with 26 meticulously designed rooms, is curated to offer an exclusive and tranquil retreat for our in-house guests at all times. To preserve the serene and intimate ambiance, we have a policy that restricts access to the pool for visitors not currently staying with us in-house. 

We apologize if this policy was not communicated to you beforehand. We understand your disappointment, but we must uphold our commitment to ensuring the privacy and comfort of our valued guests.

Should you choose to stay with us in the future, we would be delighted to extend our warm hospitality to you.

Thank you once again for your feedback.

Harin Cooray
Manager Operations
placeInfo/address: De Soysa Estate, Gurudeniya 20189 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Jetwing Kandy Gallery, A Luxury Reserve
text:
My experience at Jetwing Gallery Kandy was thoroughly disappointing. The welcome was lackluster, with staff appearing surprised to have us, and there wasn't even a welcome drink. The entire setup felt rigid, and despite being in a perfect location, the service was horrendous. The potential of the place is overshadowed by poor management.

Having visited various Jetwing locations, including Yala, Blue, Beach, Sands, and St. Andrews, I've never encountered worse customer service. The refusal to let us use the pool without booking a room added to the frustration. Attempting to discuss this with the general manager proved futile, as he claimed to be too busy, reflecting a disappointing management style that seems to permeate the entire organization.

It's disheartening to witness such a gem of a location tarnished by Jetwing Gallery Kandy's subpar standards. Urgent changes in top management or comprehensive training are imperative for this establishment to meet the high standards associated with the Jetwing brand. We ultimately left for Earls Regency, where the service contrast was strikingly superior. Despite its scenic beauty, Jetwing Gallery Kandy falls short in delivering the hospitality Sri Lanka is renowned for, especially in a culturally rich city like Kandy.
title: Gem of a location with immense potential

placeInfo/address: De Soysa Estate, Gurudeniya 20189 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Jetwing Kandy Gallery, A Luxury Reserve
text:
They follow some absolutely ridicules "butler service" system where basically you're FORCED to eat what they give you and not complain. Plus its VERY small portions; and they are clearly cost cutting. I've been to many Sri Lankan hotels, but this was the first time I've ever experienced a hotel like this where there is NO buffet or ala-carte option; and you just get a set menu with very limited/if any choices and you can only select ONE main course. 

Even then, you cannot mix and match western and eastern styled breakfasts for instance (which would possible obviously in a buffet system). I for one, really like to eat scrambled eggs and bacon but I also liked to try out the fish or chicken curry to sprinkle a bit of gravy on the scrambled egg; but no, even THIS was not allowed by the "rules" cause I ordered the scrambled eggs dish which fell under one portion; and I had to specifically request even a small gravy potion. I mean... this level of organizational rigidness at this place just blew my mind.

The QUALITY of the small portions was not good either; "lemongrass soup" was like as if someone boiled grass with salt water; absolutely tasteless,  a "Seafood noodles" dish had only two prawns in a small bowl-like plate,"baked beans" was not the normal long grain beans but some small local one, the list goes on. This is just not a professionally trained F&B service.

it just didn't feel like freedom here; it feels like compulsion. You feel like going for a swim and you're hungry after... there's no pool bar to grab a sandwich or anything. 

Overall, felt like we were in some kind of strict boarding school or rehab clinic and not a hotel. 

The rooms and washroom and the physical environment in general look ultra modern and sophisticated, which  is good for a new ish hotel; but that's about the only plus for me. 

If you're someone who likes the outdoors and just doesn't care about food (strange as it is), then you'll love it here but not my cup of tea for sure. Will not book again knowing what I know now.
title: Not for a foodie traveler. No freedom of choice.

text:
We had a mid stop at Kandy on our way to Dickoya. We stayed two nights and we travelled with another couple. 

Good: beautiful location, nice rooms but small property. 

Bad: Food was below expectations. We have had quiet a few bad experience with Jetwing food and this was worse. Portion size were extremely small and taste was average. Set menu and limited options. Not sure if the discounted prices are covered through the low quality food. 

Overall: Not a repeat stay.

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Ashani,

Warm greetings from Crystal Sands! 

We are very sorry to hear that you did not have a great experience at Crystal Sands. This is the first TripAdvisor review we have received that is under 4 stars following our opening last year, and we take your input very seriously. We strive to provide our guests with an unparalleled experience, and we are truly sorry that yours has not been a positive one.

With regards to the images, the pictures shared are actual images of the hotel and the Sky Villas. Our starting category of Sky Villa, the Palm Sky Villa is 850sqft and the categories that follow, the Sands Sky Villa and Surf Sky Villa are 1050sqft, 1456sqft respectively and our Presidential Sky Villa is 3983sqft. All these units offer a minimum of 2 bedrooms, an indoor living space and a balcony with a plunge pool. As for the mirror while all the washrooms come with mirrors, unfortunately we do not have full length mirrors in any of our Sky Villas other than the Presidential Sky Villa. 

We are sorry to hear that you found the food to be overpriced and portions to be small. Many of our guests have consistently given us raving reviews about our food and portion sizes, with some guests also noting that pricing is competitive, compared to similar restaurants and cafes in the nearby areas of Hikkaduwa and Galle. Nevertheless, your concerns have been noted and we have flagged this to our Chef for him to look into it as well. 

When it comes to the rooftop pool area, we are sorry that you felt that the area was smaller than advertised. We can confirm that the images we have used in all our marketing are actual images of the property with no enhancements to the proportions. This is visibly evident from posts shared by our guests as well. Our poolside and deck area has been used many times for private events of 30 – 50 people.

The access to the rooftop pool is indeed through the inner deck and restaurant area. However, we do have changing rooms available by the side of the pool showers directly facing the entrance of the pool, for any guests who would like to dry up and change prior to returning to their Sky Villa.

We were surprised to hear about the odor in the room and necessary steps were taken to give you a change of room. After further inquiry into this matter, we have identified that this is an isolated incident relating to that specific room and we have temporarily placed this room out of order until the issue has been fixed. 

On behalf of the team, we would like to apologize for any service delays you have experienced during your stay. We take this very seriously and we have raised this to the senior hotel management in order to take necessary steps to ensure this does not happen again. We are delighted to hear that you were happy with Sajith’s service. We will most definitely pass on your comments to him. 

We believe our team has been in touch with you today and we hope we will have the opportunity to make it up you soon! 

Warm Regards, 
Crystal Sands Team
text: Visited this place recently and i am utterly disappointed. The place does not look at all like the pictures they advertised. The entire villa was very small you barely have room inside the bathroom to move. There is no proper long mirror to look at yourself after you get dressed. Food was way overpriced and the portions were very small. Pool area they advertise as if it was a huge area but don’t be fooled by their pictures. Barely 10 people can move around that area. After getting down from the pool we have to walk with our wet clothes through the restaurant to get in to the elevator. Such unprofessional. Only plus thing was the service given by Sajith at the restaurant. The front office and housekeeping staff were not trained properly and they did not have a clue on customer service. I had to call many times to get things done. We were initially put to a room where the bathroom had a bad odor. The i had to call the front office staff and blast at them to get a room change. Please do not visit this horrible place. You can’t even have a swim at the beach because it’s rough. Worst stay i had.
title: Smelly bathrooms and overpriced food

ownerResponse/text:
Hello Anuradha, 

Thank you for having selected to stay at Water Garden Sigiriya. I am writing to express our sincere apologies for the disappointing experience you encountered during your recent stay with us, particularly on what should have been a memorable evening for your honeymoon celebration. We deeply regret the inconvenience caused by a group of guests who had booked multiple villas under our credit card promotion offer. While we strive to treat all guests fairly, we acknowledge that the behavior of this particular group fell short of our usual standards. We understand that the short duration of the noise disturbance affected your romantic dinner celebration and for that we offer our heartfelt apologies.

The party in question had booked 5 villas using the credit card promotion offer that was introduced in September. As an ethical hotel operator we do not discriminate customers who want to book and stay with us, yet I strongly agree with you that the caliber and some behaviours demonstrated by the group in question do not reflect the usual clientele that the hotel attracts. They were informed twice by Duminda, our Restaurant Manager to turn the music down and as they did not pay heed to his request, he called me to assist. 
I immediately went to the poolside and observed that while the majority of the party were in the pool, a few of them were having a drink by the pool bar area. There was a blue tooth speaker which they had brought along and some Sinhala music (not karaoke) was being played. I immediately informed them that we normally do not allow for such activities to be conducted on our premises and asked for the music to be turned down very low. The group were not pleased with my request but did comply. I also asked them to move the direction of the speaker to face the opposite direction (away from pool) and ensured that the music was turned down low. I went back to the restaurant entrance to check if the sound of the music was low and it was. I continued to stay around the pool bar area for app 30 minutes to ensure that they did not turn the volume up again. It needs to be noted that almost all Sri Lankan guests do enjoy using the pool after sunset hours, hence we are flexible with our pool usage hours for all our resident guests as we do not entertain non-resident guests for reasons of privacy and safety. However, I do agree that in these instances we need to be more mindful of the impact on honeymoon couples like yourselves and other inhouse guests dining by the poolside. 
 
I also wish to take this opportunity to assure you and all others that the group involved was not comprised of friends or acquaintances of either mine or any member of the management team of the hotel. We treat all guests equally and do not offer preferential treatment to anyone.  With regard to the steam and sauna facilities, we understand your surprise about the additional charge. We usually do not charge if the said facilities are used in conjunction with a treatment and my apologies that this policy may differ from what you have experienced elsewhere. However, we appreciate your feedback and will consider reviewing this policy in the future.

Once again, we sincerely apologize for failing to meet your expectations during what should have been a joyous occasion. Your feedback is invaluable to us, and we will take immediate action to prevent such incidents in the future.

We hope you will give us another opportunity to serve you better and create unforgettable memories during your stay with us. Please do not hesitate to contact me personally if you need anything further.

Congratulations once again on your marriage, and we wish you many years of happiness together.

Sincerely 
David de Silva
General Manager
text:
We were there for our honeymoon,during which there was card promotion that had attracted some hooligans who played loud music in public areas and not behaving appropriately . The management did not do anything about it despite the several times  I complained to the staff that it’s interrupting my fist dinner after I got married  since these hooligans were having a loud karaoke session near the main pool using their own Speaker . My table was set up near the pool . It was very surprising as to why the hotel even allowed the usage of the pool to these hooligans at night after closing hours. It came to my understanding the above group was known to the general manager of the hotel hence a special allowance for his friends were given to behave in such a manner regardless the disturbance caused to other inhouse guests.

The service is stiff . We need to pay additionaly 10,000 rupees in order to use the steam and sauna to my suprise this is not the case in any hotel I go in the world  . The standards have dropped a lot since 2017 when I first visited there. I will not recommend anyone to go to water  garden Sigiriya .
title: Terrible honeymoon experience at water garden sigiriya

text:
The room was too big even for a family with 2 kids and was not "warmly" designed. It seems that all  the rooms have the same  size.The resort as a whole was  too spacious also in the sense of too long walks to get to the pool/restaurant area. Food was mediocre in general, but the soup tasted like it was made of powder rather then "real" ingredients and the pizza is avoidable .The big size also reflected on the distance between staff and guests which was also methaphorically remoted.
The crocodile, peacock  and the view of the rock were impressive though but could not cover the more important issues. 
An expensive resort and not at all value for money.
title: Too big to be true

ownerResponse/text:
Dear 41Chamindas, 
We at Water Garden Sigiriya were taken completely by surprise with your recent review posted on our site. 
We can only surmise that you have posted your review on our hotel site by mistake instead of the many other hotels whose name contains Water. (ex Water Haven, Water Villa etc)  
All the facts stated in your review does not fit with our hotel operations, facilities and services. I give below the reasons based on your review  

1. Our owner does not contact Guests directly as he owns several hotels (Unlike owner operated small hotels)
2. We checked our Agoda bookings and have no trace of a booking made by you
3. Our phone answering staff are not harsh and arrogant as evidenced by the many 5 star reviews on TripAdvisor
4. Our hotel is easily accessible with the signage placed at important junctions / locations on the road
5. 24th to 26th December we were not full due to the Easter attacks. We did not turn away anyone wanting a room. Many hotels in the area also had free rooms. 
6. We do not have lavatory pits as stated in your review but have a waste water treatment plant to deal with the effluent
7. We do not arbitrarily cancel bookings made by Guests which explains our excellent reputation and high ratings.

In the above light we kindly request you to post your critical review on the correct hotel site that is responsible for the unprofessional acts. Please remove the incorrect post from our site that will mislead future travellers.

If you still maintain that it is indeed Water Garden Sigiriya, we have to question your bona fides and conclude that you are acting on behalf of industry competition to tarnish the excellent 5 star reputation built up on TripAdvisor. 

We have over one hundred and fifty 5 star ratings and only six 4 star ratings during the entire year in 2019. Thank You
text:
Disgusting attitude of the owner.
i booked one double room for two nights from 24th Dec to 26th Dec 2019 on HB basis by #agoda.com and i received the confirmation mail too. Then i phoned to the property and thir immediate response was harsh and arrogant. 
However on 24th afternoon i went to the Sigiriya from Galle ( around 300km and 7 hours drive ) with my wife and phoned the hotel to get the direction he said he cancelled the booking. I was so helpless becouse all the hotels of the area was fuuly booked becoz its Christmas eve. The only reason he game me was an elephant damaged the lavotory pit and he has send me an email but i didnt received any. at least he should have been kind enough to gime me call to say that he cancelled my booking rather than stay quite fir three weeks. 
finally I had to drive anuradapura (another 80km ) to fine a hotel and the owner did not worry to say sorry atleast.

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Mr Kiran Atapattu,

We refer to your recent review giving us a one star rating and wish to respond to some of the comments made.
 
At the outset we wish to highlight that you have not made any negative remarks on the villa the food or service or any other aspect of the Hotel. We are glad that the primary services of our hotel have not been negative. I also recall that during the many conversations I had with you during the stay right up to the time of departure you were complimenting every aspect of the Hotel and the services of the staff highly, even naming a few of the top performers. The Guest Relations staff and others also remarked that you were full of praise.  I was therefore rather surprised at the one star rating review that is contrary to the views expressed during your stay. 

Regarding your primary complaint about the weather you will no doubt agree that the weather is a factor beyond anyone’s control. Our Sales department updated you that the weather is gloomy upon your inquiry just before the visit. Further we were fully booked on the weekend of 14th December. Apart from that weekend we could have changed your visit to any other day of your choice. Having decided on the two days convenient to you, it seems unfair to blame the hotel merely for the inconvenience caused by rain. If there were any shortcoming on the food or the service or room cleaning we would be found wanting. In the above backdrop we wish to respectfully disagree with your rating of one star. May we also highlight that we have received over one hundred 5 star reviews this year and have received only six 4 star reviews within the entire year. We do not have any reviews below 4 star levels. Your review is the solitary one star review. We urge you to reconsider your rating in a fair manner based on matters within our control. 
The Security officers have warned the kids not to get into the lakes as they are muddy and are meant for lotus flowers and anyone getting in could easily get stuck in the mud. Additionally there are several swimming pools including the main Pool and private plunge pools like the one in your villa where resident guests can swim.
text: I was not going to write a review but as Mr Suraj Perera sent me an email requesting for a review I pen down my feelings.The reservation was made by me approximately four months ago on 20th September and advance payment by cash. As my family lives on just 60 kilometres from your Hotel and as the weather was very cloudy the day we were leaving 9th of December for your hotel and as the weather forecast predicted rain clouds and temperature at 24° in Sigiriya , I telephoned your Sales Team Mr Dilan Morais and conveyed to him the weather looks bad and he replied by saying that he will check with the Hotel and come back to me,which he did so in a few minutes by saying "it is gloomy". As rain was predicted I requested him to shift my reservation forward but he replied by saying that the property is full with a Corporate outing over the weekend and conveyed  that the change  was not possible and for him the just 20 persons were more important to him than the Customer who had paid and made the reservation approximately four months before. Having no other option we proceeded to the Hotel and were greeted by overcast skies and the kids opted only for the plunge Pool in the Villa. The second day 10th December was a Total Disaster with  heavy rains from 2 AM in the Morning upto 3 PM in the afternoon and and the kids having a miserable day being confined to the rooms decided to jump into the main pool in the drizzle around 4 PM for about 30 minutes. The next day 11th December in the Morning just before breakfast when the entire family including  the  kids took a walk round the hotel and when all of us approached  a lake with flowing water just near the main entrance adjacent to the Security Point the  kids asked the two Security Officers if they could jump into the water but the two Security Officers loudly shouted back by saying "don't don't there are three Crocodiles inside which was conveyed by me on checking out to Mr Jan and Mr Suraj Perera as well.  All these made things very unhappy to us at the end despite having great expectations from September. All above are true and honest feelings and not written with any malice or anger or  to bring disrepute to WATER GARDENS
title: LEFT WITH A HEAVY HEART

ownerResponse/text:
We do regret that your stay with us was not as we would have wished it to be however your review leaves us concerned as it's riddled with  inaccuracies.

The statement that the management was not helpful is inaccurate, we did conduct a detailed investigation which included searches & you were appraised of the steps taken, the fact that the investigation did not have conclusive evidence that money was stolen was something you were not willing to accept as such we suggested that we inform the police to conduct investigations which they did.

The verbal complaint made to us & your statement that all your bags & suitcases were searched is contradictory. What was informed to the resort was that your suspicion was based on the fact that a bag was  found in a different location from the location that it was originally placed in, our investigation too ascertained this, it was done for reasons of neatness when the room was cleaned.

The statement that we were neither apologetic or concerned is not right, in every instance when we tried to explain you refused to listen & responded with veiled threats that you would inform our other guests if we took no action which you went ahead & did. 
What was the action you expected, did you want us to give you the few currency notes that you reported missing when there was no conclusive evidence that the money was stolen.
If we had given you the money as you probably expected  it would have amounted to us accepting that it was indeed stolen without any conclusive proof to corroborate it.

Your review states that money & valuables were found missing, in your complaint made to us & statements made to the police you stated that  currency notes amounting to 
150 Euro & approximately US $ 240 were only  found missing.

What also leaves us puzzled is why you did not leave your money in the safe provided in the villa. It is a commonly known fact to any traveller to deposit valuables in the safe provided in the accommodation, further when any of our guest are escorted to their villas the safe is pointed out & it's operating instructions clearly explained, this is in addition to the comment on the registration form which you sign on arrival which has a clear comment to deposit your valuables & money in the safe 
If the case was that money deposited in a safe was missing, then there is no question that the resort is liable, which was not so in this instance.

In our two plus years of being in operation this is the first time an allegation of this nature has been levelled at us & we are extremely concerned.

We would be thankful if you could review if the few currency notes reported missing were spent or kept elsewhere.
text: Dont be deceived by the beautiful exterior. We spent 3 nights here, in three different villas. On the second day we came back after a full day of excursions and found that people had been going through our bags and suitcases. Besides feeling upset that this had happened, we also found that in two rooms valuable items and money were missing. We immediately notified the manager. The doors were not forged so we asked them to question the staff. The management was not helpful at all and told us to take it up with the local police. They did not even apologize. Or offer any solution. I would definitely not recommend staying at this hotel. After the incident we did not feel safe or at ease at the Water garden hotel. We left with bad memories.
title: Money stolen from the rooms.

ownerResponse/text:
Whilst being glad that your experience at the resort on your honeymoon was positive we are dismayed on your comment of our staff not paying attention to you & speaking only to your husband.
The sentiment & all it implies is extremely offensive & prejudiced, it leaves us perplexed as to the reasons & motive for the sentiment expressed approximately five months after your stay with us.
Based on details provided in the review the period of the stay was in August & the review is posted in mid January.
 
Further there is also a strong possibility of respect & deference having been misunderstood as a lack of respect. In local culture & specifically when our staff are from rural backgrounds values of respect are instilled in them, a male directly addressing a lady in the presence of her partner is considered impolite & disrespectful & more so pertinent when it is a young honeymoon couple.
text: My husband and I visited Water Garden Sigiriya on our honeymoon, and our experience was positive apart from one major problem: some of the (virtually all male) staff's lack of respect for women. I have travelled widely throughout South Asia, and have never experienced such unequal treatment in a luxury hotel setting before. Some staff members spoke only to my husband (even when I interjected), acting as though I did not exist. They posed questions about our stay only to him, and barely looked at me when I offered an answer. This caused significant offense and tension throughout our stay. We would not return because of this. And we did not experience this type of issue during the rest of our time in Sri Lanka. The hotel should train its staff better in this regard. Otherwise, the amenities and nearby attractions were excellent. The food was decent, but not great.
title: Lack of respect for women

ownerResponse/text:
We are glad that some aspects of your stay with us was to your satisfaction but concerned about the veracity of some of your observations & the rationale behind your low rating. In the 18 months of our existence this is the only comment we have received with such a low rating which has all of us completely baffled.
The road that leads to the resort is a jungle dirt track which is not paved & very much a part of the natural environment & one cannot expect the road surface of a highway. Does one complain so badly when using a dirt road on a safari ride???
On food there is obviously a difference of opinion between the comments in the review & the extremely positive sentiments expressed on food by over 158 reviews on this forum which leaves us puzzled about the motive of this comment.
We do regret the aspect in relation to the service of wine which has been investigated in detail & addressed, but still feel that isolated incidents like this can happen in any 5 star hotel anywhere in the world and must be looked upon with compassion and understanding.
text: We stayed here 3 nights as part of a 7 day Sri Lanka tour. The view from the location is nice, there is a long clay path with a view of the Sigiriya rock. The rooms were nice and large and comfortable. The downside to the place is the lack of responsibility with all the hotels on the road, they need to all join together and make the road more accessible, the pot holes were really bad. The food was mediocre at best, we tried both western and Sri Lankan, the Sri Lanken being the better of the two.The waiters were all nice, but they weren't trained, we ordered Prosecco twice, both times they didn't know how to open the bottle sending the cork flying and spilling the prosecco, and both times it was room temp, we had to leave it in the ice bucket to chill it, so when your charging R9000 a bottle the
title: Underwhelmed

roomTip: Great buffet but that was all that we enjoyed.
text: This hotel is all show, for such a big hotel with plenty of staff, we arrived late in the afternoon very tried from a long drive but our room was not ready.   There were 3 of us and we were booked into  a triple premium room but it was only a double with no other bed, which they had not got ready, the room was only made up for 2 people.  Two towels, two cups.   We wanted to just freshen up and go out for dinner, but we could not go as our room was not ready they attended to this.  Also there was stale food left in the fridge.   Overall not impressed.  This hotel is all show.   Good for the sporting groups, or conference groups and they probably get more attention but for the lone family travellers they are not important I felt.   Such a big hotel not for me.  Will not be going there again.  The only thing going for it is the location, but there are many hotels along the same route maybe I will try one of the others next time!

text:
If you’re looking for a restful night before a long journey, DO NOT book this hotel.

After a four-hour journey to Colombo, we decided to treat ourselves to a 5-star experience for our final night before flying to Singapore early the next morning. Wanting a peaceful stay, we specifically requested a quiet room at check-in.

Despite this, we were placed on the 5th floor, where we were kept awake all night due to a loud party or exhibition happening in the hotel. The noise was unbearable, and we barely slept. This was extremely disappointing, especially given that this is supposed to be a luxury hotel.

When we brought this to the attention of the manager, the response was shockingly poor. Instead of any meaningful apology or solution, he offered us free pastries on our way to the airport—hardly adequate compensation for a ruined night’s sleep.

For the price and reputation of this hotel, we expected much better. If you actually want a peaceful and relaxing stay, I’d highly recommend looking elsewhere. This was not a 5-star experience.
title: DO NOT BOOK IF YOU WANT PEACEFUL SLEEP

roomTip: Бронируйте заранее и договаривайтесь заранее
text: Скажу сразу, волею нашего Аэрофлота нас занесло в этот отель. Имеет он 5 звезд, но по мне так эти звезды только за то что это центр Коломбо и за окна во всю стену.  Заселились мы втроем, в номере кровать одна. Сразу спустилась на ресепшн объяснила на английском, что  хочу и почему.  Сказали принесут кровать. Сразу отмечу с английским у ребят не очень, половину слов недоговаривают, ударения невпопад, про русский вообще молчу. Поэтому сразу 2 человека на ресепшн пытались мне ответить, все закончилось моим повторением на английской и их ответами да или нет. Четыре раза ходила на ресепшн, чтобы попросить кровать в течении 5 часов. Создалось впечатление, что они и сами друг друга не понимают. Кровать принесли, поставили в проходе.  Номер небольшой,  мебель не новая, кран с горячей водой плохо открывался и закрывался, в номере ванна. 2 лифта с нерабочими кнопками, в одном не показывает на каком ты этаже. Доступная для прогулок территория маленькая: бассейн, огород, пруд с рыбками, ступеньки-водопад. Ели в ресторане plates вроде еды много, но не вкусная, по сравнению с нашим предыдущим отелем еда разочаровала, хотя повторю очень большое разнообразие есть крабы, мидии, роллы, проход в ресторан через огромный красивый приемный зал вниз по ступенькам без указателей. Пляж в 8 км от отеля, в 1,5 км от отеля городской парк с набережной. Напротив посо��ьства, где стоят люди с автоматами в камуфляже. Делясь впечатлениями с остальными поняла, что всех кого заселяли по трое заселяли с одной кроватью изначально. У кого-то не было полотенец в номере, также просили несколько раз на ресепшн. Был номер рядом где слетала дверь с петель. У нас и по крайней мере еще в одном номере размагничивались карточки-ключи. В баре через переводчик на телефоне на синегальском общение с проблемами. По выезду у нас был перенос трансфера,  с 8:30 до 9:30 никто ничего не сообщил, пошли по номерам с табличкой на английском уже около 9 часов. Информацию, которую не нашла на сайтах: ужин - с 7 часов, завтрак - с 6:30, обеда у нас не было не знаю.
title: Бизнесс отель

Your special mention of Sanath, is greatly appreciated. We will be sure to pass along your kind words to him, as we know he’ll be honoured to hear that his service made a lasting impression on your stay. Our team works hard to provide exceptional service, and it’s rewarding to know it contributed to your memorable experience.
Thank you for recommending us to others – it means the world to us! We look forward to welcoming you back for another wonderful stay in the future.

Ayubowan! (May you live long!)

Farrel Blom
Dpeuty General Manager
placeInfo/name: Jetwing Saman Villas, A Luxury Reserve
text: The location is outstanding. I have not seen a better beach resort than this. The ambience & view from the room are breath taking. The food (eventhough the choice is limited) is excellent. The service is so good, particularly that of our private butler SANATH. On the whole, we had a wonderful experience and would definitely recommed it to others
title: Wonderful Experience

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for sharing your valuable feedback with us on TripAdvisor. We are genuinely sorry to hear that your experience fell short of your expectations. Your comments are very important to us, and we have already taken steps to improve the juice served at breakfast with a new, better option. Regarding our pricing, we aim to offer fair rates that reflect both the quality of our services and product. If these concerns were brought to our attention during your stay, we would have been more than happy to assist you and make your stay as comfortable as possible by addressing them.
We truly appreciate your constructive feedback and look forward to the opportunity to provide you with a much better experience in the future.

Ayubowan! (May you live long!)

Farrel Blom
Deputy General Manager
placeInfo/name: Jetwing Saman Villas, A Luxury Reserve
roomTip: This destination, once a gem, is now a disappointment. While the wild beach location is stunning, the hotel is tired and overpriced. Everyth
text: This destination, once a gem, is now a disappointment. While the wild beach location is stunning, the hotel is tired and overpriced. Everything feels dictated by an accountant’s spreadsheet, focused on profit over quality. Even the juice is watered down—a symbol of their relentless cost-cutting. What could have been a premium experience is now an overpriced, mediocre offering. Avoid. Spend your money elsewhere.
title: Disappointing

placeInfo/name: Jetwing Saman Villas, A Luxury Reserve
roomTip: No es un hotel de playa
text: El hotel  para 5 estrellas normalito  no es un hotel de playa uno se aburre mucho los masajes son carisimos  mal caros cadi que europa  la comida bien pero normal para lo que cobran si q quieres un hotel de playa este hotel no es no queriamos ir a las maldivas por no coger mas aviones pero nos equivocamos
title: No nos gusto

placeInfo/name: Jetwing Saman Villas, A Luxury Reserve
text:
Nach einem Strandspaziergang wollten wir mit 7 Personen, davon 2 Kinder (7 und 9 Jahre) auf der Hotelterrasse etwas trinken. Der dortige Manager hat uns abgewiesen mit der Begründung "Children not allowed".
Das ist eine Frechheit!
Nie wieder Saman Villas.
title: Anti-Children

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for taking the time to review us following your recent stay with us. Please accept my sincere apologies on behalf of the team for the disappointing experience you encountered during your recent stay. Your feedback is incredibly important to us, and we regret that we fell short of meeting your expectations, especially during such a significant occasion as your honeymoon and your husband's birthday.

We understand your frustration regarding the delay in the check-in process. Please accept our apologies for any inconvenience caused by this delay. We want to clarify that the delay was due to the necessity to upgrade your booked category upon your request, which required some additional time to accommodate properly.

While we strive to maintain a pest-free environment, it's important to note that the presence of insects and mosquitoes is often inevitable in a tropical country like ours. However, please be assured that we have rigorous pest control measures in place to minimize their impact on our guests.

Additionally, we apologize for any miscommunication regarding the availability of an SUV for your transportation needs. While we had communicated the non-availability of an SUV, we did offer an alternative vehicle choice of a van. However, we understand that this alternative was not suitable for your requirements, and we regret any inconvenience this may have caused.
We truly appreciate your kind words about our hotel's view, it deeply saddens us to hear that the shortcomings in service overshadowed this aspect of your stay. Please know that we are committed to improving and providing the exceptional experience you deserve. Once again, we apologize for falling short of your expectations and for any inconvenience experienced during your stay. Your feedback is invaluable to us, and we will take immediate steps to address the issues you've raised to ensure a more seamless experience for our guests in the future.
 
Ayubowan 
(May you live long)
Wester Felthman
placeInfo/name: Jetwing Saman Villas, A Luxury Reserve
text:
First the welcoming was 0

They kept us waiting for 1 hour to choose the room

Very rude lady manager was so intense screaming at us in front of other visitors 

Too much mosquitoes and insects everywhere 

Very slow service, not good room cleaning 

Even the car we ordered to leave we asked for suv they said alright when we checked out they got us sedan without telling us !! We was looking for a comfortable car to travel to Colombo in and to fit our 5 luggage!!!!

The hotel view is nice  but there’s no use to come if the staff are like this!! 

It’s our honeymoon and my husband’s birthday too
We wanted to have a great time but unfortunately we didn’t

At check out they delayed us as well
They are not organized at all .
title: Didn’t like it

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Greetings from Jetwing Saman Villas!

Please accept my sincere apologies for the delay in arranging the refund to your account. While refunds do take a considerable amount of time to be processed and finalized, there had been a setback and a communication lapse that resulted in a delay in the process. Nonetheless, I can assure you that it is being worked on and will be resolved within the next few days.

Thank you for understanding, and we regret the inconvenience caused by this infrequent delay on our part.

I sincerely hope that this will not deter you from engaging with us in the future.

Ayubowan! (May you live long!)

Wester Felthman
General Manager
placeInfo/name: Jetwing Saman Villas, A Luxury Reserve
text:
Be careful when making a booking they do not refund your money. I made a booking in December fully refundable through booking.com
I then got a reply from hotel about the booking so I cancelled it on 13 December refund was due 12 to 14 working days . 19 January no refund received and though they assured me that it was processed they are now saying they have issued a Cheque  to local bank to start the process . Totally unacceptable
title: Beware when booking here

ownerResponse/text:
We thank the reviewer for booking 3 nights at Saman Villas. 

On the second day the reviewer wanted an early departure with a refund for the third night. In terms of the conditions of the reservation early cancellation is not permitted. The reviewer was visibly disappointed and we regret we could not waive cancellation charges. 

The reviewer’s main grievance as described in the review was “Beaches are not fit for swimming due to rough seas even though hotel promotes pristine beaches which misleads travelers”. It is true we have described the beach as “pristine” but that does not by any stretch of imagination describe the condition of the sea. Sea is dynamic and the condition varies with the weather. During the reviewers stay tourists were swimming in the sea on both sides of the hotel. 

Hotel website features the room exactly as is and without any exaggeration. This is the first occasion that any guest has complained that the photos appear better than the actual state of the room. The hotel is frequently renovated and well maintained. 

The reviewer booked on the hotel website where daily room rates are given for both high and low seasons. Reviewer was therefore aware that this was the high season in Sri Lanka and prices during this time are higher than the low season. Our high season prices are comparable to similar hotels.         

The reviewer has not been fair in rating the hotel “one bubble”.
placeInfo/name: Jetwing Saman Villas, A Luxury Reserve
text: Checked in yesterday for 3 nights. Great location, friendly staff, good food but very disappointing visit. Photos on hotel website too good for the actual state of the rooms. Hotel is a bit old and run down. Beaches are not fit for swimming due to rough seas even though hotel promotes pristine beaches which misleads travelers. Unable to cancel the last booked night. Way overrated and over priced for a missed beach vacation.
title: Beautiful location but very disappointing visit

ownerResponse/text:
We refer to the reviewers’ recent stay at Saman Villas

The hotel website clearly indicates that privacy may not be available in Deluxe Suites with Pools. The notice on the website reads as "The swimming pools are for private use for the occupants of the suites. Privacy of the swimming pools cannot be guaranteed as the swimming pools are out doors and may be seen by other guests. If you require a higher level of privacy and luxury we recommend that you book the Grand Deluxe Suite with Pool or for ultimate privacy and luxury the Saman Villa Suite with Pool"

Our suites are housed in 2 story villas with 2 suites to a villa. The images and description clearly describes that there are 2 suites to a villa. In view of low season the number of guests were very low. The reviewers main concern at the hotel was having to pay extra for a 3rd person and the hotel housing another guest in the suites above the reviewers suite. With occupancy being low we should not have allocated another guest on top of the reviewers suite and we deeply apologize for our insensitivity. It was by no means intentional.

We are surprised with the reviewers comments made about breakfast and in general about our food as almost every guest has praised the quality and standard of our food. The breakfast consists of a selection including Sri Lankan, Saman Villas Signature, American , Slim & Trim. There is a separate a la carte lunch and snack menu which offer a range of 60 menu Items. The a la carte dinner menu offers a selection of 56 menu items.  The extensive range of cuisine coupled with 5 private dining locations  offer our guests ample choice even though we only have one main restaurant.

Saman Villas cannot be compared to a 5 star hotel. Saman Villas is a 27 suite deluxe boutique resort & spa offering an authentic experience. To ensure a high level of service we maintain a high staff ratios with 4 staff per suite. Our service has been praised by many other guests on Trip Advisor. 
 

The reviewer has failed to understand the concept of the hotel prior to making the booking. Had the reviewer visited the website and understood the concept, the  reviewer would have opted to choose another hotel. 

Sampath De Silva – General Manager .
placeInfo/name: Jetwing Saman Villas, A Luxury Reserve
text:
NO PRIVACY for all private pools Villas, each villa has another villa on top of it looking directly at your pool. Pictures are deceiving they don't show the villa on top of you. Little Privacy only from left and right villas
BREAKFAST is below average
Unprofessional (Disrespectful) ground floor manager
OVERPRICED as sea view was ok in comparison with other hotels with sea view in Sri Lanka or other countries we visited such as Thailand, Bali etc
DINE in Resturant below average only one option is available, other five star hotels in the same area provides wider varietes and far much better tasty food
This is a boutique villas with an average service that is not good for money 

For the price you are paying it's not worth it. I highly recommend to check other hotels.
title: Disrespectful management

ownerResponse/text:
We refer to the reviewers false allegation made on TripAdvisor about the experience encountered at Saman Villas. We have already reported this issue to TripAdvisor as the false accusations are damaging.

Hotel has a very strict child policy where children below 10 years are not allowed due to safety and privacy reasons. This restriction is clearly and prominently mentioned in the hotels website as well as on online booking engines. Potential guests are not able to book a 3rd person/ child in any of the suites as the system will not process the reservation. Reviewer had made the booking via Expedia for two adults without mentioning a 3rd person. Upon arrival the hotel had to decline check-in. The agitated reviewer was not willing to respect the hotel policy and stated that Expedia website did not have a child policy displayed on their site. The hotel showed the child policy displayed on the Expedia site and also showed that Expedia had disabled the reservation function where booking a 3rd person/child could not be booked. Reviewer was not willing to accept the hotel policy and demanded check-in. The General Manager had also explained same to the guest. 

Reviewer had reserved for 2 nights and based on the hotels cancellation policy, hotel has the right to charge both nights. As a goodwill gesture the hotel offered to wave 50% of cancellation fees. Reviewer demanded for a full refund and started verbally abusing the staff for not letting him check-in. The Front Office Manager did not assault or even verbally abuse the reviewer, but only pleaded the reviewer to calm down. It was the Front Office Manager who helped the reviewer to find an alternate hotel. The reviewer was not willing to claim down and continued verbally abusing the  Front Office Manager and the rest of the staff. The  reviewer was uncontrollable and started shouting in abusive language using profanity and walking around public areas. We were compelled to ask the reviewer to leave the premises due to his indecent behavior.

The child policy was implemented in  2005  and in the recent past we have had only a few experiences , where guests arrive with children below 10 years. In these instances guests have understood and respected the policy.
placeInfo/name: Jetwing Saman Villas, A Luxury Reserve
text: Well, I had the most insane experience at the Saman Villas.  I booked a hotel room three weeks ago and as soon as i Reached the hotel, I was told kids were not allowed and could not check in.  The front desk manager (Amithe) consistency kept telling me its not his fault and I need to go to another hotel. Long story short, I agreed to go to another hotel and they even booked me into another hotel (which I was going to pay for).  then as I was leaving, I told them that how will I get the refund and they were very clear that they will not refund my money..At that point I was shocked, I said either you refund the money or you let me check in and very categorically they said no we will not do either or.  Then I asked them to give this to me in writing so atleast I had some proof and could take it up at a later stage, the blatantly refused.  Then so as no to loose approximately USD 800 I attempted to take a video of the manager, telling him that I need some evidence of this matter at which point Amithe assaulted me and threatened me that this is not India and is Sri Lanka.  Fearing for my life and my wifes and childs life (who mind you were standing there all this while)  I left the hotel.  I would give a serious rethink to the hotel, if this is the kind of customer service and behaviour they have towards guests....
title: Got Assaulted by the fron desk Manage - Amithe

ownerResponse/text:
We refer to the comments made by the reviewer with regard to their reservation. 

While the hotel  was not able to offer specific room numbers requested by the reviewer after the initial inspection was made by a representative, the hotel offered the best available suite categories which offer identical facilities to the suites originally seen by their representative.

All suites offer magnificent views of the ocean. The reviewer had no reason to leave as the hotel offered suitable and adequate options.  

We treat our guests equally regardless of the number of visits. While we try our very best to accommodate guest requests when allocating suites, we cannot always offer specific room numbers.

The issue of not been able to allocate specific room numbers are not a reflection of unreliable or poor service of the management. A service can only be evaluated upon experiencing a stay and not associating it with a particular room number. 

Thank you
placeInfo/name: Jetwing Saman Villas, A Luxury Reserve
text:
This was our third visit to saman villas.
One of ours uncles pre visited the place and made a reservation to those rooms we used to stay in our previous visits.By the time we turned up, our rooms were given to someone else who came before us. We were told that if we got down early, we could have got those particular rooms.  Thus, we did not get the rooms as we were promised. The management was very unreliable. We were disappointed on their service to a regular customer, and hence we decided to come back to Colombo.

Priyantha de Silva
title: Unreliable management

ownerResponse/text:
We refer to the reviewers recent stay at Saman Villas. We are very surprised with the review and rating, especially when over 93% of  guests have praised the hotel and rated very good and excellent.

We analyzed the reasons that provoked the reviewer to post such a review.  The reviewer had booked a 3 night stay and wanted to cancel the last night and demanded for a full refund of the last night. Since the management could not comply with the reviewers late request, the reviewer fabricated a false story to disrepute the hotel and mislead all readers.

Saman Villas does not offer the standard luxuriousness similar to what can be seen in large five star hotels. The concept and design are derived from ancient Sri Lankan temple architecture with rustic elegance elements, combined with modern conveniences. Saman Villas depicts a typical deluxe boutique resort and spa that is very Sri Lankan.  

For the benefit of prospective visitors to this site we are giving below the true picture;

ARRIVAL  EXPERIENCE
As  you enter the gates of Saman Villas you will proceed to the arrival pavilion from the car porch and a staff member awaits your arrival to welcome you. As you walk in, you will only hear the sounds of the gushing waters; an oversized pond with a floating timber walkway that leads to the spa and a water feature surrounded by large trees and thick vegetation. The pond is created to appear black in colour so that trees and vegetation reflects on water and creates a serene ambiance as you walk by the pathway at the edge of the pond to the craft pavilion. 

The craftsman awaits you at the craft pavilion and welcomes by garlanding you with a handmade Gok-Art (young coconut leaves) garland. You will be escorted to the reception across a timber bridge over cascading water. 

The water and the pond is by no means “ grey, murky and cloudy” as described by the reviewer. To ensure clarity of water in the pond, the water is filtered via a sand filter. 

THE AMBIANCE 
Reference to “long dark and gloomy walkways that had bare walls” ;a massive exaggeration by the reviewer. With just a 15 second walk through a short stairway, your landing place will open your eyes to some of the most magical views of the ocean and shoreline.

The landing place leads to you the main bar on your right-side by the infinity edge pool. The Lounge Bar is not a typical bar where bottles are displayed. The bar has been created for guests to appreciate the views of the infinity edge pool and ocean while enjoying their drinks. A special hand crafted art work made out of wood depicting water, sea, fish and birds adorns the backdrop of the Lounge Bar. The landing area then leads you to the Main Restaurant on to you left-side boasting panoramic views from the north shoreline to the south shoreline.  As you walk through the restaurant you will see a large terracotta mural depicting a Perahera (procession) similar to the Kandy Perahera.

THE SUITES
The website clearly explains the type of luxury the hotel offers “A modern-day interpretation of Sri Lankan culture and style, 26 suites and the duplex villa offer casual luxury in the form of soft linens and homely furniture”.  The reviewer has misinterpreted “luxuriousness”. The website also states that all suites offer open-air bathrooms and outdoor rain showers. The reviewer has failed to understand and appreciate the concept which other reviewers describe it as a “bathroom to die for”. There are no issues with mosquitoes as mosquito eliminators as placed in the bathrooms, balconies/veranda’s and bedrooms. We agree with the reviewer that the main sliding door does not fully seal. In keeping with the design and decor we opted for solid wood sliding doors instead of aluminum doors which would have sealed well. Mosquitoes have never been an issue in the rooms, though exaggerated by the reviewer.  
The swing doors were introduced by the architect after careful thought. The intention was to separate the dressing room and bedroom with least inconvenience to guests. The standard practice would have been to have a door to separate the dressing room and bedroom inconvenience guests to open and close each time they pass by. The swing doors with free movement is more convenient to guests.

We provide Daikin invertor type air-conditioning units. Two whisper quite indoor units are placed in each suite to have improve air distribution. The units do not make any howling sound as described by the reviewer. Both air-conditioning units may be operated at a very low speed with a comfortable temperature rather than managing with one unit at a higher speed and lower temperature.  

The reviewer had failed to understand and appreciate the concept of the hotel. The review does not comment on any experiential aspects such as food, service, staff etc…which are vital elements of a holiday. The reviewers only objective was to cause disrepute to the hotel as the management was not able to refund a last minute cancellation.

Thank you
placeInfo/name: Jetwing Saman Villas, A Luxury Reserve
text:
Disappointed is an understatement. I was dumb struck from the moment I stepped into the complex wondering if I had come to the right address. It was grey and murky the water features from the main gate were cloudy and very unpleasant to look at. The main building was accessed through a long dark and gloomy walkway that had bare walls and nothing to soften the spaces. The bar area looked like a scene from a 1970's play with a few bottles on a shelf in another un inviting  space. Then we were shown to our supposed luxurious  bedroom There was absolutely nothing luxurious, the furniture was a mismatch and badly placed there were saloon style doors into the dressing area and the bathroom had an open cage roofed area perfect for the mossies to get in and wait for us to enter.  The decor in the bathroom was also dreadful a confused mix of 'styles' and the cage roof made it feel dirty because of the plant debris hanging and dried on it. The sliding room doors didn't fit leaving huge gaps at the sides again letting in the mossies. The view was however amazing and the sound of the waves wonderful until we put on the air conditioning unit. It sounded like a howling wind and ruined any natural soothing wave sound. The noise from the apartment above was also intrusive we could hear them walking backwards and forwards. 
I have stayed in better hostels. Don't be fooled by the right up in the lonely planet they cannot have been here since it originally opened. It's DREADFUL. If they were charging US$200 a night I would have been upset so being charged over US$600  I felt totally ripped off. A very sour end to what has been a great trip through Sri Lanka
title: HUGELY DISAPPOINTED

ownerResponse/text:
Ayubowan! (May you live long!),

Dear Valued Guest,

Our sincere apologies for the late respond, Thank you for sharing the experience during your stay at Saman Villas.

I would like to sincerely apologize for the inconveniences and misunderstanding caused during your visit with us. 

Once again, I offer my sincerest apologies and hope you would accept this and please come back to enjoy our hospitality again in the future.

Stay safe!

Warm regards,
Dayan Ganegoda.
placeInfo/name: Jetwing Saman Villas, A Luxury Reserve
text:
We stayed 12 nights at separate two-floors villa with private pool.
Restaurant and it's personal is nice and friendly. Very good room service. Descent Spa. 
The holiday had been spoiled in the end by rude and unprofessional front desk staff and management. The manager came to us when we were chilling at the pool, started to shout in front of other guests for us to pay money which we are supposed to pay upon checkout. we stayed at many hotels in 25 countries around the world and could't believe this embarassing situation might take place. Afterwards there were no apologies or simple greetings from him or gloomy reception.  This is unacceptable behavoir. People like this should't work in hospitality.
Don't hope for a nice beach to take a swim. There are always heavy waves and dirty sandy water. Additionally to bunch of wild dogs which swarm around.
Wi-fi was extremely poor. Sometimes had to wait for one day just to send a message.  
Wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone.
title: Disappointing

ownerResponse/text:
We thank the reviewer for their recent stay at Saman Villas and  commending the location and our spa.

While there was no ongoing refurbishment work during July 2013, in view of low occupancy we were carrying out a treatment programme inside the suites for termites. We deeply apologize for disturbance caused to the reviewer by the sounds of the drills. Upon receiving the complaint from the reviewer we immediately halted the treatment programmes. We generally close the hotel for short periods to carry out refurbishment work as we do not want our guests been disturbed, however general maintenance work such as painting is carried out several times during the year due to the heavy sea breeze. 

May to end July is considered as low season on the south west coast, and our guests have the option of making use of the best offers during this period. Despite the seasonality the service offered to guests remains unchanged. We regret to note the reviewers comments about our staff been board and unenthusiastic. The overall rating and comments on staff and service is rated very highly. This is evident by the reviews posted by other reviewers on TripAdvisor.

Saman Villas undergoes a major refurbishment every 4-5 years and the last major refurbishment was in 2010 covering all suites and public areas. Saman Villas simply cannot be compared to a five star hotel; the concept and design is derived from ancient Sri Lankan temple architecture with rustic elegance elements, combined coupled with modern conveniences. Saman Villas is a typical deluxe boutique resort and spa with 27 suites spread out in over 3 acres on land and surrounded by lush green vegetation, we offer an intimate and personal experience to guests.
placeInfo/name: Jetwing Saman Villas, A Luxury Reserve
text:
We booked this hotel for 2 nights as part of our honeymoon.  The reviews we read were great.  The location is great.  I have to warn other travellers however, that you need to pick your time carefully.  We went out of season.  Which usually is not a problem for Sri Lanka.  Generally good weather and service still good.  Unfortunately this was not the case for Samman Villas.  We went there in July.  The staff were bored and unenthusiastic.  Lots of renovation work going on.  I have to add we payed full rate so it was not like they had an excuse.  Manger really not very helpful.

The rooms are now dated compared to other five star hotels

So my advice would be to go in peak season.  I wonder if previous good reviews have made them lazy.  We stayed in 4 other hotels during our stay.  This was no were near the best so don't feel that this is must for all those looking for a bit of luxury. 

The Spa is very good and reasonable price for treatments.
title: Off season don't bother

ownerResponse/text:
We refer to the review  “A sad experience....” which appears to be a review which is not genuine. The same reviewer had posted 2 false reviews previously regarding claimed stays at Saman Villas with the subjects “Interesting what happened...” on 13th April 2013 and  “Sigh....this is a sad place!” on 7th March 2013. These reviews were subsequently removed by Tripadvisor presumably because the reviewer had failed to verify their stays at Saman Villas

Our executive team speaks to all guests during their stay. The Manager speaks to every guest other than when he is on leave. With just 27 suites we know all our guests. Every Monday our executive team conducts a meeting to discuss and exchange notes of the comments made by guests who departed during the previous week. Whenever a review appears on Tripadvisor the team of executives discusses the favourable and unfavorable comments. With the procedure we follow, suspicious reviews are easily identifiable. The current review which states that the reviewer stayed in February 2013 as a couple is a false statement as we did not have such guests staying with us. The review “Sigh....this is a sad place!” posted on 7th March 2013 states that the reviewer stayed as a family in January 2013 which again is a false statement as we did not have such guests staying with us. We have checked our records and have not had any repeat guests staying with us from Germany in February 2013.

It is obvious that the reviewer is not objectively reviewing the hotel, but with ulterior motives. The reviewer initially rates the hotel 3/5 in their review “Sigh....this is a sad place!” on 7th March 2013. Since the review was suspicious the management reported to Tripadvisor. After the verification process Tripadvisor had removed the review. The reviewer re-submits a review “Interesting what happened...”  on 13th April 2013 once again giving a rating of 1/5 which was again removed by Tripadvisor on 16th April 2013.

We take both negative and positive comments constructively, but we do not tolerate reviews which are not genuine.

Tripadvisor as the name implies, is a travel advisory site. It provides a forum for both travelers and hotel owners. Tripadvisor encourages owners to respond to negative comments. We welcome guest comments, we apologize when we have failed, we implement all good suggestions made by guests and we explain when we disagree. Our replies are based on verifiable facts and as we state in several replies, our responses are for the benefit of future visitors to the site.
placeInfo/name: Jetwing Saman Villas, A Luxury Reserve
text:
We come regularly to Sri Lanka since we love it. 
Last time we decided to spend a few nice days (and a lot of Euro) in Saman Villas since its location seemed incredible wonderful.  Unfortunately we discovered fast that yes, the location is good, at least towards the ocean (you have to pass some sewage smelling area before you enter the gate) but the rest of the hotel did not make us crazy at all. We missed a hand and love for details which makes a hotel in this category so special -- but there is close to nothing. We did not like the lighting & fixtures in the rooms, the tiles around the pool (the fact that the poolboy washes the mould into the poolwater, yak!) and many other sad corners who are just dark or sad or in our opinion just not pretty. It is NOT a happy place and if you are a person with a sense for style, you find in southeast asian hotels,  this is not your place. I am sorry!
I agree with many guests, for what it offers it is totally overpriced! TOTALLY!!
title: A sad experience....

ownerResponse/text:
The review ‘Disgrace’ has arisen as a result of the reviewer cancelling the reservation.  We will therefore, first explain the facts leading to the cancellations. The party of 5 including the driver arrived having “travelled for 10 hours straight” (sic), without an advance reservation. The most worked and tired person in the group was obviously the driver. After making payment in confirmation of the rooms Valentino 333888, Paris, France requested free accommodation for the driver in separate quarters, which we do not provide. Other guests to Saman Villas provide their drivers accommodation in many guest houses in Bentota or sometimes in our guest rooms paying the very low Sri Lankan rate so that the driver gets a night’s rest in comfort. The reviewer thought of a free option. Give him a pillow and a bed sheet “so he can crash in the van” (sic). The executive who was  woken up to help the Receptionist to  sort out the commotion decided, very correctly, to lose US$ 1,500 in sales rather than be a party to an inhuman act. In fact it is in keeping with our principles of responsible tourism (please see hotel website) that we do not provide free drivers quarters. Our policy compels drivers to be accommodated in comfort in a nearby guest house providing additional income to the guest houses operated by the local community. We ask the readers of this review whether they know of any hotel in Paris, Valentino 333888’s city, which provides free drivers accommodation or bed sheets and pillows so that drivers “can crash in the van” (sic).
The Valentino 333888 from Paris says “If in fact this were my employees I would fire them immediately” (sic). Sorry sir, we have to be humane, our staff have families to support. We cannot fire employees the way you do, we have procedures.
It is true Sri Lankan hotels have 2 rates, one for Sri Lankans and resident visa holders and another for foreigners. Nothing to do with skin colour as the reviewer has said. Over 94% of visitors to Saman Villas are foreigners, simply because Sri Lankans cannot afford the very high foreign rate. Valentino 333888 tried to pressure the Receptionist to give him the benefit of the lower rate and failed. Now he is criticizing the policy.
There are numerous exaggerations, too many to deal with. A glaring exaggeration is the 78 plus 35 telephone calls, a total of 113. At the rate of 1 minute per call and allowing for all other activities in the review, a fair estimate would be 2 hours and 30 minutes. According to entry and departure times recorded by security the guests have spent exactly 1 hour and 2 minutes in the hotel premises. Need we say more? We will leave it to visitors to this website to determine the level of exaggeration.
In conclusion, the review “Disgrace” with a rating of 1 out of 5 is a real disgrace.
placeInfo/name: Jetwing Saman Villas, A Luxury Reserve
text:
The four of us had travelled for 10 hours straight and arrived in Bentota looking for a hotel and based on the ratings of this hotel TRIED to check in.  This is where the clown show began:
We were initially told that they had 2 rooms, but wait now there is only one, but wait let me call someone, yes 2 rooms, no 1 room and after showing us each room individually (which looked amazing!) we proceeded back to the reception to check in. Now what you have to realize is that in Sri Lanka there are 2 prices: one for Locals or Sri Lankas and or  Dual Citizens, and one for Foreigners, so based on your skin color you basically pay double, triple, quadruple whatever times more...no bid deal right? well if we did this in the western world it would be a lawsuit and called racism but here its just the Norm.  So since there were 3 dual citizens and one Foreigner (me) we usually in our travels would get the local rate and it wouldn't be a discussion at all, HOWEVER at this hotel they needed to make 78 phone calls in the middle of the night to ask who knows who about their PROCEDURE...you see here a Procedure is basically what somebody tells someone without any thought involved whatsoever..its basically the "way things are" doesn't matter if it makes sense or anything logical at all...so 45 minutes later some supposed Manager showed up and made some more phone calls and eventually said ok ok this time I can do it...in other words they are doing us a favor by spending $800 for the night...huffing and puffing taking my credit card...oh and this is where it gets exciting:  we asked if they had drivers quarters and they informed us that they don't do that 'HERE'...I said ok is it possible to get a pillow for our driver so he can crash in the van? and they said "in this type of establishment we don't even give 'them' coffee....." can you imagine this attitude????
