I basically snapped and told them to give me my refund back and that I would not stay in a place such as this with this type of attitude...I had enough....now you see the Credit Card machine was all of a sudden broken!! sure it was...another 35 phone calls later (and 2am by now) they finally figured out that the manager in fact was incompetent (although she blamed it all on the machine).  I threatened to go to the police at this point as they were now not giving me my money back and sure enough it now worked miraculously...
NOW I did not stay at this hotel and it sure looked very very nice, however when people treat other humans as lower then them I refuse to give them my money and I leave it up to you whether you should stay in a hotel such as this.  My final comments were: you just lost $1500 in sales (as we planned 2 nights) and they basically said:  "WE DON'T CARE" ....this are words of a failing business and if in fact this were my employees I would fire them immediately...
title: Disgrace

ownerResponse/text:
We thank the reviewer for their stay at Saman Villas and sharing their holiday experience. The review has given us an opportunity to explain several issues raised by the reviewer.

We regret we have failed to satisfy the reviewer in all areas except location.

Our responses to the reviewer’s comments are:

1.	Reviewer says “We paid close to USD 800 per night for a superior room”

The internet rate for the period 22nd December to 9th January (19 days) is USD 580 plus service charge and government tax which amounts to USD 735 per room night. Some agents offer lower rates. We are surprised that the reviewer bought the room from an agent for USD 800, USD 65 more than the internet rate. Our advice is please check the internet rate and buy at the lowest.

It is true that the reviewer booked in November one of the last available rooms. Demand is very high during this period. We have only 27 rooms and we had to turn down 6 requests for rooms for the same period.

Our rates vary throughout the year. In fact there are 7 different rate periods depending on many factors such as holiday season, weather, festivities, demand, etc. The cheapest in 2012 was from 1st May to 15th July at USD 266 and most expensive from 22nd December 2012 to 9th January 2013 at USD 735. The latter is the only period we could not meet the demand and hence the high rate is justifiable. Our rate structure is flexible to the extent that a traveler can have a very cheap holiday at USD 266 per night or pay USD 735 per night during the 19 day peak period. We also have numerous value added offers. Please visit our website for rates and special offers or contact us.

2.	Reviewer says “On new years eve, a party started on the beach near our room. It was noise from another hotel and was so loud it was as though we were in the room together”

The aerial photograph of the hotel in the website shows a general impression of the location. There are no hotels nearby except the ayurvedic treatment centre behind the hotel which may be identified from the green coloured roof. On 31st night a band was playing at a small 6 bedroom hotel abutting the highway but with a beach front, known as Warahena. The distance from Room 24 occupied by the reviewer to the Warahena Hotel is between 1200 and 1300 feet. Any future visitor to Saman Villas may verify this. There is no truth whatsoever in the statement “party started on the beach near our room” (sic).

It is a practice in Sri Lanka and many other countries to celebrate New Year’s Eve. Almost all tourist hotels have entertainment with music for dancing. At Saman Villas the band played till 1.40 am. At Warahena it was over at 2.45 am.

On 31st night in 2011 and 2012 music was played at Warahena Hotel and could be heard at Saman Villas. On both nights the hotel was full. In 2011 no one complained and in 2012 only the reviewer complained. It is not that others did not hear the music. It may be that they did not find it disturbing or they were appreciative of the fact that it is a once a year celebration.

Hotels pay compensation if a facility in a guest room or elsewhere in the hotel is withdrawn. No compensation is paid for anything not within the control of hotel management.

The reviewer complained to me and requested compensation, but there was no basis to justify any payment. The reviewer was adamant. All this was making their holiday unpleasant and  to  save  their holiday I offered a refund of 25%. This was a gesture of goodwill simply to help the reviewer and her husband to enjoy their holiday, but to no avail.

3.	Other complaints in the review

Our responses are:

a. 	Lizard in the room – A common house gecko about 3” long was found in the room. Geckos have suction pads on their feet and they can move fast on walls and ceilings. It is almost impossible to catch them. It may have entered the room from the open air balcony or verandah. Geckos are harmless creatures.

b. 	Two short power cuts – There was a failure in the government power supply on 2nd January from 18.52 hrs to 19.15 hrs.  When this happens the generator automatically starts off after a delay of about 30 seconds. When power returns the automatic changeover is very much quicker. These very short interruptions are not power cuts.

c. 	The reviewer has made many complaints about service. Visitors to this site may read all reviews in 2012 and decide whether our service is bad.

4. Why we reply

Trip Advisor as the name implies, is a travel advisory service. It provides a forum for both travellers and hotel owners. Trip Advisor encourages owners to respond to negative comments. We welcome guest comments, as evident in our Chairman’s welcome letter, apologize when we have failed, implement suggestions and when we disagree we explain. Our replies are based on verifiable facts and as we have stated in several replies are for the benefit of future visitors to this website.
placeInfo/name: Jetwing Saman Villas, A Luxury Reserve
text:
I really wanted to like this hotel and had high expectations as we paid close to $800 per night for a 'superior room', which means standard room. The pictures on the website show an aerial photo of an attractive hotel sitting alone on a rocky headland jutting out to the sea. It looks as though there are no other hotels around it. The room was one of the last rooms available when we booked it in November for a late December stay, so the price was hyper inflated. The entrance to the hotel is relatively promising, looking like top class hotels we have stayed in throughout Asia in Thailand, Malaysia, Philippines etc. How wrong we were....

The catalogue of errors began with the service. It was extraordinarily slow, in the restaurant, reception, pool, in-room etc. Even with the restaurant half full or us being a handful of people to dine there. Upon reading other reviews, we have to agree with those who mentioned the staff linger for a little too long which feels uncomfortable and unnecessary. On many occasions, we asked for two items, only one turned up or was incorrect which became quite tiring after a while.

On new years eve, a party started on the beach near our room. It was noise from  another hotel and was so loud it was as though we were in the room together. We gave it until 1.30 am before calling reception 6 times, each time the line rang out. My husband (who was unwell at the time and needed rest due to the anti biotics he was taking) got out of bed to speak to reception. When he reached reception, there was someone manning the desk! He complained and was told it would stop at 2.30, which it didn't. He called again and was advised they would call the tourist police. The music stopped eventually at 4 am. We complained to the front desk manager the following day and said we didn't wish to pay for a night where we did not sleep. The manager said it was another hotel that caused the issue and it wasn't their fault. It was shocking that he didn't try to help, except eventually offering us 10 per cent off that night, a nominal figure. The receptionist offered a 2 hour treatment at the spa on top and asked us to write a letter to the authorities to complain. It wasnt accepted by us and we asked to speak to the general manager who we met with the following day and said it wasn't his fault. Our argument was that if they know there is a regular occurrence of such parties, then why let rooms out on that side of the hotel? Also, they asked us to move to the other side of the hotel, the front desk manager said it was because a new years day party may happen, the general manager advised it was because it was a quieter room. The general manager offered 25 per cent off that night as a final gesture and when we stood our ground, he said he'd speak to the chairman. It eventually ended with us advising we wanted to speak to the chairman but this didn't happen, we were told he would email us......

In the new room, there was a lizard which we asked to be removed. The staff tried with a pencil and it ran up the wall. It appeared again the next day. Again, the staff tried to remove it with haphazard ways and said it was gone only for it to reappear at night.

The rooms were below par, again echoing the comments in other reviews of this hotel. They certainly werent furnished in a way that justifies paying $800 a night. The wi fi was very poor, even though we had been to other parts of the coastwhere it was better so it wasnt a coastal issue. The bathrooms weren't cleaned every day, the bed was made and the room swept but it wasn't cleaned at all, in fact there was hair in the plug hole until we removed it. The tv in e second room had very poor reception and couldn't be controlled from bed. When leaving the hotel to go elsewhere it was visibly frowned upon, with e front office staff saying we needed to walk outside the property to get a tuk tuk instead of helping us. There were 2 short power cuts on our last evening. There was dried in blood on a duvet cover and a black mark on our pillow case which we had to have changed. Also, for our first breakfast, we were charged for a bottle of water at an all inclusive breakfast! Along with the fact as a beach hotel, there are no sun loungers on the beach and no possibility of service on the beach should the staff put some loungers down there. The owner of the hotel visited top notch resorts in asia when he was building this hotel. I can see how he may have tried to mirror those styles within this hotel, but it falls short, feeling like Aldi mimicking Marks and Spencer but doing a bad job of it. It's not plush, not worth the extortionate amount charged for the standard rooms. Overall a most unpleasant experience and a hotel that falls in to the bottom grading of the various top notch hotels I've stayed in over the years. These complaints are not new to the management of the hotel, who continue to defend themselves on this site in a most aggressive and unpleasant manner, instead of changing their ways.
title: 3 star quality at 5 star prices

ownerResponse/text:
We thank the reviewer for their stay at Saman Villas. We are delighted to read the reviewer’s very favorable comments regarding the friendly / delightful staff, excellent people, beautiful location, small and exclusive resort and the excellent menu. However, the overall rating of two out of five given by the reviewer is influenced by some of the negative comments in the review. Our explanations on the negative comments are discussed below:-

1.	Transfer from Airport to Hotel.
	The reviewer has raised two issues.

	a.	Breakdown of vehicle 
	b.	That US$ 125 is a very high fare for Sri Lanka.

We profusely apologize to the reviewer  for the breakdown of the vehicle. Immediately it was brought to my notice I waived the entire charge of the transfer. 

We cannot agree at all with the reviewer’s comment that for Sri Lanka US$ 125 is a very high fare. We did  a comparison of a transfer from the Heathrow Airport to London by taxi with the rate we charged.At Heathrow if you wait in the queue for a taxi it will cost you US$ 89 to transfer to London, a distance of 28 km which takes about 30 minutes. In comparison the transfer time from the Airport to the hotel is approximately 3 hours or 6 times that in London.The distance that has to be covered is 92 km which is 3.3 times the distance in London. If you  extrapolate (disregarding the time taken which is  6 times) a charge of US$ 294 for transfer to Saman Villas is reasonable, of course assuming that vehicle prices and  cost of fuel etc are similar. A sub-compact car  like Toyota Corolla manufactured about 2007  will cost about US$ 28,000 a fortune in Sri Lanka. This is no surprise because Sri Lanka charges one of the highest duty rates in the world for motor cars. A similar used car can be purchased at about US$ 14,900 in London. Gas station price in the U.K is US$ 2.16 per litre whereas in Sri Lanka it is US$ 1.15. You can do your own arithmetic and you will come to the conclusion that a charge of at least US$ 250  is not unreasonable. Our charges are as follows:-

	Sub-compact vehicle						                US$ 125
	Semi luxury car						 	                US$ 200
	Luxury (Mercedes Benz or Chrysler 300 C)			US$ 460

The above prices are inclusive of 10% service charge and 15.2% government tax.

Is it fair for any one to complain that our transfer rates are high? It is very unfortunate that a very few  tourists think Sri Lanka  which is a developing country should sell everything cheap. We sometimes  receive similar complaints about wine prices. If   anyone  compares one of the most widely sold wines (Moet & Chandon) in a 4 or 5 star hotel in London or anywhere else in the world  they will find our price is very  reasonable. Wines are considered a luxury in Sri Lanka and therefore attract very high duty. Quantities imported into Sri Lanka are insignificant and as a result import prices are very much higher than in UK or Europe.

2.	Pool Villas are far from Private
There is often confusion between the English words “private” and “privacy”. We use the meanings given in the Oxford Dictionary and therefore it is best to refer the meanings given there. We have given all the necessary information  correctly in our website. We have 4 categories of rooms on the ground floor.

Deluxe Suite without pool selling at US$ 342

Deluxe Suite with pool selling at US$ 394.For the addition of a pool which is described in the website as “7 meter infinity edge lap pool overlooking the Indian Ocean for your private use” we charge only additional US$ 52 on Deluxe Suite price.

For an additional US$ 172 we offer the Grand Deluxe with a pool which is  described in our website as “7 meter secluded lap pool overlooking the Indian Ocean with sun deck and dining area for your private use”.

For an additional US$ 272 we offer the Villa (duplex with floor area 1,261 sq.ft)  where the pool is described as “ 7 meter secluded lap pool with sun deck and sun loungers for your private use in privacy”

The above rates quoted are from our website as at 19th April 2012. 10% service charge and 15.2% government taxes should be added.

Our website clearly explains the difference and what it cost to get absolute privacy. In the circumstance we cannot understand why the reviewer has complained.

3.	We were charged 2 nights cancellation

Reviewer’s argument is that although they complained about the mattress the cancellation charge which they agreed to at the time  of reservation was not waived. We cannot accept  that there is a problem with the mattress as claimed by the reviewer. During this year there are 40 reviews in Trip Advisor and no guest has complained about  an inadequacy in the mattress. We do waive cancellation charges for very good reasons only. Otherwise the guest must honour the contract. This is the practice followed in any hotel in the world.
placeInfo/name: Jetwing Saman Villas, A Luxury Reserve
text:
First, the positives. The staff at Saman were delightful, friendly and not at all over-attentive. Excellent people. The location is beautiful and the resort is small and exclusive. The menu was excellent, although it meets the description of "Overpriced"!
The hotel charges $125 for a transfer from the airport. This is a very high fare for Sri Lanka. I was happy to pay it if some kind of luxury would be on offer, as I have experienced at other high-end resorts, usually involving a comfortable car with bottles of water and cold towels supplied. Unfortunately the vehicle was an old Hyundai, which was very shabby inside. There was bottled water.....for the driver! After half an hour the engine lights came on and the car ground to a halt. The driver managed to get it going again but we couldn't use the air conditioning. Great in Sri Lanka! A bit later the driver decided that a/c would be available so we limped in to Saman at a snails pace on a wing and a prayer. Not a great start to our break and the manager immediately waived the fee (of course!)
A word about the pool villas. We had booked a deluxe with pool and looked forward to some privacy there. To quote Saman villas policy "(The) concept has always attracted travelers seeking private luxury holidays in an undisturbed atmosphere with maximum privacy." Well all the pool villas' pools are far from private as they are overlooked by at least two of the apartments plonked on top of the "Pool Villas". You are like performing seals for the occupants above! Again, I expected a private pool as in other resorts I have stayed in but was disappointed.
My wife and I have to disagree with a previous contributor about the bed. Or maybe we just had the worst one at the resort? It was as hard as a brick with lumps and springs felt through it. After one night we asked for a duvet and mattress protector to go on top of it. But when we were both awake early and taking pain-killers for our backs the next morning, we decided enough was enough. It was time to book out and find some comfort somewhere else, as all the management could offer was more blankets on top of the lumpy mattress!
We were charged two nights cancellation fee. This was the first time at any hotel I have stayed in around the world, where there was a punitive fee for checking out due to the inadequacies of the hotel! Shocking.
They try (hard) to portray themselves as an exclusive resort but fail on many counts. Very overpriced for what it is!
title: Overpriced

ownerResponse/text:
We thank the reviewer for their stay at Saman Villas.

The reviewer stayed 6 nights at Saman Villas and during their stay they had only one complaint . That was only  about WiFi, which we will explain later.

Reviewer’s main complaint was regarding a charge of US$ 30 for breakfast per person. He says “we were led to believe breakfast was included”. The reservation was made online through our website. Any one can visit our website and click on “Book Now” on the Menu Bar. It will be very clear that room rates do not include breakfast and an additional US$ 24 has to be paid for breakfast. Both room and breakfast rates are special discounted rates for internet reservations and are very much lower than rack rates offered at the hotel. At the time of check-in the reviewer was very clearly informed by the Guest Relations Executive that the breakfast rate is US$ 30 at the restaurant. They had breakfast on all six days and it was charged  correctly to their account. At check-out they refused to pay the charge for breakfast. Twice, not once, they threatened to walk out without settling the bill. The General Manager had to come down interrupting an important meeting to persuade the reviewer to settle the bill. The reviewer then threatened to write a terrible review in the Trip  Advisor. True, it was a nightmare for the Guest Relations Executive.

Our comments on the reviewer’s other complaints are:

1.	Their crappy site. In the end I could not book through their site.

For online reservations we use a facility used by many hotels worldwide. This company has its corporate office in New York and reservation facility is maintained from Melbourne, Australia.

The booking was in fact made online through our website.

2.	Staff training and numerous other comments about staff.

We leave it to our future guests to evaluate our staff. We take regular staff training very seriously and we are the only boutique hotel in Sri Lanka with its own onsite purpose built training facility.

3.	Poor WiFi Service

We agree with the reviewer that our Wi Fi facility is poor. It is not 56 kbps as alleged. The problem is that Saman Villas is located in a very  sparsely  populated area described as a sleepy village. Hence signal  strengths are weak as compared to cities. This is so anywhere in the world. For about 4 weeks the service provider Dialog Axiata ( an international  service provider)has been working on enhancing signal levels with little success. They haven’t given up.

4.	Room  toiletries not 5 star

Bath foam, shower gel, shampoo and body hydrating lotion are famous international brands, are guaranteed safety tested and not poor quality, unsafe products in misleading 5 star  packaging. Soap is a translucent glycerine soap which is soft on the skin, and comes in a 70 gm (usually hotels provide 35 gm) tablet which grips well on your hand.

5.	One staff member cleans the room – takes one hour. Why don’t 2 or 3 work together.

The total floor area of the room is 1261 sq.ft. True it take about one hour to clean. Earlier we used 2 to clean the room in half the time, but  guests complained. They preferred one person cleaning the room whilst they rested in another area of the room. In future we will ask the guests of their preferred method of cleaning. We thank the guest for bringing this to our notice.

6.	Attempted to illegally charge a plus plus method of sales tax, VAT and city tax.

All hotels in Sri Lanka have three components in every hotel invoice. The hotel charge, staff service charge and government taxes. All hotels are required by law to pay tax on the hotel charge + service charge. In fact, not paying the tax is illegal. Hotels have the option of quoting nett rates or + +
placeInfo/name: Jetwing Saman Villas, A Luxury Reserve
text:
have waited to write this review until after my wife and I had completed our 19 day honeymoon in Sri Lanka. This mainly because of the disappointing hospitality experience and the extraordinary gap in expectation and service delivery. After spending many many hours researching the most romantic destination in Ceylon, this hotel stood out and so did it's room rate. I will only marry once and so, to surprise my wife I spent $5500 booking their flagship room #5 Saman Villa for 6 nights. It read as a 2 story private enclave with a pool and I will leave it to you to read about the rest of its allure on their crappy site. In the end I could not book through their site and had to phone 4 times to confirm my booking.
To be honest it is a beautiful location with a fantastic layout, and by Sri Lankan standards moderately well maintained, although ticking some of the rating boxes does not constitute a 5 star rating. Your hotel must exceed service expectations and leave no gap between customer perception and delivery of product, especially when paying the exorbitant room rates. In hindsight I really should have booked a hotel in the Maldives for this money and recommend all others considering this hotel to do so or others in the area.

When checking out you'll feel jaded, lied to, deceived and sour that the operators of this venue are ripping you off and as experienced by 2 honeymooners; ripped off with a smile. 
I write this review in the hope that the hotel will lessen the afore mentioned gap in service expectations and delivery. 
A word of advice to management, put some of the money you took from me into staff training, your staff need it desperately, more is not better!
If you cut your staff ratio in half, trained them and intern paid them more money, than perhaps they wouldn't feel the need to shadow the guests constantly fishing for tips and annoying them.
I have put in point form other inadequacies I can remember. Saman Villas ruined our honeymoon and we would like to offer some advice to all contemplating a stay here. 
AVOID STAYING AT SAMAN VILLAS!!
- Wifi Bandwidth poor - continual annoying dropouts and a slow 56kb/per second connection. What should have taken me 10mins a day took over an hour. No 5 star Hotel in the world would even consider an antiquated service like this. But it is a cheap connection and another cost saving - corner cutting measure.
- Waiters reaching over the table to place and remove dinnerware. Servers lurking around/shadowing all the time and annoying you in moments of intimacy. Usually trying to remove plates with food when empty plates clearly visible.
- Servers also then walking past plates/bowls which had been sitting at the side of the table for up to 15 mins. 
- Servers haphazardly clanging plates down on table.
- When calling reception you're lucky to lucky to have them to answer and when you do get through response time can vary on how many times you remember to call them and remind them of your request.
- Room toiletries not 5 star or consistent with rates or a hotel also pushing the spa angle. $100USD for a 50 min massage, and they wonder why no one is using this service ($15 p/h outside the hotel), it's Sri Lanka and your not 5 star.
- Way too many staff in the public area, wandering around aimlessly and trying to have a chat or engage you at any chance to work a tip.
- House phones have a very harsh static noise. (they'll get around to fixing this issue someday)
-Sort of feel hassled each morning to vacate while one staff member cleans the room, only to return after an hour to find him still there. Why don't 2 or 3 work together and get it done in a third of the time. We found our porch used as a base for other cleaners to bring or take things from.	
- Checkout was a nightmare. We were led to believe breakfast was included with the $819USD rate. After 1 and a half hours of squabbling they added another $50 per day for Breakfast and in the midst of all that had attempted to illegally charge a plus plus  plus method to sales tax, VAT and their city tax. This is very illegal and it seems they have been getting away with doing it for years, it made a $70 difference to our bill so multiply that out over a year. The mind boggles at front of houses' ineptness to appease disgruntled guests and their greediness to extract as much cash as possible out of their patrons.
Whats even sadder is they think they have a tight 5 star operation. Perhaps the hotel Management should visit a real 5 star hotel in Europe to wake them from their inept ignorant slumber.
You'll also notice how quickly this negative review disappears down the page from management and the like as they use trip advisor to snare many would be chumps into booking.
title: Worst hospitality experience we had in Lanka

ownerResponse/text:
We thank the reviewer for praising the location and the massage. Our response to the reviewers adverse comments are given below

1.	Stayed in lower category suite, but had to accept original higher rate.

January and February which correspond  with the European winter are our busiest months. Demand for rooms is very high and on the supply-demand principle our rates are equally high. Almost every hotel in the world has rules/practices governing cancellations and amendments. On arrival reviewer was not happy with the room booked and requested a superior room which we obliged after explaining our rules/practices.

If the reviewer had not booked the suite with a pool we could have sold it to another who requested  the same category of suite. In addition  we released a superior suite to the reviewer by offering a free upgrade to another guest. In the circumstances we could not make any concessions and the reviewer had to honour the original contract with us. The reviewer was adviced accordingly prior to the room change which he accepted.

2.	Soliciting tips

The reviewer has commented on staff and hired entertainers indirectly soliciting tips in 4 paragraphs of his review. The reviewer’s specific comments in this regard are:

(a) “they waited long long time to be honoured for their service”
(b) “we had the feeling that staff were looking for any opportunity to get extra payments and 
                     tips”

(c) “the staff will do your bed or your bathroom five times a day – if they get the opportunity. 
    This could be taken as a sign of explicit service – contrary we had the feeling that staff  where   
    seeking more tips”

(d) “it is expected you honour the dancers with dollars”

Any one reading the reviewers comments will understand that the reviewer is simply expressing his feelings and beliefs and are not based on any facts.

The houseman who carried the bags may have stayed there for a few seconds, but not long long time which the reviewer has interpreted as soliciting tips.

In  (b) and (c)  above  the reviewer expresses his feelings which are not based on any facts. We leave it to those who read this reply to decide whether it is morally correct to make allegations against innocent staff based on feelings.

Dancers who are hired by us for the evening,  perform in a designated  area away from diners and cannot go from table to table. In the circumstances we cannot understand how the reviewer assumed that they “expected dollars”.

Soliciting tips by anyone directly or indirectly is strictly prohibited according to information provided in suites for the benefit of guests.

3.	“We would expect Saman Villas to pay servants enough money so that they don’t have to beg from guests”

	The reviewer has attempted to insult and  demean our staff by calling them servants. No, we don’t have servants. A servant is a person employed in a house on domestic duties. We employ mostly professionals who either have received training out side or trained by us  in-house. Every year during the off-season we train our staff and for this purpose we have a purpose-built tiered lecture hall across the road with audio visual equipment.

	The visitor has attempted to downgrade our staff to beggars. We employ staff according to the best labour standards and human rights, treating them as individuals. Our staff are amongst the highest paid in the industry and they don’t beg from guests.

4.	“We felt that the staff in general are non-professionals hired locally – a nice idea – but if you expect the best a very fatal decision”
	
	The reviewer is correct when he says the staff are hired locally – they are all Sri Lankans and they match up to foreign staff. In fact Sri Lanka provides a large number of staff at all levels to top five star hotels in the Middle East, Maldives and some other countries world wide.

	As already explained our staff are professionals. Reviewer’s comments in this regard are not based on facts, but may be his imagination.

5.	“Staff will do your bed or your bathroom five times a day – if they get the opportunity”

	Yes, if guests request,  for special reasons,  we provide that service and not otherwise.  Staff clean the rooms twice daily in the morning and evening. They do not have time to clean the rooms five times a day specially when the hotel is nearly full,  specially during reviewers stay  when occupancy was 82%. The staff visiting times are recorded and are monitored daily by the Executive Housekeeper and in his absence by the Supervisor.

6.	A Monkey and a Scorpion
	
One thing every visitor agree is that the location is fantastic. Factors contributing  to this are – remoteness of the location, tropical jungle, coconut plantation, rocky promontory and the stunning views. 99.99% of our guests love this place and they are willing to compromise on certain features associated with tropical vegetation such as insects, crawlers, squirrels, monkeys, etc. Remove the vegetation and you will have a bare rock free of animals – no longer a fantastic location. Only those who love living in a concrete jungle will be happy in such a location when on holiday.

Any visitor to Sri Lanka, other than the central parts of the city of Colombo will experience a variety of animals such as insects, crawlers, squirrels, monkeys, lizards, etc. In central Kandy, Sri Lanka’s second largest city monkeys are regular visitors to bedroom balconies/verandahs in some hotels.

At Saman Villas a batch of monkeys is sighted  a few times a year. On this occasion we were aware of their presence and were lighting crackers to frighten them away. They visit open air bathrooms when they are unoccupied and damage the flower vases. Same happened in reviewer’s bathroom , only once.

A tiny scorpion was found on the wall of the reviewer’s bedroom. On  hearing from the reviewer it was promptly removed. The tiny scorpion may have been carried away due to a gust of wind to the balcony or open air bathroom and  may have crawled into the bedroom. There is nothing to get alarmed of. Scorpions don’t attack people.

7.	Food is fair but over charged

Over 95% of our guests consider our food to be good or excellent. Our prices are reasonable when one considers quality and safety we offer. Our kitchen is ISO 22000 certified for food safety, probably the only boutique hotel in Sri Lanka to receive the certification.

8.	Local dance arrangement on Fridays are so loud
	
Yes, it is true because they play Sri Lankan drums. We organize this for the benefit of our guests so that they can experience traditional Kandyan and low country dance forms without having to venture out  incurring additional expenses. No guests have ever complained about any aspect of the performance. However, we have taken the comments seriously and from next week the performance has been advanced to start 30 minutes before dinner. We thank the reviewer for his observation.

9.	Massage is fantastic ! but only until they know you are going home – then they take  out parts of the programme

	Once again we thank the reviewer for praising our therapists for the massage.

	The reviewer and his partner had the following treatments

	(a) Tranquility – 1 hour 25 minutes
	(b) Energizer – 1 hour 10 minutes

	In all treatments there is a certain ritual to be followed at the beginning such as the welcome foot bath which is done before entering the treatment room. Apart from this there is no interruption whatsoever. All treatments are strictly according to pre-designed programmes and the fact that guest is going home is not a reason for changing the treatment. Once again guests are expressing what they felt and thought.

	Generally a therapist does 1 to 3 treatments a day and by no means are they overworked. Once again the reviewer has based his comments on incorrect assumptions.

 10.	Don’t  use Saman Villas own website for booking. You can get more than 30% rebate using others.

	That is simply impossible unless they are offering below cost and at a loss. Tour Operators and Travel Agents are given discounts by us, as otherwise they will not sell the hotel. With that discount they have to cover their selling expenses, overheads and also make a profit. It is true their rates can be lower than ours sometimes, if they keep a lower profit margin. Our rates may appear high, but not if you consider time based discounts and complimentary transfers. We try to keep our rates competitive, not cheaper. We encourage as many travel agents, tour operators and booking engines to sell Saman Villas at competitive rates so that our visitors have a wide choice to select from.

	The hotel offers room only. Breakfast and dinner are offered at concessionary rates.

	We don’t ask  our prospective visitors to book with us. We want them to search the internet and select the cheapest package.

11.	Few  questions regarding the specification to the manager and his reaction was to laugh  us in the face.

	Only question we are aware of is that the guest disputed the charge of 10% service charge. It was explained to him that all hotels charge 10% and that the reservation confirmation sent to him has specified 10% service charge. The reviewer was to check this with the next hotel in his itinerary in Sri Lanka and call us. We did not hear from the reviewer.

	We deny that the Front Office Manager or his assistant laughed him in the face as alleged. When they speak to guests all Front Office staff are required to show a smiling face and that may have been misunderstood by the reviewer.
placeInfo/name: Jetwing Saman Villas, A Luxury Reserve
text:
We stayed in Saman Villas for for 5 days in January 2012. On our arrival we werrent impressed with the privacy offered in the suite allocated for us. So we accepted an offer for a suite on a lower category "but" we had to accept the original "higher" rate. Definetely not the way we do our business - but when you where looking for the time of your life you dont want to argue !

Lugage was taken to our room by some quiet friendly personal, who waited a long long time to be honored for their explicit service - carrying two medium sized bags to our downgrated room.

Throughout our stay on Samam Villas we had the feeling that all staff where looking for any opportunity to get extra payments and tips. We understand that the general income on the island is quiet limited - but we would expect a place like Saman Villas to pay servants enough money so that they dont have to beg from the guest on the hotel. Also we felt that the staff in general are non professionals hired locally - a nice idea - but if you expect the best a very fatal desicion.

The staff will do your bed or your bathroom five time a day - if they get the opportunity. This could be taken as a sign of explicit service - contrary we had the feeling that staff where seeking more tips...

We had a monkey in our open air bathroom. This issue was handled quiet professionally from the staff.

We had a scorpion in our bedroom the first night - and asked to talk to the management. However this was not possible - because management had gone to sleep (9 o'clock pm) - which was claimed from the guy who killed the scorpion.

Food is fair but over charged. Pool is nice specially the view. Local dance arrangement on fridays are so loud that you cannot think or talk over your dinner - and also for this, it is expected that you honor the dansers with dollars !

Massage is fantastic ! But only untill they know that you are going home - then they take parts out of the program to allow them some (well deserved) time off...that is what we felt and thought.

Dont use Saman Villas own website for booking. You can get more than 30% rebate using other web booking agents/services - which will then also include breakfast....unfortunately we booked directly. We had a few questions regarding the specification to the manager and his reaction was to laugh us I our face.

Saman Villas was the biggest disappointment that I have had on any hotel. OK I had high expectations and only the fantastic view lived up to those.
title: Potentially the best view

ownerResponse/text:
We refer to the recent stay of two resident expatriates at Saman Villas and wish to explain in detail the issues raised by the reviewers.

1. Complimentary birthday cake:The reviewers stay was for one night from 3rd to 4th December 2011 and the actual birthday of the reviewers’ husband was falling on 5th December 2011. Complimentary birthday cakes are provided only if the particular guest is staying on the day of the birthday.  The reviewer wanted to arrange a special occasion with a special dinner and cake to be presented as a surprise.  We agreed to provide a complimentary cake. When the reservation was confirmed, we sent the prices for the special dinner but the reviewer did not want to book the special dinner. The  reviewer did not discuss or specify the time the cake should be presented after they arrive. The hotel staff had also forgotten to check with the guest about serving the cake, which was a complete oversight on our part. 
 
The reviewer mentioned about the cake not been provided only upon departure; had this been just mentioned to the hotel we would have readily arranged the cake as a surprise. Upon noting our mistake, I immediately called the guest and apologized and requested to meet them in person to explain. Since the guest was not able to provide an appointment, I immediately sent an apology card signed by me and Chairman along with a bottle of Moet & Chandon to the guest residence before the reviewers’ husbands’ birthday.

2. DVD Player was broken: A full check is carried out in all suites before releasing for arrivals. Based on our check list records, the DVD player was functioning before the guest checked-in and therefore we are rather surprised with this complaint. We were informed about a defect only at departure and our Maintenance Department had immediately checked the unit and found it faultless.   

3. Ditch  stinks in the bathroom: All rooms are provided with a water feature – a small pond and a spout with water circulating daily for a  total of six and half-hours. The system  was operating since August 2010 without any problems. During this period the South of Sri Lanka experienced gale force winds and heavy evening rains resulting 19 deaths and 35 fishermen reported missing. The heavy rains continued until 1st December evening. The pond drain-out could not cope with the heavy rains and water was flooding the bathrooms. For the 1st time since August 2010 we had to stop circulation and empty the ponds. The system was restarted with fresh water on 2nd December. Although the ponds were emptied to prevent flooding, some water remained in the pipe lines. Later investigations reveled that micro-organisms had formed in the water remaining in the pipe lines, which had developed unpleasant odors. When the ponds were refilled and the circulation restarted these smells came into the bathroom. Such human errors occur everywhere in the world. According to what we read in the world press not so long ago the nuclear disaster in Japan was one such incident. Since we are aware of the cause of the bad odor, we have taken preventive measures.

Bath, shower and sink water was not affected at all and it was perfectly safe to use the water. There were other guests in the hotel during this time and we have not received such complaints. 

4. Unable to soak due to poor water flow: All suites are provided with an oversize terrazzo bath. The bath spout is a unique design where the water flows from a 6-inch wide, open-top spout. Water flow from a 6-inch wide, open-top spout will look slow as compared to water flowing from a normal half-inch tap. The bath filling time is normal and this is the first ever complaint we have received regarding water flow.

5. Whilst in the private pool a person climbing on to the rock: We were rather surprised of this incident as no one made such a complaint. We would expect our reviewer to immediately raise such an incident, but our reviewer did not do so until they departed from the hotel. Although we have no way of verifying this, we immediately took the matter up with the highest level in the Police. On the instructions of the Southern Province Police Chief, the Officer-in- Charge summoned all the Three-Wheeler drivers to the Police Station and warned them severely. In consultation with the Police, we are taking a course of action to prevent such incidents in the future. 

6. Too much seasoning in the food: We note that the reviewer had consumed a Sri Lankan dish for lunch which was mildly spiced and probably the spices did not agree with them. In the case of dinner the reviewer had chosen the 4 course set dinner which was also consumed by many other guests who had commented very positively. Over 95% of our guests are very happy with our food. This is evident from reviews in websites, blogs and our own guest comment book. 

All issues that have been raised by the reviewer could have been resolved immediately by informing us. The Chairman’s welcome letter provides details of all Departmental Managers, and guests are requested to contact them to raise any issues.  Sadly our reviewers did not raise any of these issues during their stay. 

Thank you
placeInfo/name: Jetwing Saman Villas, A Luxury Reserve
text: I stayed this hotel over the weekend for my husband birthday, but ended up being unhappy stay. i have some good feedback about this hotel from my friends but all about hotel pool- infinity pool. I booked a delux suite w/private swiming pool, but several facility problems in my room (the ditch stinks in the bathroom, music player is out of order, hot water capacity is low so didn't soak myself), outside three wheeler guy is coming just in front of my private pool did asking restaurant or tour guid, and worst is they forgot a complimentary BD cake for my husband! I told them when i checked out, but just talked back they would arrange that cake just for BD guy stays on the day! if i knew that, i am ok to pay extra, but surely they mentioned it on my reservation confirmation email. We left the happy with unhappy mood, and no staff sent off at the hotel reception, just handed over the bill!! It's pitty hotel other staff is friendly, but others aren't good. Judging from food and facility, not worth paying (food is so seasoned). when compared to other srilankan luxuary hotel, i won't recommend this hotel. I won't come back this hotel, either!!
title: Not worthy staying

ownerResponse/text:
Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us.

We’re truly sorry to hear that your stay at EKHO Ella did not meet your expectations. While we’re pleased you appreciated the scenic view — which is something many guests find unforgettable — we regret that other aspects of your experience left you feeling disappointed.

Your comments regarding the facilities, cleanliness, and dining experience have been taken seriously and shared with our management and relevant teams for immediate review. We always strive to maintain a high standard of service and comfort, and we regret falling short during your visit.

Please know that we are continuously working to improve, and feedback like yours is vital in helping us do better. We sincerely hope you’ll consider giving us another opportunity in the future to provide the level of service and experience that EKHO Ella is known for.
roomTip: worse stay in sri lanka
text: I usually give good reviews, but unfortunately, our experience at EKHO Ella was very disappointing. The hotel is old and extremely overrated. It's worth maybe $50, but we paid $250 – which is far too much for what was offered. The facilities were outdated, hotel was full of insects, and even the food was below average. The only good thing was the beautiful view, but that alone doesn't justify the high price. Definitely not worth the money.
title: $260 for a $50 Experience – Very Disappointing

roomTip: Avoid the restaurant
text:
A good view and nice staff however we were given dirty towels and unfortunately both of us caught food poisoning from the restaurant. We are certain it was this restaurant as we ate nowhere else and the symptoms subsided after 12 hours (not a virus)

I would recommend stopping to admire the view but it feels like the best days of this hotel are past.

roomTip: Try somewhere else, although there's not much else to choose from...
text: Ella is a noisy smelly dump, but the countryside is divine, so it's a place to visit. But this hotel was rather a disappointment as everything was old: the decor, the sheets, the towels, the A/C units, etc, and the railway paraphernalia is quaint at best. There is no pool either, despite the picture. Food was OK and there is free yoga every morning.
title: Beware

roomTip: Ne choisissez pas les supposées chambres supérieures avec vu sur le jardin
text:
À la lecture des commentaires dithyrambiques, nous avons choisi cet hôtel pour passer deux nuits à Ella. Comment peut-on faire tant d’éloges à un hôtel moyen de gamme aux tarifs d’un 5 étoiles ? Nous nous posons encore la question.

A part la vue depuis le jardin et les fruits du petit-dejeuner, rien ne justifie ce tarif de 268$ la nuit. Accueil classique avec une serviette froide pour se laver les mains et un ramequin de soupe coriandre + gougère dans le jardin, plutôt encourageant. 

Chambre so called supérieure avec vue jardin (voir photo) de tôle ondulée, magnifique et surtout au niveau de la seule route très passante donc bruit permanent. Decoration effectivement sur le thème du train mais avec des meubles noirs abîmés, télé minuscule, literie correcte, placards sans lumière dans le couloir donc on n’y voit rien. Wifi ok et safety box.

Salle de douche avec porte double battant qui claque (pour ne pas nous réveiller mutuellement la nuit nous avons du bloquer un battant avec une chaise) et ne reste pas ouverte, amenities bas de gamme, VMC extrêmement bruyante. Joints moisis…..basique sale. 

Pas de salle de sport mais un cours de yoga à 6h dans le jardin, pas de piscine. Le 1er soir, nous avons subi la flûte de pan du dîner que nous entendions. 

Petit-déjeuner décevant avec peu de choix (pain sous plastique humide, viennoiseries industrielles à l’huile, trois offres chaudes et pas de spécialités sauf un curry de poisson sans riz). Seuls les fruits étaient bons et variés.

Cerise sur le gâteau : lorsque nous avons quitté la chambre la 1ere journée, la réception nous a demandé si le personnel devait faire la chambre pour notre seconde nuit !!!! Nous ne savions pas qu’un hôtel ne faisait pas les chambres….nous voyageons beaucoup et c’est bien la première fois que la question est posée.

Bref, pour ce prix, c’est vraiment de l’arnaque. Nous sommes vraiment déçus.
title: Pour 268$ la nuit, courage allons voir ailleurs…

text:
My wife and I originally booked EKHO Ella for one night, planning to extend our stay for another two nights based on the glowing reviews about their service. Unfortunately, the experience we had did not meet those expectations.

Firstly, my wife attempted to call the hotel several times before our arrival, but no one answered. This lack of responsiveness gave us a bad first impression and ultimately influenced our decision to leave after just one night. We chose to move to 98 Acres Resort instead, which turned out to be a much better choice with exceptional service.

While EKHO Ella does offer a beautiful view, it simply does not justify the $350 per night price tag. The fresh fruit juices we ordered were watery and tasteless, and the food quality was mediocre at best. To make matters worse, we found cockroaches in our bed, and the bathroom was unhygienic, with a strong odor and visible urine stains. This level of cleanliness is unacceptable for a property in this price range.

Another disappointment was their bar service. Although the property has a bar, they informed us that they do not serve beer. What was most frustrating is that they didn’t offer any alternatives, such as cocktails or wine. This lack of initiative led us to dine at Café UFO in the city center, where we had a much better experience.

In conclusion, apart from the view, EKHO Ella offers very little value for money. We cannot recommend this property, especially when far superior options like 98 Acres Resort are available nearby.
title: Disappointing Experience – Not Worth the Price

roomTip: Book a room only option and eat in town!
text:
This is very hard as the hotel staff are lovely but this is one to avoid in my opinion.
On arrival I booked a deluxe room with a Mountain View and was given a basement room to a wall and a ladder I had to climb up to view the mountain. 
This cost $280 for a night so I was expecting a great place bearing in mind I could have stayed at the Anassa Wellness spa for the same price down the road. 

We were booked in for the half board package and as soon as they told me it was a bbq buffet I feared the worse.
It was realised as it was awful. 
Crab bisque was like warm and I had half a spoonful.
Curry was cold! 
Potato croquets cold!
Spaghetti cold

We stay 2 mins and declined eating any more and left to a fabulous restaurant called URO in the village. 

The views of the mountain are incredible and the rooms are spacious and clean.

Unfortunately I made the wrong choice for a one night stop. 

Ella is a backpackers stop off and the town is lovely and the best we have seen so far in Sri Lanka .

If I was the manager I would refund the half board option at a minimum but he offered me a bottle of wine! No thanks .
title: Extremely disappointing in Ella

roomTip: The suite has a private Jacuzzi but other rooms are just basic. Avoid booking rooms in the ground and underground sections. No views at all!
text: Its situated in a nice location and the hotel itself is built with a train ride concept. However the hotel seems to be run down. Service isn't the greatest. Rooms are not maintained and cleaned. We had to get them to clean the floor again as it was so dirty. If the management can revamp this entire place with a bunch of motivational staff, this place could do wonders.

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Sir,

We are sorry to hear your experience at EKHO Ella, We appreciate you reaching out and we’re sorry to learn that our service has fallen short of the level you deserve. We take all reviews seriously and will use them in our continuous improvement efforts. 

We look forward to welcoming you again and serving you better.

EKHO Hotels & Resorts Management Team
text:
My recent stay at the Ekho Hotel in Ella, Sri Lanka, left much to be desired. While the view of Ella Gap was indeed stunning, that's where the positives ended, and my disappointment began.

Firstly, the price we paid for a two-night stay, totaling over $600, was incredibly steep for what we received. We expected a level of luxury and comfort befitting the price tag, but unfortunately, our expectations were far from met.

Upon entering our room, we were immediately disheartened by the disrepair and lack of attention to detail. Stains on the bed runner were an unwelcome sight, and the bathroom amenities were a collection of unbranded, generic products haphazardly thrown into a box, not at all what one would expect from a supposedly upscale hotel.

The shower in the bathroom barely worked, and to add insult to injury, it had visible rust stains, which made the overall experience far from pleasant. For the cost we paid, we certainly expected better maintenance and standards.

With our patience waning, we decided to request an early check-out, opting to leave one day before our planned departure. The only saving grace was the man at the front desk, who, upon seeing the pictures we took of our room, displayed kindness and understanding. He offered us a refund for the second night of our stay, acknowledging the disappointing state of the accommodation.

However, even with the partial refund, I must stress that the room we booked was supposedly a "JUNIOR SUITE," and it failed to live up to any sense of luxury or value. The overall experience at the Echo Hotel did not justify its exorbitant price tag.

To make matters worse, we found refuge in the 5-star Shangri-La Hotel in Colombo for a night, paying $100 per night less than what we spent at the Echo Hotel. The stark contrast in quality and value between the two hotels was evident, and it further solidified our belief that Ekho Hotel is grossly overpriced for the experience it offers.

In conclusion, I must caution other travelers against choosing Ekho Hotel in Ella. While the view may impress, the overall state of the rooms and the exorbitant cost make it a highly disappointing choice. I recommend exploring alternative accommodation options that offer more value for money and a higher level of comfort.
title: The Biggest Disappointment of our Week in Sri Lanka

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Skyler,
Greetings from EKHO Ella!
First and fore most thank you for choosing our hotel EKHO Ella and for taking the time to write a review! 

We would like to express our apologies that you have a negative experience in our hotel. 

Kindly be advised that our team is working on the case and escalated it to the management for immediate action to ensure that this incident is not repeated again and follow up accordingly.

Allow me kindly invite you to contact me personally to discuss this with you further to sharika.silva@ekhohotels.com

We hope your next stay at EKHO Ella will be more pleasant stay and looking forward to welcoming you back again.

Warm Regards,
EKHO Hotels & Resorts | Management Team
text:
The view is very good, from up top. Not much of a view if you have lower room.  I like the room theme of a train journey. The room was very clean, but we had a few issues. The bed was the smallest bed I have ever tried to sleep on, didn't get much sleep the two nights we stayed. For the amount of money spent to stay here there should be a bit bigger beds. Felt like I was going to fall off bed if I rolled over at night. 
Our room phone did not work so we could not contact reception if we needed something.
Every time we went through reception area there was nobody there. When wanted to check out we had to wait for them to call and track down receptionist.
We booked with half board, dinner was horrible no flavor/ seasoning to food, only ate a few bites, was the same at breakfast time. We ended up eating out for dinner the next night and skipped breakfast the following morning of checkout.
There were a few other things but they are minor.
A simple redesign of room to include beds that are a decent size would make this place much better. A good trim of grass / ivy area down below to open up view for those staying in the down area would help also. The seats  view down below you can only see the ivy fence from seat.
And some simple seasoning or something else for the food. Papaya juice and tea was not even good either 
But for now just based on the experience I had in my opinion till these things are addressed only 1-2 stars if you include the view.
I was wanting to go to little adams peak and a few other places after waking up this morning but with the bad sleep the last two nights I was to exhausted to do so.
Local wildlife is nice to see, birds, mongoose, monkeys
title: Good view but...

text: This is a very dated and dirty hotel charging you like a five star hotel, I booked the junior suite but was so disappointed how dirty the hotel was and very tired and old, we didn't use the towels and the jacuzzi in our room because it was so dirty. Loom for another hotel there are much newer hotels in ella.
title: Very old and tired rooms look for another hotel

text:
I should have been more suspicious given the limited number of reviews, but the Tripadvisor Traveller’s Choice 2021 award gave me some confidence, though admittedly I have no idea what the award  means. In any event, there is no way this is the best hotel in Ella. Somehow none of the five star reviews mention that the hotel is located on a bend in the road so you have traffic on three sides of the hotel, with all the honking and rumbling of trucks and buses that entails, all night and all day. 

The entrance to the lower section of the hotel looks like a car park, as do the hallways. The pillows are synthetic and hard, shower weak, furnishings shabby but not chic. The steak we had at the restaurant was inedible, though the fish was fine. Service was friendly, but given the generally exceptional level of service in Sri Lanka, that’s not saying much. 

It seems to me there is some serious TripAdvisor algorithm manipulation going on.
title: Something fishy

Thank you very much for your rating and review. We appreciate you taking the time to highlight your experience at the property.

Our Sincere apologies for the inconvenience experienced at the property.

text:
Hotel is in a central location and has nice views however the rooms are in need of a makeover.  They’re a bit grimy with broken tile, mold in the bathrooms and outdated furniture.  

Staff is pushy and made a number of mistakes to disrupt my stay.  I’d recommend looking elsewhere.
title: Staff is pushy and incompetent.  Nice location and views

ownerResponse/text:
Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay at Glenross Living. We are pleased to know that you were amazed by the magnificent views surrounding the property, the beautiful room and its cleanliness. 

Our apologies to have kept you waiting to check-in on arrival. While inquiring on the matter, I was informed by the head butler that you had arrived an hour earlier that the usual check-in time; which also had been a busy time for the team, serving other guests whilst also attending to the ones getting ready for departure. It was also brought to my attention that the room boy had offered you the comfort of staying in the living room adjacent to the plunge pool in the first floor of your villa, while he was getting the room ready, but you had opted to take a stroll down the pathway in the estate.
 
Our team of culinary experts strive to create a rich dining experiences by producing some of the finest dishes, which have also been highly complimented by many of our guests, but we are sorry to know that none of what we offered had gone well with you.

Although this experience seem to have not lived up to your expectations we appreciate you taking the time to share your thoughts. Nevertheless, we at Glenross do our best to deliver services to all our guests with much attention and care.

Shamil Samad
General Manager
text:
We visited this location over the long weekend, hoping to enjoy the stay. The villas and the location was nice. The villas were clean and the views were amazing. Couple of staff members including Ajith were inviting and adhering to our needs.

However,  from the time we entered the property, we were kept waiting for one thing or another. Initially we waited at the car park nearly 10 min  till the buggy arrived to pick us up in order to go up to the bungalow. We had lunch and then waited for about 30min( 2-2.30pm) for the room to be ready so we could check in. The following day after breakfast we were again kept waiting from 10.45-11.50 as the room was not cleaned. We walked up and down the property and waited for an hour! Their staff are extremely slow. Was utterly disappointed about this. 

Next and most important issue was the food. It was not up to standard. For the price of 1 night we got very mediocre food which lacked flavour and choice. We received bland food including seafood which was WAY overcooked. Our 2 night stay wasn’t very satisfactory due to the food not being up to par. Would want the chefs Aruna, Upul,  Tharidu and Ranjith to look into this matter and improve for the sake of their future guests.
title: Long weekend getaway

ownerResponse/text:
Hello Zainab,

Thank you for your review. 

Firstly, please accept our sincere apologies to the delayed response on our part as there were a number of investigations that took place regarding this incident. 

However, as a policy we have taken all measures to inform all our guests during the check in process which includes a room introduction, to place their valuables and belongings in the safety box provided. Provided that the protocols were in place, and a client lost their belongings, we would always give first priority to conduct an inquiry and sort the matter out provided the guest brings the incident to our notice either while they reside at the property or at worst during the day of checkout (even a few hours later is understandable). In this instance we were brought to notice that the belongings were not in place two days after checking out from the hotel, where we are completely unable to take responsibility of the two days a guest spent elsewhere besides the property “Glenross Living”. Given the circumstance, the General Manager nonetheless investigated this incident, however was unable to come up with a conclusion. We hope you understand that we have done our best from our end given the limitations in this scenario. 

Secondly, a turndown service is provided in a hotel as a gesture to create a relaxing post-evening ambiance for a client in order to enjoy a good night’s rest. Gestures such as bringing down the blinders, dimming of lights, refreshing of washrooms, setting up of beds for the night, replacements of used water bottles are some of the services that are provided. The hotel maintains a strict record of the individuals assigned and entering each and every room to maintain order and discipline with the services that we offer. The clients are provided with door tags that gives them an option to express their view on if they do not want the to be disturbed. 

I hope you do understand our situation with this incident.
text:
I’d booked Glenross to celebrate my birthday and it really was a stunning location. The food was delicious and staff, warm & welcoming. Little did we know, they had other plans for us. 

We checked in around 3 pm and requested for dinner by 7. We’d only used the pool during that time. Yet, we returned back to a cherry-picked clean room. The bed was clean with all the blinds down but the wet towels still in the same place as we’d left it. We thought this was strange and inquired about it. Apparently, it was their turn down service. However, absolutely no mention of this to us. That they will be entering our room at night to steal money and then pretend like it didn’t happen, again cherry-picked. (Will get back to this in a bit) 

We’d been to so many hotels and never had our room cleaned at night, just after we’d checked in. (Unless requested) I’d left some jewelry and my wallet inside my handbag when we went to dinner that night because we weren’t expecting anyone, right. Came back from dinner with a fever and went right to sleep. The next morning, had breakfast and checked out to head home. 

Only once we’d reached home and I had to pay for something, I reached for my wallet. I took some rupees out and noticed that there were lesser notes but didn’t pay too much attention to it until later when I decided to check all the compartments of my wallet. An area that had 3 hundred dollar notes now only had 1 note. Separately, the rupee section was missing a total of 6500 rupees with various denominations. This person had conveniently taken a couple of notes from different compartments so it wouldn’t be noticed. Note that from the time the money went missing to when I found out about it, the bag with my wallet inside was in my sight the whole time. 

This was immediately reported to Glenross’s manager, Mr.Grenville and to the Glenross head office too. Mr.Glenville requested for 2 days to sort this out and get back to me with a solution. The head office was to call me back so I could speak to a supervisor in charge as I was terribly upset. We’d lost close to a 100,000 rupees at a hotel that was supposedly one of the best. Until today, we’ve had no call back from the head office with no reply to my emails. As for Mr.Glenville, he rightfully got back to me within 2 days only to tell us that there was no solution except for us to file a complaint with the police and that they were okay with that. His tone had no sense of remorse. 

This was more than having money stolen from you. I felt violated. Someone had gone through my belongings, disrespected my privacy and Glenross Living did nothing to help.
title: Unforgettably painful

ownerResponse/text:
At Glenross Living, we take pride in our commitment to providing exceptional customer service and it is disappointing to hear that we fell short of your expectations. We appreciate your feedback and will use it to improve our services and procedures.

Please accept our sincere apologies for the inconvenience caused, and we hope we can have the opportunity to welcome you back to our hotel and provide you with the exceptional experience that we strive for
text:
I wanted to book the Pool Villa at Glenross Living, Kalutara, for one night on the 30th of December 2022. After getting in touch with a representative from the Hotel, I was sent the booking email around 4:00pm on the 29th and required to pay 50% of the total amount as an advance payment. I then made the payment that night (on the 29th around 9.30pm).

I then received confirmation of the booking on the 30th morning, at 10:00am. Around 11:00am, the next day (30th) which was the date on which we were travelling, the Hotel called me as I left the house and informed me that the room was already booked by another party. 
Assuming the other party was also required to make an advance payment, that would entail that the management had already received their advance payment yet was not aware of the same. 

Nevertheless, I was informed by the hotel that my refund would be made immediately (which should be the 30th, i.e., the date of my booking). I provided my bank details on that very day at 1:15pm. 
 
Fast forward to today (5th of January 2023) and I have still not received my refund despite numerous calls and attempts to obtain my refund every day. Constant excuses were provided for the delay. Not only are their staff severely incompetent in handling bookings, they are also very slow in rectifying their blunders. Glenross has by far the worst customer service! Absolutely no attention nor care for a person’s time and money.
title: Unreliable Service!

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Prabha K,

Thank you for your recent review and for the positive comments made about the location and the setting. 

We are concerned that you were not entirely happy with the cuisine and few other aspects and we have addressed the concerns raised with our culinary team and housekeeping. We are sure that the team will learn from this feedback.

Though we opened our property recently in these challenging times, we are determined to get all aspects of product and service similar to our sister properties. 

We thank you for the time taken to explain the concerns and we will spare no efforts to address these concerns so that the excellent ambience complements the cuisine and the service.
 
We are delighted to hear about your plans for a visit later, and look forward to welcoming you back.
text:
My wife wanted to go to this place & I was pleasantly surprised hearing there's a 50%-off offer going on when she made the reservation.

The location is just amazing, so is the building and the setting overall! It's just amazing!! The staff was also really friendly & caring. They were also kind enough to prepare a breakfast item that was not originally on the menu for me.

The room did not have facial tissues, so we had to request one. Toilet tissue roll was also half-gone. We had to request the napkins as well for the breakfast although the cuisine needed napkins. There were two 5-course meals (we stayed one night full-board), the vegetables in all dishes were over-boiled and the soup - I literally burnt my tongue. I just kept these to myself instead of complaining, because this is a time everyone in the country is struggling. Tourism is one of the hardest-hit. I just felt happy as I'm in a way contributing to the country by taking this trip, though it is just one drop into a larger ocean... My patience went out of the window when the guy brought a full-size fried rice as the 'main course' for the 5-course lunch. I selected that as it was supposed to be a Thai rice, but there wasn't anything Thai in it - it's pretty much the same fried rice you can purchase from almost anywhere in Colombo for a buck or two.

I don't know whether any of these things are intentional with the half-price package. After all, it is for a different market segment who might actually come looking for fried rice (no disrespect intended to anyone). 

I asked for the menu again - the name is delicately worded where you can legally argue that it's actually fried rice and it's the eggs that came from Thailand :-) 

This looks like a serious business and I don't know why they have to go this cheap. In any case, would like to pay 100% price and come back someday for a proper stay!
title: Please make 50% offer optional if that helps...!

ownerResponse/text:
Thank you so much for taking the time to leave us a review.

Manager
Glenross Living, Kalutara
text:
I've never given a hotel such a low score on this site, but I feel like Glenross deserves it absolutely. Almost everything that could go wrong, did.

The location is poor. It's much more isolated than the website suggests (according to the website, the drive to the airport is two hours, but our driver said it was more like 4.5hrs), and the last 20 minutes is up a single-lane rutted track with no barrier - our driver was really worried about damaging his car, but he just had to keep going as there was no way to turn around. Then when we arrived, the room, while certainly both prettily decorated and huge, had neither air-conditioning nor wifi, even though we booked it through an agent having been told it had both (a dongle was offered, but it didn't work). It was also very poorly cleaned, with a dead cockroach on the floor, hundred of ants, dead and alive, in the bathroom, and a bathroom window that looked like it had never been cleaned. Dinner was awful - inedibly salty soup, overcooked barbequed food with cheap salads, and fruit salad - and priced at a ridiculous 3,000 rupees each (our other guesthouse meals ranged from 1,000 to 1,600 rupees). The breakfast bread was stale and hard as cardboard, and the omelette was raw inside. The door handle fell off, so if when one of us was in the bathroom, the other had to let them out - the staff couldn't fix it. One of the plug points was coming away from the wall and sparked when we tried to plug things into it. We couldn't sleep because of the heat.
 
I would say, though, that the staff were all very kind and did everything they could to help, but it was obvious that there was no professional hotel manager on site. 

We had booked for two nights before flying home, expecting a relaxed getaway, but left after one night, hot, stressed and upset. We had been offered a change of room to one of the two rooms with a/c, but we'd just had enough by that point. I've delayed writing this review until our agent had a response from Glenross - the result was a complete refund for both nights, which I think was only fair.
title: An awful experience

text:
After a long day of activity from our group tour with Exodus Travel, my family turned in around 9:30pm. At 10:30pm my wife is awoken from the doorbell on the room. With nobody answering, the person entered the room with a hotel key, my wife realized what was happening, and the person exited the room.

We called the reception who called the hotel manager to review the security camera footage. They came to my room with the culprit and claimed it was a bellboy with a room service delivery who came to the wrong room. I had no way to validate this as the footage was not offered.

My wife is now completely freaked out thinking someone is going to rob or kill us in our sleep and this whole situation could have been resolved by 1) not giving waitstaff master access to all rooms 2) training staff accordingly to identify the correct room for orders 3) directing staff to call when the door is not answered for a food delivery. I would almost never give such a rating, but in this situation, there is a clear, unacceptable gap in the sense of safety that guests of this hotel expect as short term residents.
title: Late Night Room Entry - Possible Attempted Break-in
