ownerResponse/text:
Dear Sir,
We regret very much for your comments and it's a policy of our hotel and other hotels as well, when you make a booking through booking.com they take the full payment in advance and that's the reason they request for the credit card details, otherwise any one can
make the booking and cancel it at any time they wish, ultimately the hotels will lose the opportunity of selling the rooms.
text: My last hotel to stay after my 3 week stay in Sri Lanka. Very hotel had its flaw- when i checked in here I thought wow. First impression great, located next to the beach with a beautiful sea view. The next day is where it all started! A miscommunication regarding about payment, I was not surprised they would take the full payment as soon as I checked in. It’s a first for me, this usually happens at check out at every hotel I stayed at. The reception staff did not make this clear- I even asked, ‘anything to pay?’ Upon my arrival. He stated “no”. He should have said, “no as the balance has been taken already.” As he wasn’t clear, this caused inconvenience for me as I changed all my money to rupees so I can pay for the hotel, so I can avoid using my card as direct debits are due out. After speaking to the manager about this, he hasn’t done anything. Still reeling about this, I have breakfast the next day. Just to find an uncooked chicken sausage! It’s raw as anything and pink in the middle. (See the photo). My 4 year old son was about to eat that. After complaining about that, the manager brushed it under the carpet and walked away. No apology from anyone- manager or chef no one! They advertise a man cave with pool table facilities in the lift, booking.com and on he leaflets. Nothing! Wifi is poor and also had a fiasco regarding room service. THe menu clearly states when you order a curry, you receive a rice dish and 3 vegetables dishes. That’s not the case, you have to pay extra for the 3 vegetable curries and rice. Not clear at all and again no apology. This hotel has taken the gloss off my holiday and I will not be returning to this hotel ever. Anyone reading this please take this advice into consideration! There are many other hotels in Colombo that you can book and get value for money. Read my review on GOH hotel in Colombo- that place has been there since the British ruled the country and its a better hotel than this! No care or hospitality- because they took my money before entering the hotel. Disgusted!
title: Started great....finish was terrible!

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Sir,
I regret to inform you that I did inquired in to your complaint and as soon as I met you I apologized to you personally,
text:
We stayed at this hotel twice during our Sri Lanka holiday, first at the beginning from 18-19 May'18 and then again 28-29 May'18. During our first stay my son and myself stayed in room no 510 and before going to sleep he enjoyed the music and slid his headphones under the pillow as per his habit, which he forgot to pick up while checking out. After apporx. 1 hr on the road to Habarana, he realized his mistake and we immediately got in touch over phone with the reception. And here our ordeal began, and after several calls we were very casually told by the lady that they couldn't locate it. During our second stay, I requested a meeting with the manager. A gentleman met us on 29 May and his business card read as "Ronald Perera, CEO".  Though I didn't want to create a fuss over it, but at the same time I wanted to make a strong point that he must seriously look into the issue and try to identify the culprit and punish. Today it was JUST a headphone costing USD 100, but the same person could put them in serious trouble sometime in future. The gentleman listened to me patiently and very casually thanked me to bringing it to his notice. He didn't even feel the need to apologize for the inconvenience caused. Surprisingly he seemed to be a qualified hospitality professional because his card mentioned his qualification as " FCHSGA (SL), M.I.H(U.K)".

After returning home, I wrote an email to him after a few days to check whether something was done in this regard. Again, I didn't receive any communication whatsoever from him. At this point I decided to put a feedback on TripAdvisor as a cautionary warning to the people who chose this hotel for their stay.

Rooms were nice, offering beautiful views of the sea shore. Across the road and on the seashore is a railway line-local trains run through it from early morning till late evening. Whenever a train passes by, you will hear some noise even on 7th floor, but I didn't find it that disturbing. Food is reasonably fine.
title: Be Careful with Your Belongings

placeInfo/address: Thaala Bentota No. 20, Hotel Road, Bentota, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
text:
We visited Tala Bentota on January 15th for dinner at 8:30 PM, dining at the outdoor bar upstairs. While the setting initially seemed promising, the overall experience was highly disappointing.

We ordered a cheesy burger, a couple of beers, and a fruit salad. Unfortunately, the quality of the food was far below expectations. The fruit salad was nothing more than small dices of watermelon, papaya, and pineapple – no garnish, lime, or effort to enhance its appeal. The cheesy burger was equally disappointing. Despite its name, it featured only a basic slice of cheese on a chicken patty, lacking flavor and any creativity in preparation.

Although the server was humble and polite, he did not address our feedback about the burger. When we mentioned that it was not up to standard, he simply smiled and said "okay" before retreating to a corner to use his phone, showing little regard for our concerns.

A manager in full black attire briefly visited the area but left without interacting with guests or supervising the service. Furthermore, the washroom facilities were unclean and in dire need of housekeeping attention.
title: Unhappy

roomTip: Es gibt keinen Privatstrand. Die Sonnenschirme und Liegen sind nicht vom Hotel. Yoga wird nicht jeden Tag angeboten sondern 2 x pro Woche
text:
wir hatten ca. 6 Monate vorher ein Deluxe Zimmer für 8 Nächte mit All inclusive über DERTOUR gebucht über über 3000 Euro gebucht. Es war der Abschluss unserer 15 tägigen Privatrundreise. Wir wollten hier zum Abschluss entspannen und Ayuveda machen. Wir sind am 28.12.2024 angereist. Leider hatte das bei unserer Ankunft nur noch 2 schlechte deluxe-Zimmer zur Auswahl. Eines direkt im lauten Eingangsbereich (Zimmer 205) neben der Rezi in der 1. Etage mit kleinem Dachfenster und ein zweites , kleines Zimmer in der Ecke neben dem Restaurant und viel kleinerer Terrasse. (Zimmer 100) Hier befindet sich der Durchgang der Angestellten zum Restaurant. Das ist auch nicht leiser. Aber was sollten wir machen. Man bot uns an am nächsten tag ein beseres Zimmer zu bekommen. Aber damit nicht genug. Als wir dann die Unterkunft erkundeten und uns in ein Restaurant setzten, hören wir die ganze Zeit Motordrachen über das Hotel fliegen. Von Ruhe auch hier keine Spur. Auf die Frage, ob die hier jeden Tag herumfliegen, erfuhren wir, es wäre der einzige Strand wo das hier erlaubt sei. Die Reiseleitung Ort war hier ebenfalls keine Hilfe. 
Da wir über 5 Nächte hier sind, war eine kostenlose Massage inklusive. Als wir bei Spa danach fragten, erfuhren wir, dass diese nur 15 Minuten dauert, nur für eine Person ist (obwohl wir beide ja einen pro Person Preis bei DERTOUR bezahlt hatten). Eine Frechheit. 
Außerdem hört man den die Diesellok gleich hinter Hotel vorbeifahren.

Wir sind total enttäuscht und würden dieses Hotel nicht weiterempfehlen.
title: Erholung findet man hier eher nicht

text: Our travel agent had booked us a deluxe room with three extra beds since we are a family of 5 (youngest 4 years old). We kept asking for the bed that we had paid for through our agency and in the end asked if at least we could get some sheets so that one could sleep on the couch. They agreed since "our comfort is their highest priority" - well, apparently not as high a priority as their bed policy.. 😞

placeInfo/address: Thaala Bentota No. 20, Hotel Road, Bentota, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Try somewhere else.
text:
This hotel purports to be 4.5* . No way, this is a 3* at best.
Positives - lovely people, waiters, pool guys and ground staff. Reception not so good. The room, when we eventually got what we wanted, was really good and well looked after. The Hotel grounds and the beach were beautiful and very clean.
Room - Deluxe Room. First floor have a very cramped balcony with a poor view. Ground floor Deluxe same dimensions but a huge terrace.
Food offering is very poor. The buffet is awful and repetitive using very cheap produce. The a la carte option is served in Chatters which is really a pool bar with the food cooked in a kitchen some 60' from the table and has to be carried across having been left on the counter, hence it was never really hot. One saving grace was that were able to order fresh fish on three nights but at an extra cost of around £80.  
The Frangipani Restaurant that was supposed to be the main a la carte restaurant was closed as it was deemed unsafe! 
All inclusive wine was white or red served from a 3 litre box. No alternatives and no Rose. All soft drinks in the room fridge were charged as extra!
The hotel offers no information on tours or the local area but Shiran Tours on the beach is reliable, good value and honest.
No umbrellas in the room which can be needed with the current weather.
Not enough sun beds with umbrellas and those that were available on the garden and around the pool were quickly reserved with the usual towels/book on the bed at around 7.00am.
The large majority of guests were Russian or Latvian some of whom thought that is was acceptable to go to dinner in a vest/singlet, despite a notice at the entrance asking gusts not to.
This is a second visit to Sri Lanka where, on our first time, we toured so have experience of other hotels 
All in all a major disappointment.
title: Three star at best!

text: The Chatter is pleasant but very highly priced. I ordered a seafood pizza. It was possibly the worst I've ever had. The only discernible flavour was tomato paste. Mozzarella with not the slightest flavour or saltiness. No herbs other than 3 thyme leaves on top. No garlic. No olive oil. Miniature cubes of tasteless "seafood" the texture of rubber - possibly calamari or cuttlefish. No prawn. No fish. No anchovy. Crisp on the outside and soggy in the middle indicative that it was cooked in a conventional oven. To the credit of management, as I ate just a single slice they did not charge me. So disappointing. I'd been looking forward to it.

placeInfo/address: Thaala Bentota No. 20, Hotel Road, Bentota, Bentota 80500 Sri Lanka
text:
27/03/2023 - 06/04/2023
After reading the reviews about Thaala previously known as Avani Bentota, my sister and I were so excited to be staying at this resort. However, I am sad to say I will not be returning or recommending it after our experience. 

ROOM
After a 22hour journey from the UK, arriving at 22:25, we found that even after 5 emails requesting a twin room sent in advance to bentota@avanihotels.com, the email advertised on their website, that we were still booked into a standard room with one bed. We expressed this to the Thaala/Avani Bentota reception staff and manager Hiren at check in, only to be told they cannot do anything about it now, they will change our room in the morning when other guests have checked out. Not what you want to hear on your first night when feeling exhausted. 
The next day, we were told the same thing and were not moved into a new room. It was not until day 3 of our trip, once again 21:53 at night, after a day's excursion were we moved into the superior twin room we had booked and paid for. 

CLEANLINESS/ HYGIENE 
When finally moved to our new room, housekeeping had to be called 5 times as the sheets put on the beds were filthy and soiled! Not what you would expect at a 5-star resort. Each sheet that was laid on the bed had red, green or black blotch stains on them. If not stains, then they were torn or holey. I could not understand this. I would be standing next to the Thaala/ Avani Bentota staff member, seeing stains the size of my palm or worse, yet he continued to lay the bed unless I said, "sorry this one is also stained". I was perplexed as to why the hotel even retained these sheets, let alone thought them acceptable for guests to sleep in or on.
As a result, we then had to return to our first room for the night because it got so late, and we just needed to sleep. For the rest of the trip, every day, the bedsheets had to be checked and usually changed, as it was clear any old sheets were used to dress the beds. Whether clean or dirty. The next morning, we did not hear a word from the manager Hiren about an alternate room change, or for the rest of our stay. I spoke to Hiren and said to him this is not what I expect. It feels like this is being done on purpose because the sheets are indisputably dirty. It was only after speaking with another guest, who informed us that they were given new sheets that, again I ask for another set of sheets and was provided brand new bedsheets. This was on day 7 of our trip! 
This kind of treatment from Thaala/ Avani Bentota staff, makes you feel like you are being a difficult or fussy guest, when quite clearly brand new, unused sheets were available in the hotel and could have saved a whole week of unnecessary discomfort. No one pays to stay in any resort to feel this way, let alone a 5-star hotel.
title: Sorely disappointing

Stayed at this resort recently, the beach and ground of the hotel are nice but on the pricey side for what you get.  However 2 main issues which would stop me returning:

1: some of the staff who hang around reception are quite rude and militant, they dont know what customer service is

2. Right outside the hotel a taxi mafia operates, they come onto Avani property and the hotel is obviously complicit in their scams.  The mafia will physically attack and abuse your driver unless its booked through them, but their prices are extortionate.  Do not use these taxis and tuk tuk standing outside

I much prefer the south of SL rather than staying in these resorts and experience of Avani simply reinforces this.
title: Would not recommend

text:
This has to be the worst hotel ever  , I now suspect these good reviews were fake. We arrived to what looks like an amazing posh hotel to be shown to a superior room  , but five minutes later we had a courtesy call from reception and I said the room 224 has a smell of damp and the shower also had damp stains . We were shown another room which also had damp and finally another room with the least smell 116 ,but they had sprayed with air freshener which soon disappeared. I suspect air conditioning issues so we used the fan for our whole stay to minimise the smell
After 30 minutes our suitcases weren’t delivered so we collected them ourselves.
There is also a loud train with horns blaring  that passes and sounds like it’s next door from 5am till late. After my evening meal , which was of poor standard and service except waiter Buddika and Maneesha. You clearly get some service depending on the colour of your skin .Reception asked about my issues and I was honest with him , the managers from housekeeping and catering arrived and I could tell they just were not interested or wanting to admit there were any issue and when asked surely others have reported this issue the manager was in denial offering yet another room.
Our room was near reception so was could hear noise most of the evening and morning from reception and cleaners  . Even the cheapest hostel is better than this awful hotel and I have stayed in 6 other hotels in Sri Lanka on this trip and this is the most expensive and worst
No approach from the manager to even address the problems , shocking maintenance of hotel facilities  .The only reason I didn’t leave on arrival is that I had been travelling for 12 hours . The pictures say it all and this was a superior room
title: Worst hotel ever

placeInfo/address: Kimbula Thona Kalkudah Beach, Kiran 30000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: The pool is very nice....
text:
Dear Avanti 

Hope your well.

As requested with regards to our stay at your hotel...we regrettably would like to further inform you of our unfortunate experiences:

Where do we start...?

1ST INCIDENT 
ROBERT - GENERAL MANAGER 
We arrived at approximately 2030 / 28th August 2023 and was met by Robert - General Manager.  We mentioned the Roads leading up to the Hotel was very bumpy dark and not sufficient Signage towards Hotel...Despite this...my Husband and I found the Ride leading up to Hotel quite adventurous...although, upon mentioning these  facts to Mr Robert (thinking of other guests)...and also mentioning that we had tried to contact Hotel several times with different numbers to inform our estimated time of arrival without much success...all this was shrugged off and Mr Robert simply said..."oh well...your here now" with a hand gesture !

Due to bad feeling from beginning...all throughout our stay bad experiences just spiralled...day after day...

2ND INCIDENT 
Large Cockroach discovered soon after our arrival in our accommodation under fridge !
Due to our utter shock and disgust...not to mention this was now quite late in the evening on first night after arrival...we were very very tired after our long journey to Karparha Sands Hotel 8 - 10 Hours on the Road) - we had contacted Mr Robert who had mentioned he was sleeping when we called...this was the first time he had heard of Cockroaches in accommodation and not sure what he can do for us !  Unfortunately Mr Robert's flippant attitude did not help this matter and made us feel that we were not being truthful with what we saw...please see attachment !
We were eventually moved that same evening and to our shock and dismay he mentioned that we may need to move back to same Accommodation !  Which we instantly refused and mentioned we did not at all feel comfortable with this...

3RD INCIDENT 
The second Accommodation was equally worse than the first Accommodation due to its dirty appearance and other aspects as attachments...to name but a few:

- The large Tear on roof of tent which was stitched back together...

-  Very dirty stained floor mat...
- Dirty Floor with unsightly Mark's...also along edges of Tent...

-  Inadequate Shower Facilities with only Half a Turn Handle which were very stiff and required extra pressure to turn water on and off and would hurt our hands in the process...

-  Much Algae from where the water flow began and much green Algae on the wall of stone work...very unsightly for guests...

-  Toilet becoming blocked several times...

-  Large Mirror was near to the actual Toilet...and felt this should be situated near to Towel Rack on the other side...

- Insufficient Towels displayed and not always complete with correct Towels...

-  A large bunch of House Keys were left by the House Keepers in one of our Accommodation...

- Much dried and dead flowers and foliage in outside shower areas...

- Unable to visualise how shower water was being drained...didn't appear to have much of Drainage System...other than going into the Plant areas !

- Some times noticed sewage odours coming from under the Decking  !

-  No privacy from outside shower facility due gaps and Guests and Staff passing by are able to quite easily peer into Shower area !

-  There were significant gaps inbetween the Decking which lead into the accommodation which may result in certain creatures entering the room  !  We already had problems with many Flies within accommodation...

-  Mosquito / Netting missing from around bed frame / Posts...

- Outside / Infront of Accommodation - the Seating area Canopy also has Rips/Tears...

-  Water with Flowers just outside accommodation to wash away sand on feet prior to entering room...were not always available...

4TH INCIDENT 
We were moved yet again to a 3rd Accommodation where much of above situations were quite apparent and common in each Tent Accommodation...

All of the above Incidents & Experiences actually comprises and amounts to many many unfortunate experiences....

We should also mention that efforts were made upon speaking and expressing our concerns since beginning of our arrival at Karparha Sands Hotel with Avanti - Resident Customer Relations Manager...who actually also confirmed that sightings of Cockroaches have been mentioned previously despite Mr Robert's previous comments...Although by this time- we expressed that we didn't want to stay at your Hotel...as we were extremely disappointed...

Although we appreciate and can understand to certain extent situations are are not ideal after Pandemic etc...as Guests & Customers - what we have experienced is by no means a 5 Star Accommodation as described our experiences above !  This was quite apparent during the rest of our stay in Sri Lanka when we went onto visiting and staying at other 5 Star Hotels which despite the country's economic situation were very much the standards they should be with the level of Service expected from 5 Star Hotels...

Please also be advised that we had specially selected your Hotel for our Double occasion...our 10 Year Anniversary and my Birthday out of all nearby Hotels to celebrate our Special Occasions...thinking we would treat ourselves to what we thought was a 5 Star rated Hotel...especially also returning to Sri Lanka after 5 Long Years...to be sadly confronted with all of the above incidences  !   
We had booked for 4 Nights of which the first 2 Nights Days were spent moving from one accommodation to another...a total of 3 x Accommodation Moves...
Unfortunately this is certainly not a 5 Star Hotel and would honestly rate this Hotel as a 3 Star which Guests should be aware of prior to making Booking !

Dear Avanti as mentioned and requested I have now spent time and effort composing this emai and would greatly appreciate if this correspondence can be definitely forwarded to the Founders for them to acknowledge our unfortunate circumstances and to please copy me in when you forward this to them.

Thanking you for your assistance and response.

Regards 
Shantha & Ronny
title: It's definitely not THE BEST....

Robert Claesson

placeInfo/address: Kimbula Thona Kalkudah Beach, Kiran 30000 Sri Lanka
text:
During our Sri Lanka trip the Karpaha Sands was the fourth stop out of five. 

The resort was the only one that did not meet our expectations. When approaching the resort fromt he main road through gravel road, it was already dark. As the road was so extremely bumpy and not illuminated at all our experienced Sri Lanka driver had serious doubts if this track would lead to a 5 star resort. But as Google Maps doesn't lie we have stayed on the track and finally reached the resort......

Quickly our driver has been provided access to a drivers' room and we have been guided to our room. After being ready to go to bed we have seen that the bed linen was dirty and we have wondered how this could happen in a resort on this level. So instead of sleeping we have asked the staff to replace the bed linen. Also in the outside area of the accomodation we have seen in the morning that the place had not been furbished up for new guests. The cushion of the daybeds outside had not been cleaned from sun lotion and sand of the previous guests and looked like you see on the picture below. Cigarette butts beside the daybeds didn't make you want to be there...... also a cleaning of the table outside from sand etc. had to be requested on the next morning...... unfortunately we cannot say that housekeeping performed a good job.

The accomodation itself is designed nicely but you see that this is not achieved with high quality materials in most cases. So having a closer look does not make you feel to be in a luxurious environment. As a result of this you already distinktly see signs of abrasion on several things - though the resort is quite new! I worry how it will look in 2-3 years from now. Absolutely no comparison to high class resorts like Wild Coast Tented Lodge or Uga Ulagalla that we had been able to experience as well during our trip. At least the space was spacious in our accomodation.

After the first disappointments with the above mentioned we have seen the surroundings on the next morning. The beach is really stunning! The ocean was very well accessable for swimming during our stay - even for little children. The water temperature was very comfortable. We just didn't understand why daybeds had so rarely been provided around the beach area..... if your accomodation is not at the beachfront, you need to be quick in the morning to secure your daybed.

Also very nice is the design of the hotel pool. It's nicely constructed with nice looking tiles which don't appear cheap. 

The food in the restaurant was quite average and - compared to the other five star accomodations during our trip - the worst. It was "just ok". 

What we have felt during our stay was that several staff members did not seem to be happy with their jobs / the guests. We have rarely seen smiling faces from the staff. We can even state that our feeling was that there is a very strange atmosphere in the resort regarding the staff. We have never felt comfortable with this - different to any other hotel that we have stayed in during the trip.

Our driver for two weeks was always happy and very modest. But regarding the drivers' accomodation he said, that it was unacceptable - especially the sanitary environment was abominable.

Finally our experience leads into the conclusion that we cannot recommend the resort. The hardware and the location with it's surroundings is Ok with some curtailments - but the software needs to be improved urgently and severely!
title: nice location but the resort needs to be improved noticeably!

roomTip: Terrible driveway
text:
The beach itself is beautiful and spotlessly clean. However, I should say that I was against coming here in the first place as the room was essentially a glorified tent on the beach.
As it transpires, I was correct. As soon as we arrived , a snake dropped out of a palm tree and landed on the sand. Later, a similar (or perhaps the same one) jumped onto our veranda and grabbed a crab in its mouth. My wife saw a larger snake slither over a sun lounger. The tent is divided into two sections, which enables the guest to sit on the toilet and converse face to face with the other guests, in the style of the ancient Romans.
The roar of the sea is incessant throughout the night.
The driveway access to the hotel is really very poor. Also, my brother’s tent experienced several power cuts during our stay.
On the plus side, the food was very good, and I would like to thank k. Vithurshan the waiter and R. Thus he than the bartender. In fact, all the staff were friendly and helpful.
In summary, save your money and go somewhere else.
title: Ridiculously overpriced

ownerResponse/text:

placeInfo/address: Kimbula Thona Kalkudah Beach, Kiran 30000 Sri Lanka
text:
Positive:
1. Beautiful beach
2. Good entry into the ocean
3. The staff is polite and tries very hard to help, I would like to mention Kirupa and Akthar separately

Negative:
1. The hotel is located very far from the airport, the transfer takes 6-7 hours one way.
2. The room is a tent standing on the ground. The room stinks of dampness and mold. The floor in the tent is worn out, covered in many years of plaque, no one washes it, but only sweeps it. The hotel does not sanitize rooms from parasites. Huge cockroaches, 5 cm long, small frogs are constantly crawling around the room. Small insects constantly fall on the bed, which is absolutely not hygienic! At night, you can hear squirrels running on the fabric roof of the tent.
3. The toilet is leaking, which is why the room constantly stinks of sewerage.
4. Bedding with holes. In general, the room is quite dirty, constantly haunted by a feeling of unsanitary conditions.
5. The shower is presented only on the street, after you have a swim you have to walk on the stones, your feet are dirty again. A small snake was once seen between the stones.
6. There is no TV in the room.
7. On the beach, you can say on the territory of the hotel, fishermen live. Not far from the pool they have two huts in which they sleep. There is a well nearby. Fishermen drive tractors all day on the beach, it stinks of diesel. You lie on the beach sunbathing, the fishermen walk past the sun loungers and look at you, at your wife. There is no sense of security and you absolutely do not rest because of these views. On the beach technical garbage, blades are lying around. Fishermen spend the whole day on the beach, going back and forth, driving a tractor. They throw a net, and a rope goes far into the sea, and when they drive along the beach on a tractor and pull this cable, you have to get out of the sea so that they don’t cut off your head with this cable. So-so vacation… 
8. No one cuts coconuts on palm trees, and they periodically fall on the sand, which is very dangerous for tourists who simply lie under palm trees and do not assume that a coconut can fall on their heads.
9. There are no sun loungers on the beach. That is, they are only for guests of the rooms of the "Palam" category. For rooms of category "Koyala" sun loungers near the room in the garden and by the pool. That is, if you want to lie on the beach, there is no such possibility. You can lie on the sand or on creepy-looking pillows, which are also only 2 or 3 pieces.
10. Pillows on sunbeds and towels in a disgusting state.
11. They sell warm coconut in the bar. It's not my first time in a tropical country, but I'm drinking warm coconut for the first time.
12. Breakfast menu. There is no buffet. Every day they are the same. The menu says that you can order mango juice, however it is not available. The waiters explained this by the fact that now is not the mango season, while it is sold in stores. 3 sausages are served for two people, and those are soy. No ham, no cheese.
13. The restaurant has very slow service, the dish is carried from 40 to 60 minutes. Anytime, for lunch or dinner.
14. Waiters constantly mess up, forget your order, bring not what you ordered, you have to wait until your dish is cooked.
15. The food is incredibly spicy. You constantly say “not spicy”, they still bring spicy food.
16. Chipped dishes are used.
17. The restaurant is incredibly dirty. Pigeons and crows are constantly flying. Pigeons generally made a nest under the roof of the restaurant from the inside. Because of this, chairs, pillows, even appliances in bird droppings, nothing is removed, everything is dirty, no one cares. Cats sleep on pillows. The pillows are dirty and smell like cat urine.
18. The clothes of the waiters are dirty, it seems that they have not been washed for weeks.
19. General manager Robert does nothing. Doesn't go outside the restaurant. For 10 days, I have never seen him on a tour of the territory, or that he looked at least one room. He only goes to dinner and says: “Good evening. Have a good day?
20. We ordered tea, they brought us tea in bags. In a country where leaf tea is grown, they brought tea in bags!
21. On the territory, in the restaurant, in the pool there are burnt out light bulbs, no one changes them, no one cares.
22. The toilets are very dirty, there are almost never towels, there is nothing to wipe your hands with. Soap is also not always available. The toilets on the ground floor never have lights on in the evening.
23. Pigeons and crows bathe in the pool. Terrible filth and unsanitary conditions.
24. After 7 days of staying at the hotel, prices for the menu increased sharply, and not by 10%, but by 40%, for example, the old price for Seafood BBQ was 6900 LKR, the new price is 10000 LKR, an increase of 44%.
25. On the 8th day of my stay at the hotel, my body could no longer cope with the dirt in the hotel, and I caught rotavirus, spent the whole day lying in the room. Luckily I had medication with me. The hotel is in the middle of nowhere, and if you catch something, you are unlikely to be helped. First aid kit in the hotel is very poor with expired medicines.
26. Upon arrival, I wanted to pay for the transfer, the price was supposed to be 44,000 LKR in both directions, they told me that I had already paid for it and they would check it. No one has returned to me with feedback. However, when leaving, the transfer price turned into 50000LKR. I consider it an unprofessional attitude towards customers to overestimate the price at which there was an agreement earlier.
27. The transfer to the airport was in the evening, no one even offered a late check-out. Taking into account the fact that out of 17 rooms, 12 were occupied. That is, 5 rooms were free, but we were forced to vacate the room at 11:00 am.
28. Every day, especially in the evening, the lights are turned off several times. You are sitting at dinner and suddenly it is completely dark, after 1-2 minutes the generator starts.
29. There are no cameras on the territory, the security is rather weak.
title: Very durty

ownerResponse/text:
As this guest has been unresponsive to our attempts to contact them, this reply should be considered as general information in regards to this review.

By law, Sri Lanka does not have private beaches - this means that the natural beauty and splendor of the island’s beaches belongs to everyone. Fishing is a valuable industry in the country, and the fishermen from the local village have been co-existing with us in harmony for years. There is absolutely no threat to be feared from them; they go about their daily lives to provide for their families, with no disturbance to our guests or to the hotel.

As for the hotel related comments raised by this guest:
•	Our locks are of the highest quality.
•	The dish mentioned is made fresh daily in limited quantities for breakfast only. We apologized for not being able to provide said dish, and presented alternatives which were not accepted by the guest.
•	We stand by our staff, who are by nature pleasant and welcoming, and certainly not rude. As the general manager, I tried personally to apologies to the guest, but was declined - in fact, I was asked by him to not address him.
•	We have provided early check-in and a late check-out by 4 hours, and we were informed that their stay had no issues at check out. We would have done our best to address these concerns immediately had we known their thinking.

Vanakkam, 

Robert Claesson, 
General Manager

ownerResponse/text:
Thank you for taking the time to leave a detailed review, and let us know about improvements we can make. 

We would like to sincerely apologise for this misunderstanding regarding the beach BBQ; we have limited capacity to offer these special events, however this should have been properly communicated, and we would have been happy to offer the BBQ on a different night if possible. 

We hope you will allow us to make up for this and would love to welcome you back to stay with us again. We value all our guests and strive to have a perfect guest experience, and feel certain we can deliver this if you are able to visit again. 

Sincerely, 
Karpaha Sands Management
placeInfo/address: Kimbula Thona Kalkudah Beach, Kiran 30000 Sri Lanka
text:
Possibly the best view and beach in the whole East coast. Almost 5km of untouched beach stretch. We were so excited to go here. Unfortunately beyond this everything was downhill. With the resort at full capacity, one would have expected a full staff! There were literally two service staff for more than 25 ppl, the staff were not trained well at all with one waiter being extremely rude. 

The food was below average with half the things on the menus being “unavailable “. There was no manager on duty to even inquire about anything. The worst was when we wanted to order a Beach BBQ for dinner and asked them a day in advance ( as stipulated in the menus) and the response was “ some other guest have also ordered and there are only three ppl, so they can’t do it for us”. The waiter was so rude and didn’t even bother to explain to us in detail. 

We left there after one night. Such a shame that a place like Karpaha Sands is marketed in one way and what you get in terms of food and service is worse that a 3 star hotel. 
Given the location, view and beach I would def return, once the chef and service staff are trained properly. Where there should be atleast 3-4 staff per room there was 1 per 5 rooms!! 

* there was no COVID protocols- staff had no masks or gloves on. Every other resort we have been to post COVID have admirably followed safety precautions)
* there was no turndown service 
* we had to take our own bags to the rooms 
* there was no service on the beach
title: Beautiful location...nothing more

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Valued Guest, 
Greetings from Araliya Green City - Nuwara Eliya!
We regret to hear that your check-in experience did not meet your expectations. Our team at Araliya Green City is dedicated to providing professional and respectful service to every guest, and we are truly sorry if you felt otherwise.
Upon your arrival without a prior reservation, our reception team worked swiftly with housekeeping to arrange two rooms for you, despite the hotel being near full occupancy at the time.
With regard to your request to exchange damaged USD notes, we kindly explained that, in accordance with hotel policy and local banking regulations, we are unable to accept or exchange torn or defaced currency. In addition, your request for a 30% discount was respectfully declined, as our rates are fixed during peak occupancy and offered consistently to all guests to maintain fairness.
We understand that these limitations may have caused disappointment, but we assure you that our team, including Mr. Gavindu, did their best to assist you within the hotel’s guidelines. 
However, once your concerns were raised, I personally got involved in the check-in process to ensure your comfort and satisfaction. I am happy to note that by the end of the process, you expressed that you were satisfied with the service received.
We truly value your feedback and appreciate the opportunity to resolve the situation. Should you choose to visit us again, we look forward to welcoming you with the warm hospitality that we are known for.

Warm regards

Nisansala Wimalarathne
Executive - Guest Relations 
Araliya Green City – Nuwara Eliya

The room walls are paper thin and you can hear the guests in the next room talking. Bathrooms are worse - you can hear the other room shower and toilet flush very clearly.

placeInfo/address: No 01 Glen Fall Road, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text: During our stay my wife was electrocuted and received a substantial shock and burn to her hand whilst using the Hotel hair dryer in our room bathroom.  As shown in attached photograph.  Whilst Management were prompt in their attendance to the room when called, when the Hotel engineer was attending to the issue, the Managers having left the room were outside the room in the hallway have a great laugh about the matter.  The issues was identified as being an exposed wire in the handle of the hairdryer, which apparently came into contact with my wife’s hand whilst in use, causing a shock up her entire arm and burn to her hand.  One would think that regular inspection of electric items in the room should be a matter of priority and the hotels response & attitude to the matter left a lot to be desired.  Clearly safety  standards need to be addressed.  On the positive side the staff and service were great, a real shame management are allowing these safety standards to slip.
title: Electrocution occurred during our stay

placeInfo/address: No 01 Glen Fall Road, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Make sure you have the view that people rave about.  Take you own coffee and water!
text:
After reading the glowing reviews about the hotel and the room views we booked in for 2 nights but wished we had left after day one.
On check in reception told  us that they weren't busy so we asked for an upgrade. 
We found we had a view....of the petrol station......we should have complained straight away but were so tired we thought we could put up with it but surely there could have been a better room??   
We went out to eat and asked reception for some fresh milk to have with our coffee in the morning ( no coffee machine in the room) and some more water ( there were just two small bottles in the room which is barely enough to make tea or, god forbid coffee!!) On our return nothing had arrived so we thought we would just call down in the morning, its a 5 star after all.  And then the debacle began....After numerous phone calls  in the morning someone eventually arrived with a handful of various sachets of tea, powdered coffee and creamers but no fresh milk.  These were kind of useful as we then found that the container in the room that said 'coffee' only held even more creamer.....so we persevered to eventually be sent a teapot half full of lukewarm powdered coffee and loads of warm milk.  This took an hour and we couldn't drink it as it was vile.
We appreciate this is a tea region and I drink gallons of it but surely there are other people who prefer coffee in the morning??  There is a tea room in reception that has a huge coffee machine but it seems it was only used for hot water or nobody knows how to use it.
Day 2 and we tried again.....to be told twice  the coffee is on its way to then be told they only have Sri Lankan coffee. Erm....
We gave up after an hour as we were checking out then when we were in reception it started again as different staff kept asking us if we had a problem with our coffee.  We had forgotten about it by then but they were all terribly apologetic and offered to provide us with some while we waited for our taxi.    Still nothing appeared and after explaining to around 3 people I was losing the will to live.  Eventually 2 lovely coffees appeared from the food hall next door.  Hurrah. 
But this had taken 2 hours from out first call that morning.
I tried to explain that when one issue becomes such a debacle it makes any other little niggles that one would normally overlook  become a problem too.  
The windows in our room wouldn't close properly so each morning the traffic on the roundabout next to the petrol station woke us up,  these windows and frames were dirty,  the magnifying mirror light didn't work, the tap in the sink in the bathroom needed descaling,  the pot for the used teabags was really grubby.
I assume the hotel has a 5 star rating as they have a swimming pool which looked quite depressing in a small covered area but  its certainly not the service.  The staff were all really lovely and smiley but there was obviously no communication between them. Or maybe just say if a service is not possible so customers can just get on with their day rather than wait around to be misled.  We stayed in numerous hotels of various levels that we stayed at in Sri Lanka and this was the only one that we had a problem with.
We were reassured numerous times that the taxi ordered through the hotel  to take us to our next stop knew where he was going.   Guess what......
Simply bad management.
title: Disappointing

placeInfo/address: No 01 Glen Fall Road, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text:
An order was placed for a high tea buffet at Araliya Green City Nuwara Eliya at 3 p.m. January 1st 2023. We were 26 persons all together (including 5 children). We reached there on time, but we had to wait about one and half hour because the buffet was not ready at that time. We finally got only 9 items for the price of 3000 per head. And also it was only one piece of each item per person. It was a buffet in name only.  No refill. Also the bread items presented were stale. It was a bad experience for me and all of us were disappointed. We did not even get a portion that's given by high tea platters usually...We did not expect this from a highly rated 5 star hotel. After complaining to the reception they reduced the payment of 5 kids only. 

As a side note we would like to mention we went for a dinner buffet 2 months before and it was perfect and really worth it, and so we recommended it to many. This was the reason why we went there again.

But we will never recommend them again for high tea.

FAHIM ZIYAD from Beruwala
title: High tea buffet

ownerResponse/text:
Dear  Mr/Mrs  Joyece 

At the outset we wish to thank you for having stayed at the Araliya Green City Hotel, Nuwara Eliya.

Our forte has invariably been unobtrusive service and unfailing attention to all discerning Guests. We take great pride in serving all our guests.

I am sincerely sorry and please accept my apologies because were unable to reached your expected standards.

Your feedback on the faulty lighting did not go unheeded, however, the Front Desk staff member gave a room change on the same night with minimum delay. Besides, the Management was also pleased to offer you complimentary breakfasts to your family the following morning and a late checkout according to your convenience.

The issue although very inconsequential it was solved immediately and the Management has been benevolent in offering value additions as a good gesture. We hope that you will appreciate the fact the Management has exerted themselves to the best in dealing with this matter.

Therefore, in fairness we regret very much to inform you that the Hotel has not failed in the services offered to you.

We wish you and the family great health, happiness and peace.

text: We stayed Araliya Green city last weekend and and we are not happy about their service, safety and food. 1st with the reservation they mixed up big time. Once I have confirmed the booking they didn't sent any email or any confirmation until we reach to hotel. When I tried to call them to query about the reservation they are passing the call to here and there and no one is responsible about reservations. I have visited many hotels during this covid pandemic period and this is worst place that didn't follow safety guidelines. Guest are roaming in public areas in the hotel like buffet, lobby with masks and no one there to instruct them to wear face masks. Funny thing is Front office manager was also not wearing mask properly and most of the chefs in action stations were also wearing mask properly. Regarding the food they had buffet in the weekend with less varieties. They are not serving pork or any pork related foods in their buffet and I can't understand how this can be a 5 star hotel with international buffet. Foods in Sri Lankan corner is somewhat ok but western foods are zero tasty. They only have two waiters in entire buffet area and guest have to more than 10 min to fill up the water. I feel that investment of the Araliya group is wasted due to poor management of the Araliya Green city hotel. Only positive thing is they have well maintained indoor pool and gym
title: Good place with great location but need improvement in service, safety and food

ownerResponse/text:
Dear STARWalker_Family,

Greetings From Araliya Green City! 

Thank you for choosing Araliya Green City as your preferred accommodation partner in Nuwara Eliya. It was a great pleasure for us to have welcomed you.  

Firstly, please accept my sincere apologies for the apparent discomfort caused to your sleep in the night.
Nuwara Eliya is generally a very quiet town in the night as almost everyone goes to sleep by 10 pm but since the holidays are around the corner their might have been more traffic than usual contributing to noise pollution! 
Your constructive feedback on wine service has led us to immediately implement a refresher course on wine service to all my waiter staff and thank you. 

Rest assured changes necessary to minimize sound pollution has been implemented immediately with the corporation of the city traffic police and trust you would consider staying with us again as and when your travels bring you back to our great city.

Hope to welcome you back in the very near future. 

Yours Sincerely,
placeInfo/address: No 01 Glen Fall Road, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text:
The main reason for a hotel stay is to get a great nights' sleep. If we can't sleep, it really doesnt matter how friendly the staff is or how tasty the food is. Even though we were on the 3rd floor, the hotel's paper thin walls/windows let in every horn, tuk tuk engine, and conversation. When the streets finally became quiet enough, suddenly the call to prayer is blasting. Even if the noise was controlled, the curtains are sheer and the room is lit up with the sunrise. Lastly, the bathroom walls allow you to hear the conversations of your neighbors. 

Overall, service was good but our dinner waiter hovered to an awkward degree yet struggled to complete simple tasks like bringing water to the table in a timely manner. The wine I requested was only available by the bottle, fine, I'll take the bottle...he brought out three glasses, one for me and one for both my young daughters. Was confused when I stated, no wine for them. ?? 

We wouldn't stay here again and sadly will go through our day today tired and a bit frustrated.
title: Noisy room prevented sleep

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Rashmikam

Greetings from Araliya Green City !

Whilst extending our sincere apologies for the inconvenience caused and we thank you for your feedback which we greatly value in our continuous efforts to serve you better. As you have stated that the hallways are dark is because we are moving our standards into be the one of the most Eco-friendliest hotel in the country, despite of the water is not heated up to standard is doubtful as we have not received any complain with regards to the temperature of the water as it’s been a centralized system, but we will definitely look into it and take it as a constructive feedback. As a practice we always double check prior releasing the rooms for the guest but it is such an unfortunate situation to know that the kettle was not working, but indeed we will look into it as well. Furthermore we should state that the chef we have is a master chef and the most of the guest do love the buffet and its spread but we are sorry to hear that you were not satisfied with it. Please do let us know precisely what should be improved in the buffet is it the Indian spread or the action station, etc…yes far most all standard hotels in Sri Lanka by default serve hot beverages either tea or coffee as we have the finest tea & coffee in our country and that the guest can enjoy the true Sri Lankan tea or coffee and yes it is complimentary and all other additional hot beverages are charged extra which as a prestige traveler I am pretty sure you are well aware of it.

We are very surprised of your comment which reflects the overall service of our food court as it is one of guests favorite place to dine as most of our prestige Indian guest has given us very good feedback as we have a dedicated Indian chef to prepare the authentic Indian dishes.
. 
All constructive criticism is most welcomed as we always strive to serve our guests with true Sri Lankan hospitality and highest standards of service. 
Sincerely look forward to welcome you back to our Hotel and to our food court in the very near future to serve you even better.

Thank you,
Ashiq Muhammed
Front Office Manager
placeInfo/address: No 01 Glen Fall Road, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text:
The hotel is big and green and brown. It is situated in a nice location. The hallways are dark and the bathroom water doesn’t get hot, nor did our shower or kettle function properly. The rooms were spacious. 

Above all the breakfast buffet was definitely not 5 star quality, the dining hall is completed like a banquet hall- full, coffee is watered down and self served , any orders of cappuccinos or americanos are an added charge.

The food court was the biggest let down, extremely expensive and really mediocre. The food we tried was the Indian and it was salty and the meat hard.

The spa was of a good standard standard we were very happy with our massages, would recommend that.

The staff don’t greet aside from when you check into the hotel. 

All in all not happy with our stay.
title: Terribly dissatisfied

placeInfo/address: No 01 Glen Fall Road, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text:
We had an unhappy experience at the Araliya Green. First of all, the check-in took 15-20 minutes. We had booked two rooms. After 20 minutes, we are told that one room is getting ready in five minutes. We wanted to freshen up and go out. So we headed to the one room which was supposedly “ready”. To our dismay we find a couple of technicians working furiously at

They may be a five star hotel, but clear they are not ready to deliver a five star experience. There are other options you may want to go for in Nuwara Eliya!
title: Five star hotel with One star Customer experience!

ownerResponse/text:
Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback. I was quite surprised to read your review, as it doesn’t align with our experience during your stay.

As one of the directors me and my chef with over 12 years of experience at our hotel, I personally prepared your dinner on the second night. I clearly recall that on the first night, both you and your husband enjoyed the pork fillet, which you did not mention in your review. On the second night, you ordered the pasta with Fresh tomato sauce (served without parmesan as per your request), and your husband had the chicken breast.

That evening, our owner Michel spoke with you, and I also came to your table. I remember your husband complimenting the food, telling me it was “excellent and tasty.” At no point were any concerns raised about the food during your stay.

We take great pride in our cuisine and consistently receive positive feedback from guests. If there was any misunderstanding or disappointment, we wish you had brought it to our attention at the time so we could have addressed it immediately.
We’re always open to constructive feedback and remain committed to providing a high standard of hospitality.

Warm Regards,
Pulasthi Nanayakkara
Director
placeInfo/address: Wewa Road 16 Division, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Save your money and eat elsewhere.
text: I had high hopes for the food at this hotel, but it ended up being one of the worst parts of my stay. I ordered from the restaurant menu and was incredibly disappointed. The pasta was overcooked and swimming in a watery, flavorless sauce. The chicken dish I tried the next night was dry and clearly reheated — not something you’d expect from a so-called “Luxury boutique” hotel restaurant. Even the presentation looked rushed and unappetizing. To make matters worse, the food took forever to arrive, and the staff didn’t seem particularly bothered. For the price, I expected much higher quality. Save your money and eat elsewhere.
title: Worst Nightmare

ownerResponse/text:

Normally we play soft music in the restaurant actually it’s not from the kitchen before we clean the terrace I personally came to you and asked whether we can clean then you replied it’s ok no problem actually I have to remind you we spoke about the massage in the morning and we fixed the time before you go to the room after the tour at the lobby about 12.30pm

placeInfo/address: Wewa Road 16 Division, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka
text:
We've been travelling in SE Asia, Australia and Sri Lanka for over three months, staying in 5* hotels and in little homestays, and our two nights here has been far and away our worst experience. It started badly and just kept getting worse. I know others adore this place. We couldn't wait to leave.

It seems to be run for the benefit of the staff. For example, we tried to book a 2pm spa session and were told we could only have 5pm because the masseur didn't plan to be in until then. We accepted and planned our day. A few hours later we were told the appointment absolutely had to be at 2pm because the masseur had changed his mind.

Laundry promised in the morning was forgotten until the afternoon. When I asked I was promised 10 minutes. It took two hours. 

The kitchen had music blaring when we tried to sit by the pool. Then the grounds staff started sweeping up leaves round our recliners. Having grumbled about the laundry and the massage appointment we gave up and went to our room.

Here we unearthed the cause of the house that kept us awake on our first night - a nest of squirrels playing inside the room around the ceiling. We alerted staff, who took a look and told it was leaves. (The squirrels had gone into hiding.) Leaves? With beady eyes and furry tails? That night the squirrels woke us again and at 2.30am we were moved to a pokey little room. Any chance of sleep ended when staff arrived at 5am or so to chat and bang stuff at the storeroom next to our new room.

The owner is fond of replying on here to issues like this by saying 'Well what do you expect in the forest?' I expect them to take reports of animals in a room seriously and not dismiss them. The same applies to the ant-infested toilets. I expect a forest hotel to clean, sanitise and inspect them.

Two more anecdotes:

When the chef did his rounds after dinner we said we were surprised how tasteless the curry was. He agreed, saying he didn't spice it. He provided spice for customers. What!? This made our driver laugh out loud for some time.

It was my partner's birthday and the hotel offered to make a cake and decorate our room. The cake was bought in from Mango Mango in town, a restaurant the hotel recommended which, when we visited, we left without ordering because it was so miserable.

The birthday room decorations? Six second hand balloons with smudged script on them saying 'Happy Wedding'.

A complacent, self-satisfied shambles of a place. Nice views.
title: Worst experience in three months of travelling

placeInfo/address: Wewa Road 16 Division, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka
text:
We spent 3 nights at Lake Lodge as a base while sight seeing the area.
Our 1st impression was good having dinner around the lovely pool but increasingly felt annoyed by the over familiar host Michel & agree with other comments that he should not be in your face while you try to eat dinner! 
We settled down to enjoy our one free morning  by the pool to find all the hotel washing festooned around the pool fence to dry. Michel then with no warning supervised workmen to cut down a large healthy tree.This involved a very noisy 2hrs of chain sawing. When I approached Michel he failed to apologise but said he couldn't wait until the hotel quiet season as jobs would pile up! We were the only guests at the hotel at this point.
Finally as if to punish us at our last breakfast we essentially got no service while Michel sat by his computer.
This was part of a fabulous 3 week holiday in Sri Lank & were delighted by all our other hotels.
title: Rude,inconsiderate over familiar manager in what could be a good hotel.

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Graham,

I am very disappointed to receive your comment for the second time after TripAdvisor found your first comment as violate, after all the 156 Excellent and Very Good reviews about the service level of our staff and the fine culinary experience we offer. I feel duty bound to take issue with you over your comments about being charged for your espresso coffees, all NINETEEN (19) of them!!! I informed you when you requested double espressos that they would be charged as I explained that any amount of tea or Sri Lankan coffee was free with breakfast but as other styles of coffee are made from a machine with expensive capsules, they have to be charged. It states this clearly on our menu. I actually think that at an average of £2.63 per cup, they were very good value compared to what you would pay in the UK, about the cleanliness of your room. 
Actually, my houseboys are cleaning the rooms twice a day and our supervisors are checking that I can assure you my bed linen are made from cotton, quite incorrect of you to suggest anything other. 
As to my personal style of management of my hotel, I consider it my duty to be friendly with my guests, I am French, it is my natural Gallic way to interact with the people who stay with us. If you felt I was intruding all you had to do was say that we could chat later as you wanted a quiet breakfast time with your wife, I would not have been offended. What does offend me though, are your comments
You did go out one night for dinner and immediately upon return requested dinner at our hotel the following night, as your wife said you hadn’t been happy with what you’d had outside, now you are saying something entirely different. We merely ask our guests if they are enjoying their meal and if everything is alright, as if it isn’t we can immediately change their food. It is only our concern for our guests and their comfort that makes us ask, we are not looking for ‘praise’ of any sort.
I cannot do anything about the lake in front of my hotel; your pickiness knows no boundaries that you can take issue with nature! It hasn’t rained in Sri Lanka for over six months; we are desperately in need of rain and actually pray for it every day. If the ‘tank’ which is what it is actually called, was full then you wouldn’t see the petrified trees.
Wi-Fi signals and strength are a huge problem away from the main cities in Sri Lanka, until the providers upgrade their services it is something totally out of our hands.
Let me finish by saying that you commented in our in-house guest book before you left that “Lovely kind attention hosts and staff it made our stay” so the other readers can make their mind up about you and your comments and judge against all the top-class comments we have received over the years
placeInfo/address: Wewa Road 16 Division, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka
text:
Bathroom not quite clean - toilet stained with streaky green lines - hopefully a cleaner but why not gleaming white porcelain?  Not a "ladies" toilet. Toothpaste accident not cleaned from bathroom floor in 3 days. Cold water shower on day 3 - no hot water.
Sheets not cotton - were they nylon or polyester. Yuk. 
The reservoir an eyesore full of dead trees. Looks like Armagedden.  Note it is NOT a lake its a flooded valley eservoir with half submerged trees ruining the vista.  There are signs with pictures of bloated dead bodies by the shore telling you not to swim. Not for children to see please.
Poor wifi - unusable for Skype or Facetime in the room.  WiFi was fine in a local restaurant where we ate on day 2 so its not poor everywhere despite what may be said.
Surprise invoice warning !!!!!!!!!!!- Unlike every other hotel in the world the inclusive breakfast does NOT include an expresso coffee and you won't be told that until after 3 days an extra 10,000 rupees (about £55) is now on your bill. When you complain (and I did give them the chance to correct matters) you will be fobbed off. I felt ripped off. Nowhere in the world have I had to pay for an expresso coffee with my room inclusive breakfast.
Owner doesn't understand it is not good service to stand over your guests table and invade their meal and private time with a forced 10 minute conversation while you are eating. Politeness stops you from telling him to go away. HIde in a book or mobile phone and let him pick someone else.
This is a poured concrete structure devoid of any "charm" and the word "Boutique" seems inappropriate. It is a simple hotel with no character and with a small number of rooms. Thats small - not boutique.

Very Very Disappointing - the experience does not correlate with the price or the service. I see the manager is prone to reply to these poor feedback comments defensively.  I only tell it as it is and I did approach the management to communicate my disatisfaction.  Most of my comments are reflected in the same way by other poor reviewers over 24 months so clearly they have yet to take these points on-board and put them right.  It's easy to fob your guests off when they complain but most Brits will simply pay and then spread the word so others don't get caught the same way.

We had a great time in Sri Lanka and had some wonderful experiences and locations over 21 days. Lake Lodge Hotel is not one we would go back to or recommend to our friends or, indeed, other travellers with Audley Travel UK..
title: One to avoid -  iffy bathroom and bedding. Lake a nightmare.  Summary below

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest ,

While we have received several very positive reviews, for which we thank our valued guests, we have also received some constructive criticism, which we have not replied to, but we have acted on. This particular review however, in our opinion, is biased. We work on the basis of honesty and integrity, and in large part, our guests have been exactly that, for which we are truly grateful. 

The fridge in the room doesn’t have any liquor due to the hotel do not have permits to sell liquor in the premises.
 The bike that we have in the hotel is to provide free to the guest that how stay with us and that we don’t have any mountain to ride here is only flat lands. The bike what we have here is only the standard size bikes. 
In the rooms we have wall fixed international socket that have five different plugging.
The architectural designer in the room that we have two bed side lamps that can be rotatable and adjustable while you’ll reading on the bed. 
With the furniture in the room that we have is to make sure that don’t take lot space in the room. So if we have any large furniture in the room its take lot space in the room. But we have provided furniture like a writing table with a chair and table lamp. In the balcony we have and two chairs and a stool, all this furnishers are make out of wood.   

As a hotel police we don’t keep connections with tuk tuk rides and they charge different rates with each guest. That is a reason we don’t keep connection with the tuk tuk rides. But if a guest asks for a tuk tuk we arrange it but not the rates for the tours. Its up to the guest to be check with the tuk tuk ride
The dead trees in the lake are there for more than hundred years, because this lake was a manmade lake with combining two small lakes together. The trees were cover with water when they combining tow lake together. Now the dead trees help a lot have good bird paradise around this area.
Every night we check with our guest do they like to try some Sri Lankan Breakfast on the next day morning. If they like to try then it has to order before. 
While a guest having there they meal at anytime. We check with our guest that they like the meal that they having is good or bad. If it is something wrong then and there we can change it for our guest. But in this case we check with guest, but he didn’t say anything bad about the meals, if something wrong before the guests eat that can be change and arrange something different. But after having it and say its wrong is easy and can’t help to have it again. 
The rates for the rice & curry what we served can be high for you. But our service what we offer to our guest is different to a small restaurant like on the road where you’ll can find writhen 5KM. 
We are of course open to constructive criticism and will take up some of the other matters the guest has pointed out. Furthermore, we thank the guest for recommending the very villa he stayed in despite his criticism of it.

Thank You,
Best Regards 

Manager
placeInfo/address: Wewa Road 16 Division, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka
text:
This is NOT a bad hotel - at say £ 35 per night it might be considered quite good - but , at well over three times that price , it falls woefully short of offering value for money , and in many details it fails to provide what it claims will be available .
i) The publicity states that rooms have baths . Room 4 did not .
ii) The advertised " minibar " is NOT a bar - it is a fridge with soft drinks in it .
iii) The only English Language TV channel of the 7 or 8 available was Aljazeera . I have been to Sri Lanka on four previous holidays totalling over 40 days and never before found myself in a hotel which did not have channels showing international cricket !
iv) There were 4 " Mountain " bikes available for SHORT guests ( none big enough for my 180 cm ) .None had gears ( MOUNTAIN bikes ? ) and they were in a poor state of repair .

Other complaints : -
a) When I pointed out a cockroach to a member of staff checking my oxymoronic " minibar " he prodded it with his toe to see whether or not it was alive ( it was ) and watched it scuttle across the floor to hide under the desk . No comment was passed , and no further action was taken during the remaining three hours of my stay .
b) A member of staff had to be called before the lavatory could be induced to flush .
c) Similar assistance was needed before I could begin my fruitless search for cricket on the television ( the plug did not fit the socket ) .
d) The ONLY chair in the spacious room was a folding wooden thing - NOT comfortable .
e) The architect/interior designer did not allow for the possibility of anyone wishing to read after dark . The only way to do so was to take the " chair " to one particular corner ( two guests could NOT have read simultaneously )
f) The furniture on the balcony was visually elegant but NOT practical . After at most two minutes reclining in one of the " sunloungers ( ? ) " the recliner was decorated with horizontal bars and VERY uncomfortable  .
g) I have consulted staff at hotels all over Asia before taking my first " tuc-tuc " from their door ( to find out roughly what my journey should cost ) . Never before has the result been me paying three times the going rate for that first journey .
h) " Lake Lodge " should properly be called " Reservoir Lodge " . Many apparently enjoyed the view from the terrace - to me the hundreds of dead trees sticking ten to fifteen feet out of the water made it look like the Somme after heavy rain rather than Windermere .

The breakfasts were variable . The first - egg hoppers - was rather good . I asked for egg hoppers on subsequent mornings , but was told this was not possible . I did not understand the reason(s) given for this state of affairs . I did not much enjoy the alternatives .

The evening meals were very poor value for $ 23 . 
Of the three first courses I ate two ( tuna samosas and spring rolls ) bore all the hallmarks of having come from packets of frozen food , and gave little or no pleasure , and the third ( tomato and mozarella salad ) disappointingly tasteless .
Of the three main courses , the Seared Tuna was SUPERB ( the best I have ever tasted ) , the " Rice with Fish Curry " was good ( BUT not as good as one costing 800 Rupees I ate subsequently , 5 km away ) , and the " Rice with Chicken Curry " was appalling . All bar one of the vegetables I had enjoyed so much with the fish were absent , replaced by varieties of semi-spiced mush I did NOT enjoy , and the only parts of the chicken to reach my plate were gristle , bone , skin , and sinew . I searched hard for a few fragments of meat - not easy , thanks to the management's obsession with " candle lite " ( sic ) dinners on the terrace - but found none .
I bitterly resented having committed myself to pay $ 23 for each of the two meals which did not include the seared tuna - they would not have been cheap at $ 10 ( the $ 23 did NOT include the [ excellent ] Italian coffee ) .

Having said all that , the staff were unfailingly courteous and cheerful , and my room had a first-class bed and a very good shower .
title: NOT Value for Money

ownerResponse/text:

Mr.Ranjith P’Kumara
