placeInfo/address: Wewa Road 16 Division, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka
text:
First impressions of Lake Lodge are favourable - when you walk upstairs to the terrace and the swimming pool you know you are staying in a stylish, boutique hotel. Our room was fantastic with great views over the tree canopies to the distant mountain ranges. the room was huge and clean and the bed was extremely comfortable. Operationally though things leave a lot to be desired and for the money we paid ($265 a night before the added 24% taxes) I would expect a lot more, even taking into account we stayed over the Christmas period. 
For some reason the chef provided us with 'Western' food options which we found strange as surely most tourists coming here would prefer to try Sri Lankan food? In retrospect, and after staying in a couple of other boutique hotels, we probably should have asked for Sri Lankan food but this was never offered as an option. The food we ate was disappointing and tasted as if a lot of it came out of a jar or the freezer. 
Staff were friendly and amiable but hovered around us endlessly fussing. Every meal someone would just appear in front of us, say hello and then not move on when we said hello back - it was quite unnerving as we were often mid conversation ourselves. 
Location wise it is perfect for exploring the Cultural Triangle and if they got the food and service right it I'd have no issues in recommending it to anyone. We have stayed in many boutique hotels around the world and I'm afraid Lake Lodge in no way represents value for money at $265 a night.
title: Almost ticks all the boxes but vastly overpriced

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Ms Nicki,

We are most distressed to read of your review.  We are also surprised as neither you nor Mr Antonio had mentioned your food poisoning during the 3 days with us.

As you had mentioned,  you did have breakfast the first morning with us.  Following this, you left the hotel at 1.25pm for a few hours.  You had your own driver so we were not aware of where you went.

The next day, you left early for your whale-watching tour and Mr Antonio requested for breakfast packs which we prepared for you.  You returned at 11.30am and left the hotel again at 4pm and returned after dinner.

On your final day, you had to leave early for your flight and again requested for breakfast packs.  As your departure time was brought forward to 3.30am, you changed your mind and told us there was no need for the breakfast packs as it was too early to eat.

During you short stay with us,  you were very friendly towards our on-site staff and said all was well each time we had greeted and offered assistance to you.  You spent a significant amount of time out of our hotel with your driver and did not have any other meals at our hotel.

Our kitchen standards  follow strict hygiene standards. Our fresh foods are delivered every 3 days, and some on a daily basis (such as fruits and eggs) during the high season .  We put a bottle of dried fruits in the room and these come in little vacuum packs which we decant into the crystal bottle in your room prior to arrival.  We do not believe dried and cured fruits would be a likely cause for food poisoning.

We are very sad that you had decided your food poisoning was our absolute fault and have expressed it in such a categoric and degrading manner just only a few hours after leaving our hotel.   We close our hotel every year for one month to refurbish the property entirely.  Being by the Indian Ocean, corrosion happens very fast and there would certainly be wear and tear with time.  In addition, we continue with monthly maintenance but keep that to a minimum to avoid disturbing our guests.

We would never avoid taking responsibility for our mistakes.  However, to unequivocally accept this blame (or even likely blame) for causing your food poisoning and most distressingly, ruining your Sri Lankan hotel seems unfair.  

We respectively deny your claim and humbly request you to reconsider this review.  What is especially unfair to us is that you had not mentioned this matter to us while in-residence but instead, chose to publicly humiliate us almost  immediately after leaving our hotel. 

Regardless,  we wish you and your Mr Antonio speedy recovery good health and that after your emotions have subsided, you would have fond and happy memories of Sri Lanka.

The Sandhya
text: We’ve spent 11 days travelling around Sri Lanka and finished off our break at this hotel hoping to spend 3 days relaxing after an exhausting but fun trip seeing Sri Lanka.  We arrived late afternoon on our first day and were full of excitement at the prospect of relaxing on the beach for some time after travelling the island.  On the first morning of our stay I ate breakfast and went to sunbathe.  An hour or so after eating breakfast whilst on the sun lounger I had to get up and rush to the room as I felt I was going to be sick.  I was sick and continued to be sick for the next 24 hours any time I attempted to eat or drink anything.  I violently vomited at any attempt of drinking liquid even small amounts.  My husband too was sick and is suffering as we leave on our way to the airport.  He also has a compromised immune system due to taking medication for Crohn’s disease so will take him longer to recover and will impact the next part of our journey in Dubai.  The only thing we both ate that could have caused this were eggs at breakfast and the dried fruit and nuts that are provided in the small jar in the room.  I would never normally eat anything like this in a bar where other people’s fingers and germs have touched, but whilst on holiday in a “luxury”  hotel you let your guard down a bit.  Needless to say this totally ruined the time for us and we spent the majority of time in our room feeling rubbish.  When we attempted to go out as we’d booked a private whale  tour, we both felt so awful we just couldn’t wait to get back.  Totally took the shine off for both of us.  The hotel has stunning scenery and I witnessed a beautiful sunset through the gap in the curtains from the bed I was lying in but too sick to get up on the first evening.  The hotel itself is in need of a bit of TLC.  Looks a bit tired in places.  Definitely wasn’t as pristine looking in reality as it looks in the pictures.  I would not come back here.
title: Would not come back…..what should have been a relaxing experience was the worst experience I’ve felt whilst travelling

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Mr David,

You had gone all out to remind us it was your 25th anniversary and we made every attempt to welcome you including a complimentary airport pick up (worth US$150) even without your asking for it. In that offer, we thanked you for being one of our earliest booker for the season and for supporting the country. We are certain in all your years of travels, that very few hotels would have offered you such a generous and unsolicited gesture.   

Your credit card was invalid four times. We asked repeatedly for an updated credit card. When you did finally provide a valid credit card number just 3 weeks prior to your check-in, you instructed us not to charge it for yet another day (even though your payment was already past due by 8 days). Each email from you was titled “URGENT” - we obliged. 

In the meanwhile, you took that opportunity to re-negotiate your rate. We did indeed have a flash sale but it did not cover the period of your stay. In addition and very importantly, you were not entitled to change your booking under the terms of Booking.com.  Even if there was a special offer (which there wasn’t), you would not have been able to change your booking per the terms of Booking.com.   With that same reasoning, had our rates gone up in the meantime (which is a likely scenario when our hotel is close to full house), we would not expect you to pay more. This is simply double standards on your part.   

We certainly did not blame our close partner Booking.com for anything. You simply wanted a better deal and we were trying to be subtle about it in our reply to you.   

We never talked or communicated with you (or any of our guests for that matter) in a “flat” manner. We explained everything in detail and apologized repeatedly even though we could not understand the justification of your demands. We had even offered an exceptional rate for the suite when we were unable to identify the rate you had demanded.   

It was your emails that were curt, offensive and demanding.  Not ours.  When you didn’t get your way, your final email to us was downright negative and petulant.   After a multitude of emails apologising to you and trying to placate your demands, enough was enough. 

You are right - we really do wish for guests to be happy. We didn’t see fit to have you stay with us.   You were clearly not happy and we didn’t want you to be so on our property. We gave you a full refund without any penalty despite your holding that room for over 3 months without a valid credit card.   Your foreign exchange gripe is solely your individual matter as we only deal in USD.  This has always been the case since the start and with all our honoured guests.

With this unfair and inaccurate “review”, we are glad we made that difficult decision to unwelcome you.
text:
In all my days of global travel staying at some of the finest hotels in the world has a hotel canceled my reservation. The reason given was that they only want happy guests and as you will see below I had some reservations leading up to this altercation.The determined that I was not going to be a "Happy Guest" and they only want happy guests.
I had been greatly looking forward to staying here as the hotel is very beautiful and contemporary. Located right on the beach the location was perfect. I booked this hotel a few moths ago prior to arranging my flights. Understand here that Sri Lanka is not the easiest place to get to. I had gone out of my way to support Sri Lanka as it slowly emerges from the pandemic and the scourge of financial mismanagement.
Some background here. The attempted to charge my credit card as per our agreement and there were a number of issues at my end. My bank thought there was possible fraud and so declined the charge a few days passed as I was travelling I then had them manually put through the charge. 
In the meantime I noticed on the website that the premier suite in the hotel was being offered at the same rate as I was paying for the smaller room. It was showing on Booking.com at a discount of 40%. I said that I was interested in taking advantage of this. 
This offer was priced in C$ on the website. The hotel went and charged my credit card that amount in USD. When I pointed out the error they flatly stated that this was not a valid rate and was an error on the part of booking.com. 
They refunded the difference and reverted back to my original room. Flatly refusing to honour the posted rate or the upgraded room. I pointed this out and without further ado they cxld my booking saying that I was going to be a problem and they wanted nothing further to do with me. I am out the difference in the exchange rate. Ona side note I am still travelling to Sri Lanka staying close by and am looking forward in spite of this to a long awaited visit.
title: Only Happy Guests need reply

roomTip: Our room had cockroaches in the bed, a terrible experience.
text:
This hotel was once an amazing hotel with great architecture by Geoffrey Bawa. The layout and the long pool is still great. But unfortunately this hotel is currently in a bad state and urgently in need of many essential upgrades. 

We paid for a expensive premium room, with an interesting planning and architecture. But problems soon arose. Firstly our AC didnt work. Secondly our bed had cockroaches (!), which was a terrible experience. The wifi also did not work. Eventually we got a room upgrade. Our new room was better, but in also in a bad state with a non-functioning fridge. 

It seems like the entire property lacks proper maintainance. The hotel area also had a bad smell many parts of the day, and also many annoying crows near the pool area (a general Negombo problem). Some of the employees are amazing, and very very friendly and helpful but their assistance could not improve our experience to an acceptable level. 

The price is very overprised. In the current situation this is barely a 3 star hotel, not 5 as stated. I can, unfortunately, not recommend this hotel to anyone in the current situation.
title: Find another hotel in Negombo, dont stay until the hotel is properly renowated and maintained

text: Prinzipiell hätte das Hotel Potenzial, die Zimmer sind eigentlich architektonisch hübsch, aber leider alles weit weg von einem fünf Sterne Hotel. Ich hatte in meinem Zimmer genau ein Handtuch, und leider auch nicht einmal eine Ersatzrolle Klopapier. Das Restaurant ist abgeschmudelt und das Personal ist völlig unmotiviert. Zum Frühstück wollte ich einen Cappuccino, gibt’s aber leider nicht weil die Maschine kaputt ist, das Essen ist okay. Viel einheimisches Publikum, in meinem Nebenzimmer war bis um 3:30 Uhr in der Früh  Party und dann schlafen nicht zu denken. Dies war mein 6tes Hotel auf meiner Sri Lanka Rundreise, wobei man sagen muss alle andern waren wirklich wunderbar, nur dieses ist eigentlich wirklich eine absolute Zumutung. Anbei auch noch ein Foto vom sogenannten„Strand“.
title: Nie mehr wieder

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest, 

We sincerely appreciate you taking the time to share your recent experience at our hotel. It is through feedback such as yours that we can address areas in which we need to improve and strive to offer a better experience to our guests in the future. 

I am aware our Operations Manager, Mr.Harin Cooray, has responded to your concerns and offered you to contact him directly. In the meantime, please allow me to address your concerns one by one. 

First and foremost, we would like to extend our apologies for the inconveniences you encountered during your stay. It is disappointing to hear about the issues you faced, and we genuinely regret the negative impression that was left. 

Regarding the age verification for your youngest son, we understand that there may have been some confusion during check-in. We apologize for any discomfort this may have caused. As per our policy, like many others in the industry, the children’s rate applies to children under 12 years, and we are obliged to verify the children’s age at the time of check-in. 

However, we do acknowledge the importance of clear communication, and we will work on ensuring that this aspect is more transparent in the future. 

The issue with the resident rate and staff behavior is concerning. We would like to express our sincerest apologies for any insensitivity or misunderstanding you felt from our team. 

Discrimination in any form is unacceptable, and we are committed to providing an inclusive and respectful environment for all our guests. 

Regarding the misunderstanding about the bathroom items, we acknowledge the inconvenience it caused. We apologize for any confusion, and we are grateful that it was resolved satisfactorily. We will use this incident as an opportunity to further train our staff on handling such matters with care and sensitivity. 

We are deeply sorry that the refund process took longer than expected and that you had to resort to a chargeback with your bank. We take full responsibility for processing your refund, and we regret any delay with the refund process. We are grateful that it is now resolved. 

Your concerns are valid, and we understand your frustration. Please rest assured that we are taking your feedback seriously, and we are committed to improving the quality of our services. While we cannot change the past, we hope you will allow us the opportunity to serve you better in the future. 

We hope you allow us another chance to serve you, and we will do our utmost to ensure a superior and more pleasant stay. We value your patronage and trust, and we are determined to learn from our mistakes. 

Thank you once again for your feedback, and we wish you safe and enjoyable travels.

Ayubowan (May you have a long life) 

Chitra Chandrasiri 
General Manager
text:
Western family of 2 adults and 11 and 14yr old children's.

Accused of lying about my youngest sons age on check in to avoid paying adult price even after they had his passport. Over 12 is considered an adult. 

Was contuinally questioned on checkin how we booked resident rate. Staff had difficult accepting bordering on racism that a non Sri Lankan could be eligible. This was despite visa being shown. Staff members were in disbelief over this and visibly put out are ethinicity could obtain such a concession. Other Jetwings do not behave in this way. 

On check out accused of stealing bathroom items that were then found on bath in the bathroom.

Due to above cancelled subsequent stay. Received refund acknowledgement for payment within 14 working days. After 18 working days and ignored chase up had to go to bank to ask for chargeback. 

Never received a response from Jetwing about the refund not being done and having to go through bank.

Jetwings reply to the other issues was an apology stating that was below there normal service levels and if you come again it will be better. No accountability or responsibility taken whatsoever.

text: Due to the minimum guest count not reached, buffet was not arranged and ala carte menu was provided which is totally acceptable. Being a 4 star hotel we really didn’t expect this kind of terrible service. I do not recommend this hotel for family getaways if buffet is not arranged. Not worth for the money paid at all. Really disappointed.

text:
Never ever try to visit jetwing lagoon for your most awaited holidays. Keep away from the worst food which you will have same things for your lunch as well as dinner, They are not able to provide a room with proper Air conditioning system. Pls don't do the same mistake we did.

They gave us a negative reply. I was insisting that one of their waiters  Also the restaurant manager was not courteous at all, who would giving excuses like they have not had any thefts happened in their hotel rather who should be inquiring seriously. Dear Guest,

Thank you for contacting me, following my message, it was a sincere pleasure discussing the matters you brought to our attention in detail. Thank you very much for giving us another opportunity and we are looking forward to welcoming you back at our resort in the not too distant future. 

Ayubowan (may you live long)

text:
Like many others who stay here, we arrived after a transcontinental flight, looking to reenergise in luxuriant and peaceful surroundings. We had been here a few years ago and had enjoyed our stay; likewise, my parents stopped off here once and gave the hotel a glowing review.

This time however, our stay was tainted by various deficiencies. Had we been staying at a mid-range hotel, we may not have been bothered to call these out. Jetwing Lagoon, however, is extremely expensive (we're talking Western prices or more; this extreme pricing is a phenomenon across the whole of Sri Lanka, but that topic deserves a separate post in its own right) - we paid USD 201 for one night, plus a USD 90 late checkout fee. At that price, you expect immaculate, standout service - but this was far from the case.

First, the positives:

- The hotel is a short distance away from Bandaranaike Airport (c. 20 minutes by car) and is therefore convenient as a pre-departure or post-arrival stop-off (central Colombo, by comparison, is at least 60 minutes by car, depending on your exact destination and traffic).

- The vast, 100m pool that forms the centrepiece of the property is stunning.

- The Geoffrey Bava architecture is pleasing, although perhaps not for everyone (the concrete paths leading to the rooms and the flooring around the central pool are very rough and not easy to navigate barefoot).

- The rooms are immensely spacious - exactly what one needs after (or before) being cooped up in an aircraft for hours.

Now, the negative:

- We arrived at around 4 a.m. and made it clear to the lady at the front desk that we wanted to rest. At 9 a.m. the same morning, we received a wake-up call from reception; when we pointed out the error, the lady simply said "Oh, wrong number", and hung up. This was both woefully unprofessional and disruptive, and we called back to complain later in the day, only to be met with a relatively dismissive and brief apology. In any top-range hotel, we would have expected that someone would take this issue up with us at the point of checkout, at the latest. But on checking out, we weren't even asked whether we had enjoyed our stay - we were simply presented with the bill very indifferently; clearly no-one had registered, let alone escalated our earlier complaint. We therefore spoke to the deputy general manager and then the general manager; both offered an apology but had nothing constructive or reassuring to say.

Bottom line, the staff are largely untrained in customer service, and this is very noticeable in comparison with the level of attention offered to guests at other top hotels.

- We had lunch in the restaurant by the lagoon. The food was good, but the number of flies buzzing around the table made it difficult to enjoy the meal. Guests at the neighbouring table were likewise struggling with the insect invasion. Clearly the hotel has little control over the proliferation of bugs, but we felt they could have prepared the tables better - e.g. by providing lids for the curry pots. A waitress came to our rescue by draping some paper serviettes over our food. We appreciated the gesture but it actually just demonstrated how weakly the hotel addresses (or doesn't address) the issue.

- The lunch service was extremely slow, even though there weren't many guests in the restaurant. Even a simple tea and plate of curd took around 25 minutes to arrive (we actually walked around the gardens while waiting for it).

- The lawns in the gardens were still full of paper scraps and burnt-out rockets from the recent new year celebrations. Again, one would not expect this lack of cleanliness from a hotel aspiring to be top-class.

Overall, a nice place, but suffering from some very serious deficiencies which seem due to inadequate staff training and poor management. We felt we were being fleeced for money and did not feel cared for.

In the response to this review, it would be nice to read some truly thoughtful suggestions for improvement rather than the cut-and-paste platitudes that characterise the responses to most of the other reviews.
title: Paradise lost

text:
This hotel centres (both on its website and in reality) on its 100m pool. So why does the company think it’s ok to fail to warn visitors in advance and instead dupe people into paying to stay when the pool is closed)? Jetwing operate several other hotels in Negombo so it would be simple to offer alternative accommodation. 
So instead of the widely hyped pool, we had building work and aroma of tile adhesive. 
We found the staff friendly and doing the best they could in the circumstances but this is a hopelessly awful place to stay at the moment. 
There’s another small pool on the rather nasty beach (lucky as swimming is not allowed - nor is it in the lagoon, which again is not clear till you arrive.)
Aside from the pool, the open air bathrooms just don’t work here - being by a busy road and some scruffy housing rather takes the edge off the experience.
Sadly a bad way to end a fantastic trip to Sri Lanka.
title: Shame on you Jetwing

Just checked out of jetwin lagoon 09/04/2018 and I'm just in shock. One of the worst experience ever at a 5 star hotel. This menu is what was offered for lunch today. Jetwin lagoon has taken the word "set menu" to another low level. Meaning of "set menue" ;a complete meal with a limited number of options to choose from each course. If you are not sure check it up. Kindly point out to me which "OPTION". It felt as if we should eat this or just starve. Which my little daughter had to untill we got her something from another restaurant outside after we left. They didnt offer an option or neither a kids meal for my daughter. A 5 star property to serve what we could get in any cheap market. I'm just appalled. Iv never got such bad service in any of the other jetwin properties special attention was always given to the kids aswell. We pay good money to receive a 5 star service but sadly this is what we get. Even last night's set menu was disappointing when I requested for a simple cheese pasta for my daughter they refused and wanted us to select an option of hotdog, chicken nuggets or fish nuggets.. options you can get in a fast food restaurant....
 When we get to the front desk to checkout hungry and annoyed the girl at the front desk tells us "this what we told you that it's a set  menu.." cherry on the  top.. just what we needed to hear.. once again teach them the correct definition on the word set menu.  The front desk manager wanted to know why we didn't ask for option from the A la carte? When we question the kitchen they said we need to make an additional payment. Mind you after we payed for a full board option. which we didn't pay for eventually since we didn't want to eat a rice and curry. text:
This hotel was the last leg of our wonderful stay in Sri Lanka.  We were referred by an expat that stayed in the hotel previously.  However, the property did not live up to our expectations.  

The hotel touts ocean front/sea side and beach access.  Yes, there is access to sand across a busy road.  However, you can not swim in the ocean.  The hotel has built a pool "oceanside".  The lagoon side is a nice view, but it doesn't give the "resort" feel.

Our room was the Bawa Suite.  While it appeared perfect on initial review, the bathroom did not have proper circulation and was like a sauna with no circulation and excessively humid.  The room was not as clean as I expected and found random hairs in the bathroom.  Very gross.

There is nothing within walking distance so we opted to eat lunch on the property.  Everything we ordered was edible but not fantastic.  Everything that was fried was extra greasy (egg rolls, seafood, etc).  We did not stay for breakfast.

The worst part of the experience had to be the staff at the "welcome" desk.  I asked transportation to the city and the receptionist quoted me DOUBLE the price of Pickme or Kangaroo Cabs for a smaller/non-AC vehicle.  She also steered me toward a tuk-tuk that was also overpriced.  So, my husband I and walked the road until we were able to get a reasonably priced taxi service.

I was so dissatisfied with the service, we checked out six hours after check-in, even though I prepaid for the room.  Even upon check-out, the reception staff didn't seem concerned or interested in the issues.

I would not recommend this hotel to an enemy.
title: If you are looking for luxury and true 5 star quality and service...this is not the place for you!

text:
Unfortunately, this hotel was disappointing and much below any expectation. 
Location is far away from city, restaurants and cafe, and it is very difficult to find a Taxi, you need to order and wait for at least 30 minutes. 
Breakfast was not open buffet but limited menu to order from !
Room was very hot due to Air conditioning problem and I asked them twice to fix it but no repose. 
Internet is very slow.
No SPA and gym facilities, only steam box and it was not working at this time !!
Hotel staff were in general lazy and not willing to help.

text:
We stayed here one night and the experience was unfortunately disappointing.

First of all our booking was for some reason under different name and so despite arriving at 1am in the morning, being tired and having a voucher, I had to wait over half an hour for the staff to finally agree that yes, it was our booking. 

Secondly the staff was not communicating very well and judging by their body language and facial expressions, they were annoyed that they were bothered by someone who actually wanted to get what they paid for. Also when we finally got our room, the porter let me carry my own bags and then actually expected a tip once he showed me to my room. 

Otherwise the rooms were beautiful and with the outdoors bathroom it felt special. Shame that the customer service completely destroyed this experience and the price we paid was definitely not corresponding to the service.
title: Pricetag & service do not match

text:
A curious hotel 
Good for stopover after or before flights as 20 mins from airport  for 1-2  nights 
It trades on mentioning it's a Geoffrey Bawa design - rooms are large stylish with huge bathroom with open roofed edges . Very impressive 
Linens good and toiletries are topped up (sometimes ) and reused - a plus 

The table / bar service is slow - u could lose interest by the time it arrives
Tho they top your wine glass up so regularly it's annoying . I think they must have had a talk about extra selling!
The main pool is huge and clean 

The sea side pool is ok - unloved tho satisfactory and can be empty a lot of the time so very nice swimming to crashing waves 

The beach is black sand and full of rubbish 

The sea is rough - no swimming - with waves crashing on a rock shelf 
One is hard pushed to say anything nice about beach really so am
Puzzled by other reviews praising beach 

Internet very patchy in our rooms and around site . Very poor connection and slow 

If room numbers are low there is fixed menu but the  cooking was very good indeed and after the press of the buffets it was relaxing to have table service . But you never knew type of meal on offer til you sat down 

I think it has potential to improve / but trading on airport proximity and bawa link . A bit sad
title: Curious hotel

text:
Le cadre est magnifique, l’hôtel plein de charme et atypique et la vue y est belle mais c’est tout. Le personnel très gentil également.

Les chambres sont vétuste et très mal insonorisées, des 7h les bruits de couloir commencent avec les garçons de chambre. Les plafonds sont très fin également.
La literie mauvaise avec un matelas à ressorts que l’ont sent. La salle de bain, mono vasque, vieille avec des fuites. On est très très loin du standing espéré! 

Les repas sont bons mais sans être particulièrement incroyables au vu du prix, tarifs excessifs au bar.

Au vu du prix élevé de cet hôtel pour la région, et des prestations, je ne recommande pas d’y séjourner. Y passer prendre un thé en revanche oui!

roomTip: Find somewhere else if you’re paying over $400 aud for this hotel.
text: I will try to be fair writing this review but I am bitterly disappointed in this hotel.  I booked a triple through Agoda and clearly stated that our party included 2 adults and one child of 12. The room was a triple. Agoda said the room was fine for 3 adults so I went ahead and paid the very large amount - one that we wouldn’t usually pay - for a special event - about $750 AUD. By far the most expensive hotel I have ever booked. We arrived. The gardens are lovely and the staff are decent. That’s where the good ends. We booked a garden view - the room has a view of a car park (currently in the hotel at night or I would take a picture). The beds are hard. The hotel is extremely dated and needs a good refurb. So I am already annoyed that we got terrible value for money. We took a stroll and upon return the staff inform me we have to pay another $165usd for my child - who to them is an ‘adult’ (she’s twelve remember). I checked their website and sure enough it says a 12 year old is an adult - so I tried to ‘rebook’ with Agoda and sure enough it still says the triple is for 3 adults…though it also says ‘children under 11 stay for free’ if you click on a very small ‘I’ - at the very least unclear - but also, I booked well in advance (and paid in advance) and there was no other mention of an additional fee - or what that additional fee would be. So, all in all, not a good experience. Even without the extra $165 usd slug this hotel is just very poor value for money. And on top of all of that breakfast is not included. So, in sum, well over $1000 aud and no breakfast for a dated hotel. Absolutely terrible value - an experience worth $400 aud tops (and that’s being generous and factoring in the peak season and historical nature of the hotel…).
title: Very disappointed and terrible value for money

text: A heritage property in the tea areas at least 30 minutes from Nuwara Eliya. The hotel is nostalgic and slightly run down. The staff are excessively intrusive with a constant unspoken desire for tips. My biggest complaint is the ridiculously expensive drinks, both alcoholic, soft drinks and beverages. The loose tea in the room was very good but the tea in the dining room was very ordinary. Thus not the quality hotel advertised. Highly overpriced.Bad weather over the 2 days meant there was absolutely nothing to do or see unless you left the hotel by car. Dark and dated which summarises our stay.
title: Not worth the trouble to get here.

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Valued Guest 
Thank you for your feedback. We're pleased to hear you enjoyed the pleasant views from your room and had a positive experience with the 90-minute Balinese massage at our spa. We also appreciate your constructive comments. We value your input and hope to provide an improved experience in the future.
Warm Regards 
General Manager 
Heritance Tea Factory
text:
Stayed for 1 night on 22-12-2024.
Positive points:
Pleasant view from the bedroom (as described in the hotel web site photo)
SPA, tested the 90mins deep tissue Balinese massage very good.

Negative / Needs significant improvement.
The hotel comes up as Four-Star Luxury hotel in the google search. This is utter rubbish, because :
1. Two towels in the bathroom+ wash room: how to you imagine using the same towel for both face and back side ? this is not hygiénique.  
2. The dinner and breakfast food choices and quality is simply bad. Check that out the dried string hoppers, left over food, dried. Not sure if the hotel has the capability to deliver "Fine Dining" at the TCK 6685 Restaurant.
3. Instant coffee for breakfast, this is a shame. Luxury hotels serve hot, brewed coffee.
4. Why is water charged at the table, can you not have the option to server free water?

The hotel has been capitalizing on its colonial history, but it’s time to look ahead. How do you envision positioning yourself in the hill country as a hotel that offers a unique experience to travelers ? This is certainly in the hands of the management to create a powerful vision for the future. 

 Besides sticking reminders in the bathroom on the number of liters of water per minute: what are you really doing to be a meaningful greener hotel ?

The surrounding region grows vegetables perhaps for the entire country, however we do not see them either for dinner and or breakfast.
title: Poor Quality: fails to meet expectations significantly.

text:
Really beautiful location, that’s it.
When we arrived in the room we noticed the sheets and the pillow had yellow and black stains, the shower tub doesn’t drain the water and there is a lot of dust around the room and the hotel.
We were a group of 20 ppl and they forced us to have a set dinner menu (€65 each person, way too expensive) instead of letting us use the buffet with the explanation that ‘we were too many’, honestly I don’t see their point but we didn’t want to argue. Moreover the aperitivo was way too expensive for the quality of the wine they offer. Some of the staff member was very polite, other not at all.
Anyway the tea experience was fun.
The reception guy offered us to change room and the chef was caring for the ppl who has allergies and the ones who didn’t want to eat local food.
title: Not a real 5 stars

text: Expected so much from this hotel but was let down. Given a poor room, very tired decor, above resteraunt so evening noise but was worst in the morning 6.30 music playing. Bathroom is not clean and shower dangerous to get in and out of. No sealed water to drink in room and silly price to buy. Very comfy bed. Food very good but waiters not the best. It was a busy evening so reception girl made no attempt to help with the water and the room was as it was.

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Valued Guest 
 It's concerning to hear about the issues you encountered, particularly regarding the service and atmosphere. Your feedback is invaluable and will hopefully prompt improvements. Thank you for sharing your candid thoughts
Warm Regards 
Resident Manager 
Heritance Tea Factory
text:
This hotel is absolutely not worthy of visiting, I am saying this because of my real experience. (What’s even funny is that our driver who was born and raised in this country said this is the place he least wanted to come to because not only is the hotel mediocre, but the entire area is desolate, like a wilderness, with almost nothing to do and nowhere to go）

I found here interesting because of the severe racism and the sense of being offended. Originally I was born in China, now I and my wife live in New York. Things happen in our first night dinner in this hotel, three ridiculous things happen:

1. Dinner buffet is included in most of packages, but if you order extra beverages you’ll be charged, which is quite normal and even a common sense, but waiters here keep asking Chinese/Asian Yellow visitors if they know something would be charged, more than one time, even after people saying that they know the rules.

2. I ordered a “Ice black coffee with no sugar and milk”, the staffs here, their English is not good though, I carefully  slow down my talking speed, 1 minute after, a waiter came to me asking if I know this coffee would be charged, I said nicely to him: “yes, absolutely, no problem”. After about 5 mins, he came back to me and asked again “Sir this coffee is chargable”, I replied to him “Yes, I know, thank you”. Things got worse when they finally served this “ice black coffee” which is absolutely not what I want, it looks purely white and tastes sweet”, I called the waiter asking if this is black coffee, he started to laugh and reject to admit that this was the wrong one. In order to verify if it’s my problem, after dinner I went to the bar and ordered the same thing “ice black coffee”, this time they did it correctly, which, on the contrary, proved that I was being cheated and offended in the dining room.

In the bar, again, a young Asian couple came in and ordered some drinks with influent English while I was enjoying my black coffee, I heard that they asked them the same issue about the charge at least twice, I don’t understand why they kept doing this.

3. A racist European woman. While we were eating, she sat next to our table with a man. She called over the waiter and suddenly asked him, "How do you handle leftovers” The waiter was puzzled and replied, "We usually calculate the supply well, and guests can consume what we offer." Then, in a sarcastic tone (perhaps she thought I couldn't understand English), the woman asked, "Why are some people here keeps eating and eating? I don't understand. As of me, I only eat a little bit of vegetables."        I didn't understand why she would ask such a biased and malicious question, at a time when guests just started their dinner( about 7:50 pm the dinner starts at 7:30 pm). Since my parents were also present, I didn't want to confront her. In the end, we only left some pasta unfinished, with hardly any leftover. However, the waiter didn't seem to recognize her as a racist, or perhaps such racists are particularly welcomed at this hotel.

Further things to be known for those who are planning to come to this hotel: unstable wifi, inconvenient traffic, unstable electricity (it has tripped three times within one hour after check-in)

To sum up personally, I would definitely not come again.
title: This Hotel is full of “interesting” things

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Valued Guest , 
Thank you for taking the time to share with us your feedback regarding your recent stay at our property. Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconveniences. As a hospitality company that prides itself on our service and facilities, guest feedback is of utmost importance. However, we understand that not all guests are alike and what one may find satisfactory may be perceived differently by another.

We vehemently deny any allegations on discrimination, especially against women. We promote an environment that is free from discrimination and without any class divide especially as we work with local communities. We can assure you that we have strict policies against any form of discriminatory behaviour. Our managerial staff undergo regular training to uphold professional conduct and treat all guests with the utmost respect. We sincerely regret if you felt otherwise, but we have found no evidence to support the characterization of our manager-level employees. We also wish you brought this to our attention whilst in-house in order to address this directly. 
Kindly note that wages paid to tea pluckers within our grounds is fair and transparent; as such we have enjoyed long standing relationships with these ladies and their families going back to generations. Your comments on community behaviour are rather appalling as well and we cannot assent to same. 

With regards to your feedback on hotel information, although our staff is well informed, we have taken this constructively and escalated to relevant department in order to minimise similar feedback. On transportation, we aim to offer transparent and competitive pricing for our car services. Your comments however, will be taken into account as we assess our offerings. 

Warm Regards 
Resident Manager 
Heritance Tea Factory
text:
1.여성에 대한 전반적 태도- 일반적 직원들은 괜찮으나 식민지 시대 매너와 여성에 대한 차별성으로 매니저급 직원은 양아치나 깡패 같음. 고압적으로 돈을 뜯어내는 구조라 짜증 유발

2. 호텔 프로그램 안내 부족- 남성이 가면 설명을 잘 하는지는 모르겠지만 설명을 안하고 모른다는 태도를 보임.  차에 대한 전문성도 부족하고 마사지 프로그램 데일리 프로그램 안내 없음

3. 차량서비스- 가장 비추하는 지점. 모든 호텔은 적절한 가격은 차량서비스를 제공하는데 콜롬보나 갈 등에서ㅜ겪지 못한 비매나와 높은 차량 서비스 가격제시하여 비싸다고 하자 뭐가 비싸냐고 대꾸하고 , 너는 호텔 투어 다니냐는 등의 비웃는 듯한 말투를 지속함

4. 스리랑카가 전반적으로 계급사회 분위기가 있는데 여기 호텔은 웬만한 곳을 가본 나로서는 비추/인도보다 못하고 차별적인 서비스를 스리랑카에서 처음 겪음

5. 누엘라가 전반적으로 식민지 시대처럼 차밭에서 일하는 사람을 착취하는 구조라서 백인이나 남성 위주로 정중하나 여자는 거의ㅜ개돼지 취급하는 분위기. 차밭에서 일하는 여지 임금이 정말 바닥이라 그렇게 대우함

Hotel is a unique place but food is really bad. The buffet dinner ended up being a la carte. They didn’t have enough people. Food I got was either too salty or too sweet. 
Breakfast menu is more like a lunch menu and again food quality is bad. Coffee sucked!!

roomTip: Don’t come here if it cost more than 50 dollars per night
text: I strongly do not recommend it. First of all, let's figure out what is a good and high-quality service for you in a hotel where a night costs as a living wage of a small local village? This is a sincere desire to surround you with comfort and coziness and also to satisfy any of your desires. In the Heritance Hotel, deceptively claiming the status of a grand hotel of the last century, only waiters and porters have this desire in the most rudimentary state.  The administrative staff, which has climbed to the top of the simple food chain of the hotel staff, lazily and brazenly does not want to do anything, or simply because of its narrow-mindedness is not able to. As my friend said: "uncompromising Sri Lankan suite" in this particular case will meet you with dull rooms without bathrobes and slippers, with a dirty bathroom and an empty minibar. To the owners of this disappointing establishment, I heartily recommend two things: to visit a normal hotel and drive the administrators away.
title: No

text: We went there about 2weeks back, Hotel is situated in an amazing place,surrounded by a large tea estate  with a breathtaking view ,Hotel staff was minimal but very friendly and supportive , specially Mr Norbert  Raj at restaurant,but the stay was not money worth purely because of the  food which was not up to the standard of star hotel compared to other hotels in the same range.They are giving a set menu where the varieties were minimal
title: Amazing Hotel, Amazing Staff But Food is not up to the standard of a star hotel

text:
We were really excited to be staying in a revamped tea factory. 

Upon arrival we were faced with a rude receptionist (this impoliteness persisted through the day). The rooms were not great, it could get very hot and stuffy in the day, with creaking floorboards announcing your every step. Food was lacking flavour whereby pepper and salt became my best friend during the trip. I briefly used the gym for a quick sesh, due to its intolerability. It had no AC, and the spa workers told me their fan was down, and at one point wanted to close the only door-the tiny, scrubby gym had-that allowed me some air.

Unfortunately we hardly took any pics cause it was not on for the books.

text:
Property is unique - it was converted from a tea factory. The lobby is well maintained and beautiful, but the rooms are a bit dated. Could do with a new makeover. The gym is small and had a musty smell.

Restaurant was good - very spacious and lots of food choices on the menu. Dishes were delicious and up to standard.

What let me down was the horrible service. Booking a room was difficult and the hotel did not reply to any emails despite more than 10 emails from me. I even asked my tour agent in Colombo to contact them but again was told they didn't reply. 

Would not recommend this hotel for the poor and unreliable service.

With regards to your review shared on TripAdvisor and our investigation in to the matter it was revealed that the hotel did their utmost during your stay to ensure that your experience at our unique theme hotel, Heritance Tea Factory, was a memorable one.

Kindly note that with regards to the music from the village kovil, we do hope you understand that this is beyond our control. As an Aitken Spence Hotel, Heritance Tea Factory  practice a sustainable living and community model where we encourage guests to enjoy the locality of the area the hotels are built on. While many of our guests enjoyed this music which went on till 7.30 p.m with light drumming continuing only till 9.00 p.m and picking up again approx. 7.30 a.m the next day, is its regrettable that your sentiments differed. 

We do also have on record your request for a 30% discount citing same along with a late checkout the next day. Our Assistant Resident Manager has, for this request, offered 15% discount with late checkout and an upgrade to the Executive Floor as a gesture of good will; which you have refused. 

We also note that the windows in your rooms were kept open during your stay; which the hotel staff including Front Office associates have advised to be kept closed due to the weather and also to prevent the sound from the area disturbing you as you have mentioned. Our rooms are well equipped with necessary fans and heating equipment for the comfort of our guests; and we do wish that the advise was heeded to, so that your holiday with us would have been more enjoyable. 

On day of departure as well, you have requested for late checkout which we have complied to as a gesture of good will, and have also waived off your extra charges. 

It is never our intention to provide any of our guests with a service or holiday that does not fully meet with or exceed expectations.  In fact, it is our intention to always offer the best possible service for every aspect of our guest’s holiday.  Feedback we receive is therefore of the utmost importance to us.

Whilst we feel it is important to note that Heritance Tea Factory is a popular choice amongst our customers, which generally achieves a high proportion of positive feedback, it is not to say that your concerns have been dismissed.  Indeed, we acknowledge that our customers are all different and that what may be perfectly agreeable to some guests, may not be at all in line with the requirements and expectations of others.  We have therefore made note of your constructive feedback on staff and will look in to same in future trainings and apologise for any inconveniences caused.

We do hope that this will not deter you from enjoying Aitken Spence hospitality at any of our other properties.

Yours Sincerely, Roshanlal Perera, General Manager, Heritance Tea Factory.
roomTip: DO not go there

bad management and customer service. 
one of the worst, overrated hotels I ever been to. on top of that comes the hotel  management  
( Priyan Suwathilake Hotel Front office manager  should be in the hospitality )

On the first day of the stay, around 5:30 pm Tamil celebratory music started playing very loudly from the kovil in the adjacent village. We didn’t mind at first but it was played loudly for hours till night and the music was back before dawn and played for 2 hours and interrupted hour sleep. Then, we called the reception asked about the loud music played and when is it going to stop, we were asked to wait for their response but was ignored. When we spoke to the manager he wasn’t sure when the music is going to stop and we were offered an executive room which felt like a downgrade from the room we already were in. And we book this room especially because of the 300°view and space. - Strange vibes and regimented feeling
- Fairly average food
- Nothing to do 
- Dated room decor

placeInfo/address: 21 Galle Face Centre Rd, Colombo 00100 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Itc Ratnadipa, A Luxury Collection Hotel, Colombo
roomTip: Avoid this hotel! There are many great hotels in close proximity to this location, some even have direct access to a Mall.
text:
The ITC Ratnadipa Colombo undoubtedly makes an impressive first impression, with its striking architecture and stunning nighttime lighting.

The suspended bridge bar offers good cocktails and wine, and the live entertainment was exceptional, but unfortunately, these were the only highlights of our stay.

From check-in, it became evident that form had been prioritized over function. Despite being a Marriott Bonvoy Lifetime Platinum Elite Member, there was no recognition or acknowledgment of status.

We had booked a Tower Suite with a sea-facing balcony, but it turned out to be a cramped studio-style room with poor design choices. The kidney-shaped layout made it awkwardly configured, with no full-length mirror, a large luggage room with a faulty light sensor, and a bathroom lacking basic amenities, including an insufficient supply of toilet paper. The spacious shower area had a misplaced shower head, causing water to leak into the bathroom.

The balcony was long but impractical, with an outward-opening door that, due to high winds, became difficult—if not impossible, to close. Though the view was excellent, the wind made spending time outside unbearable.

Service & Housekeeping Issues:
Housekeeping was unreliable, welcome fruits and canapés remained in the room for three days, rotting and covered in mold, despite repeated requests for removal.

Room service was appalling, more than half of the advertised menu was unavailable, and the limited options that were available were of subpar quality.

The 24-hour restaurant faced the same issue, many dishes were simply not available, and what was available did not meet expectations.

The TV inexplicably turned on at high volume at random hours of the night, requiring an engineer’s intervention on two of the three nights we stayed.

Location & Accessibility:
Unlike other luxury hotels in Colombo, ITC Ratnadipa has no attached shopping mall. Guests must walk along the main road and pass through multiple security checkpoints just to reach the Shangri-La’s mall next door, which is an inconvenience for a hotel of this category.

🤬A Frustrating Check-Out Experience:
After three nights of disappointing service and an overall lack of entertainment, we decided to check out early and move next door to the Shangri-La Hotel. However, this turned into an unnecessary ordeal.

Although the Marriott Bonvoy app listed no extended stay requirements, the hotel attempted to charge us for the full seven nights.

Despite notifying the reception the night before and receiving confirmation that our early departure would not be an issue, the check-out staff refused to acknowledge it.

The situation escalated when the receptionist became rude and aggressive, dismissing our confirmed reservation terms and insisting that ITC Ratnadipa had separate, unadvertised policies.

After a series of frustrating calls to the Marriott Bonvoy Help Desk, they confirmed that the hotel was in the wrong and escalated the issue. Eventually, an assistant manager intervened, resolving the matter after nearly three hours of unnecessary back-and-forth.

☝️Final Verdict:
While the ITC Ratnadipa Colombo looks spectacular from the outside, the poorly designed rooms, inconsistent service, lack of essential amenities, and unprofessional check-out process made this one of the most disappointing luxury hotel experiences we’ve had. After moving to the Shangri-La next door, we finally received the level of service and comfort we had expected in the first place.

✌️For those considering a stay here, I would strongly recommend exploring other five-star options in Colombo
title: Disappointing Stay at ITC Ratnadipa Colombo – Style Over Substance

placeInfo/name: Itc Ratnadipa, A Luxury Collection Hotel, Colombo
text:
Our current stay at ITC Ratnadipa Colombo is tainted by deceptive room allocation practices, inconsistent service, and an overall lack of respect for customer loyalty. As Marriott Platinum members, we expected a smooth check-in process and fair treatment, but what we experienced was the opposite.

Deceptive Room Allocation

Upon arrival Sunday night, we were assigned an ITC One City View room despite having booked a waterfront room. The hotel misleadingly claimed this was an "upgrade" and justified the switch by stating that a "waterbody" within the complex technically qualifies as a waterfront view—a blatantly deceptive tactic. The expectation when booking a waterfront room is a clear view of the Indian Ocean, not an artificial water feature facing the city. This approach suggests the hotel arbitrarily assigns rooms while misleading customers about what they are actually getting.

When we insisted on the Indian Ocean view room we originally booked, we were told that ocean-facing rooms are all suites and that they could not upgrade us to one. This refusal seemed arbitrary, especially considering our loyalty status with Marriott. We ultimately declined the so-called "upgrade" and accepted the room we had booked—one with an Indian Ocean and pool view.

Manipulative Upgrade Process

To make matters worse, next day after dining at their fine dining restaurant Avartana, we received a call from reception offering an upgrade to an oceanfront suite—the same upgrade that was denied at check-in, a night before. This sudden reversal was deeply frustrating, as it implied that the hotel deliberately withheld an upgrade that was available all along. It raises serious concerns about preferential treatment and whether upgrades are being handed out based on who attends their complimentary cocktail hour versus who chooses to spend money at their paid dining venues.

This behavior suggests a transactional and discriminatory approach to customer service rather than a genuine commitment to hospitality. If the upgrade was available, why wasn’t it offered at check-in? It leaves the impression that they prioritize certain guests over others based on arbitrary factors, rather than honoring loyalty and fair policies.

Final Thoughts

While the property itself may have luxurious facilities, the dishonest room allocation, unreliable upgrade process, and favoritism in guest treatment made for a disappointing experience. It left a negative impression of the ITC brand, one that suggests they are willing to mislead customers and manipulate upgrades rather than fostering genuine goodwill.

Would we return? Unlikely. Trust is key in luxury hospitality, and ITC Ratnadipa Colombo fell short.
title: Deceptive Room Allocation & Unreliable Service – Disappointing Stay

text:
Although this is a very fancy hotel with plenty of fine touches to encourage a traveller to stay there, the fact that they couldn't get my name right, despite being repeatedly told, means I cannot rate them highly.  

The confusion started on check in where the lady asked for my travelling companion's (my sister) email address.  From then on, they presumed that she was the lead traveller, despite the booking being in my name and they already had all my details as a Bonvoy gold member.  So her name appeared on the tv screen and on the room iPad.  When I brought this to the attention of Reception, they blamed it on an IT glitch and advised that it would be changed.  It wasn't.  Another hotel employee also approached me at breakfast on the second day and assured me it had been rectified.  It still wasn't.

On checkout, I brought it to their attention again and they assured me everything was fixed.  Except it wasn't and my sister has received two emails since we left.

All this hotel had to do was check my Bonvoy account to see my correct email address.

So if a hotel cannot get your name right, then all the other fancy touches are just window dressing.

Bottom line is I won't be staying here again and can't recommend it to others.
title: Disappointing experience

We booked a dinner buffet for 12 of our family and as we arrived early (my wife and 2 children) we decided to go to the 29th floor to get a view of Colombo and have a soft drink before dinner. I approached the bar and was told that as I was wearing shorts I wasn't allowed and told to leave rudely before I had a chance to explain. I didn't see any mention of a dress code prior to or entering the 29th floor. I appreciate you have dress codes but these were smart shorts and bearing in mind the weather in Sri Lanka seems a bit silly. Prior to booking we requested one table for all 12 of us and space for a wheelchair for my father, when we arrived this wasn't ready and we explained that this was requested over a week ago. The staff were polite and helpful in this area and put this right.
The buffet was ok nothing like it had been hyped up by what I had read prior 
to going. There was no soya ice cream and only one non dairy dessert option. If this is a 5 star offering it was average. There are multiple other better choices for food and drink in Colombo so I would choose one of them in future every time.
title: Overrated, unfriendly staff

placeInfo/address: 21 Galle Face Centre Rd, Colombo 00100 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Itc Ratnadipa, A Luxury Collection Hotel, Colombo
text: Plenty of teething issues. I should've known something was out of sorts when the check-in staff welcomed me as a Bonvoy Member when my booking was done via Club ITC. On pointing out the same, they were confused as to how this happened. It's an impressive property, newly opened, on the Colombo sea front, bang next to Shangrila & OGF Mall. Just that no one knows what's happening, from the Front Office Staff to the restaurant staff and Duty Manager. Having checked in at around 245 pm, we went to the 'all day diner' only to be told they shut shop at 3pm. When I mentioned this to someone later, they apologised for the 'miscommunication'. Ahasa, the lounge bar on the 29th level is very good, again the service is a tad slow. They stress on prior reservations despite empty tables. Silver Tips, the cocktail bar at Lobby Level is a huge disappointment. Planned to have something light at Avartana, their fine dining restaurant but the bare minimum was a 7 course set menu. Great ambience, though. Finally ordered room service, only to be told that since the front office hadn't done a pre-authorization on check-in, as I wasn't entitled for signing any bills to be paid on checkout. Only cash. This is despite paying the room tariff in full. Took me about a dozen calls including two to Duty Manager Kevin who finally got things sorted out. Note - The elevators have a mind of their own, especially level 26. Keep jumping up & down and suddenly stop at any floor. The hotel staff accepted that this was an ongoing issue, unresolved till date. Spotted the huge resident cockroach in the wash room on the day of checkout, didn't bother to inform anyone as we were just leaving. Till the management doesn't hammer out these issues and the staff don't get trained properly, I wouldn't bother visiting this place again. Having said that, it looks great
title: Avoidable for now

placeInfo/address: 21 Galle Face Centre Rd, Colombo 00100 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Itc Ratnadipa, A Luxury Collection Hotel, Colombo
text:
We made a reservation at Ahasa on 9 May 2024. The reservation process was tedious with calls being unanswered - voice mail box being full - transferred from one desk to another. It was chaotic to say the least.

We were there at 5PM and these are few observations:
- There are too many staff giving orders to others but only one or two to actually get the job done
- The waiter/server looked uninterested and tired. When we asked him about what cocktails he would recommend - he just said there are 10 on the menu (we asked him twice thinking he misunderstood the question). We ended up skipping the cocktails. 
- The food was ok, but nothing to write home about. 
- The attitude of staff was of wanting and showed that there is lack of training. In the hospitality sector - service is king. Unfortunately, it was very basic and very poor at ITC.
- The POS machine had no connection but the server/waiter said that the cards (my friend gave two cards to try) is not working. Anyway, after I paid in cash, he came back and said Rs 5000 is short. I gave him the proper amount but he maintained it wasn't the case and luckily I saw a note on the floor and directed him to that. He didn't apologise - nothing. It was appalling. 

Unfortunately, the experience for the three of us was terrible. There are plenty of other options in Colombo  and when the hype dies down, ITC will struggle to retain the customers if they dont invest in training their staff.

The only people we found being nice and cordial are - the young lady manning the washrooms just outside Ahasa and the Doorman at the entrance.
title: Poor service

"We had hoped to book this hotel for Mother's Day, but we struggled to reach the reservation desk for nearly two hours. Finally, when we managed to get through, the reservation agent informed us that they didn't offer high tea, which was disappointing. When we requested the lunch buffet, we were informed that the restaurant was fully booked.

 

In an attempt to salvage the occasion, we drove to the hotel and tried to go to the bar for cocktails. However, we were stopped by security and informed that the hotel was at full capacity. This experience marked the first time in 30 years as guests that we were turned away due to the hotel being full. For the sake of constructive feedback, it's evident that many staff members lack professionalism and require additional training. Our first impression is very poor."
title: First impression is very poor

text: Staff at the dining hall lack attention, even with reduced capacity, neglecting walk-ins noticeably. The transition from attentive Indian staff during launch is evident. The hotel, still under construction, emits odors and dust reminiscent of a tool shed. The absence of a lobby or reception creates a traveler's hotel atmosphere despite aspirations of luxury, except for the exceptional deck view in the transit lounge. Human touch is crucial for attracting the desired demographic. The preference is to book Shangri-La for consistency and service quality.
title: Inattentive, pretensive sense of luxury based on an unknown brand to Sri Lanka. Staff training in vain & unsupervised.

Was coming for a reservation at Indian ocean restaurant. We came early to have some cocktails before the restaurant. From the first moment we entered into the hotel. They were very unwelcoming and had the feeling they do profile screening of their guest.

text:
My recent experience at ITC was unfortunately marred by misleading information provided by the staff. When we initially placed our order, the waiter confirmed that we could "bank" our bottle (presumably referring to saving an unfinished bottle of alcohol for a future visit). However, when settling the bill, we were informed that this was not possible.

In addition to this confusion, we encountered other issues such as poor customer service, having to repeatedly request basic amenities like mixes topping up, and receiving unpolished cutlery with water marks. 

Despite these shortcomings, the menu showed promise. However, the overall execution and service fell short of expectations. This is not the first time we visited ITC. Very poor customer service!

Ample staff present. The bar had only 3-4 occupied tables during our visit, yet the service was surprisingly lackluster.
title: Disappointing Service
